FSIO.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /******************************************************************************
2 *
3 * Microchip Memory Disk Drive File System
4 *
5 ******************************************************************************
6 * FileName: FSIO.c
7 * Dependencies: GenericTypeDefs.h
8 * FSIO.h
9 * Physical interface include file (SD-SPI.h, CF-PMP.h, ...)
10 * string.h
11 * stdlib.h
12 * FSDefs.h
13 * ctype.h
14 * salloc.h
15 * Processor: PIC18/PIC24/dsPIC30/dsPIC33/PIC32
16 * Compiler: C18/C30/C32
17 * Company: Microchip Technology, Inc.
18 *
19 * Software License Agreement
20 *
21 * The software supplied herewith by Microchip Technology Incorporated
22 * (the �Company�) for its PICmicro� Microcontroller is intended and
23 * supplied to you, the Company�s customer, for use solely and
24 * exclusively on Microchip PICmicro Microcontroller products. The
25 * software is owned by the Company and/or its supplier, and is
26 * protected under applicable copyright laws. All rights are reserved.
27 * Any use in violation of the foregoing restrictions may subject the
28 * user to criminal sanctions under applicable laws, as well as to
29 * civil liability for the breach of the terms and conditions of this
30 * license.
31 *
32 * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED IN AN �AS IS� CONDITION. NO WARRANTIES,
33 * WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED
34 * TO, IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A
35 * PARTICULAR PURPOSE APPLY TO THIS SOFTWARE. THE COMPANY SHALL NOT,
36 * IN ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR
37 * CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, FOR ANY REASON WHATSOEVER.
38 *
39 ********************************************************************
40  File Description:
41 
42  Change History:
43  Rev Description
44  ----- -----------
45  1.2.5 Fixed bug that prevented writes to alternate FAT tables
46  Fixed bug that prevented FAT being updated when media is re-inserted
47 
48  1.2.6 Fixed bug that resulted in a bus error when attempts to read a invalid memory region
49  Fixed bug that prevented the Windows Explorer to show the Date Creation field for directories
50 
51  x.x.x Fixed issue on some USB drives where the information written
52  to the drive is cached in a RAM for 500ms before it is
53  written to the flash unless the sector is accessed again.
54  Add some error recovery for FAT32 systems when there is
55  corruption in the boot sector.
56 
57  1.3.0 Modified to support Long File Name(LFN) format
58  1.3.4 1) Initialized some of the local variables to default values
59  to remove non-critical compiler warnings for code sanitation.
60  2) The sector size of the media device is obtained from the MBR of media.So,
61  instead of using the hard coded macro "DIRENTRIES_PER_SECTOR", the variables
62  "dirEntriesPerSector" & "disk->sectorSize" are used in the code. Refer
63  "Cache_File_Entry","EraseCluster" & "writeDotEntries" fucntions to see
64  the change.
65  1.3.6 1) The function "FILEget_next_cluster" is made public.
66  2) Modified "FILEfind" function such that when using 8.3 format
67  the file searches are not considered as case sensitive.
68  3) In function 'CacheTime', the variables 'ptr1' & 'ptr0' are not used
69  when compiled for PIC32. So there definitions were removed for PIC32.
70  4) Modified "rmdirhelper", "FormatDirName" & "writeDotEntries" functions
71  to remove non-critical warnings during compilation.
72  5) Updated comments in most of the function header blocks.
73  1.4.0 1) While creating files in LFN format with file name length as 13,26,39,52...etc(multiples of 13),
74  MDD library was creating incorrect directory entries. To fix this issue,
75  functions "FILEfind", "CreateFileEntry", "Alias_LFN_Object", "FormatFileName",
76  "FormatDirName", "FSgetcwd", "GetPreviousEntry" & "rmdirhelper" were modified.
77  Now "utf16LFNlength" variable part of "FSFILE" structure, indicates LFN length
78  excluding the NULL word at the last.
79  2) When creating large number of files in LFN format, some files were not getting created in disk.
80  To fix this issue,function "FILEfind" was modified.
81  3) Modified "FSformat" function to initialize "disk->sectorSize" to default value.
82  4) Modified "CreateFileEntry" & "FindEmptyEntries" functions to remove unnecessary
83  assignments & optimize the code.
84  5) Modified "FSfopen" function to prevent creating an empty file in the directory, when SD card
85  is write protected.
86  6) Variable "entry" in "writeDotEntries" function is made volatile & properly typecasted
87  in it's usage.
88  7) Modified "FSFopen" function so that when you try to open a file that doesn't exist on the disk,
89  variable "FSerrno" is assigned to CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND.
90  1.4.2 1) Minor Modification in "CreateFileEntry" function to fix a bug for file name lengths of
91  26,39....characters (multiples of 13)
92  2) Fixed the LoadMBR() function to scan all of the MBR entries and return success on the first
93  supported drive or fail after the 4 table entries.
94  1.4.4 1) Cleared the "read" flag and set the file pointer to NULL in FSfclose() function to prevent the
95  unintentional acess to a closed file.
96  2) Modified "FSfopen()" function so that in "ReadPlus(r+)" mode the FAT table is read from media
97  & the latest FAT contents are present in cache of RAM.
98  3) Modified "FILEget_next_cluster" function so that: if the last two clusters of the data region
99  are allocated to a file,then that file can be traversed using "FILEget_next_cluster" function.
100 ********************************************************************/
101

147  BYTE gFileSlotOpen[FS_MAX_FILES_OPEN]; // Array that indicates which elements of gFileArray are available for use
148  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
149  // Array that stores long file name (static allocation)

164 #if defined(USEREALTIMECLOCK) || defined(USERDEFINEDCLOCK)
165 // Timing variables
166 BYTE gTimeCrtMS; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate create time (milliseconds)
167 WORD gTimeCrtTime; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate create time
168 WORD gTimeCrtDate; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate create date
169 WORD gTimeAccDate; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate last access date
170 WORD gTimeWrtTime; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate last update time
171 WORD gTimeWrtDate; // Global time variable (for timestamps) used to indicate last update date
172 #endif
173 
174 DWORD gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF; // Global variable indicating which FAT sector was read last
175 BYTE gNeedFATWrite = FALSE; // Global variable indicating that there is information that needs to be written to the FAT
176 FSFILE * gBufferOwner = NULL; // Global variable indicating which file is using the data buffer
177 DWORD gLastDataSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF; // Global variable indicating which data sector was read last
178 BYTE gNeedDataWrite = FALSE; // Global variable indicating that there is information that needs to be written to the data section
179 BYTE nextClusterIsLast = FALSE; // Global variable indicating that the entries in a directory align with a cluster boundary
180 
181 BYTE gBufferZeroed = FALSE; // Global variable indicating that the data buffer contains all zeros
182 
183 DWORD FatRootDirClusterValue; // Global variable containing the cluster number of the root dir (0 for FAT12/16)
184 
185 BYTE FSerrno; // Global error variable. Set to one of many error codes after each function call.
186 
187 DWORD TempClusterCalc; // Global variable used to store the calculated value of the cluster of a specified sector.
188 BYTE dirCleared; // Global variable used by the "recursive" FSrmdir function to indicate that all subdirectories and files have been deleted from the target directory.
189 BYTE recache = FALSE; // Global variable used by the "recursive" FSrmdir function to indicate that additional cache reads are needed.
190 FSFILE tempCWDobj; // Global variable used to preserve the current working directory information.
191 FSFILE gFileTemp; // Global variable used for file operations.

193 FSFILE cwd; // Global current working directory
194 FSFILE * cwdptr = &cwd; // Pointer to the current working directory

207 #endif

223 // Directory entry structure
224 typedef struct
225 {
226  char DIR_Name[DIR_NAMESIZE]; // File name
227  char DIR_Extension[DIR_EXTENSION]; // File extension
228  BYTE DIR_Attr; // File attributes
229  BYTE DIR_NTRes; // Reserved byte
230  BYTE DIR_CrtTimeTenth; // Create time (millisecond field)
231  WORD DIR_CrtTime; // Create time (second, minute, hour field)
232  WORD DIR_CrtDate; // Create date
233  WORD DIR_LstAccDate; // Last access date
234  WORD DIR_FstClusHI; // High word of the entry's first cluster number
235  WORD DIR_WrtTime; // Last update time
236  WORD DIR_WrtDate; // Last update date
237  WORD DIR_FstClusLO; // Low word of the entry's first cluster number
238  DWORD DIR_FileSize; // The 32-bit file size
239 }_DIRENTRY;
240 
241 typedef _DIRENTRY * DIRENTRY; // A pointer to a directory entry structure
242 
243 #define DIRECTORY 0x12 // Value indicating that the CreateFileEntry function will be creating a directory
244 
245 #define DIRENTRIES_PER_SECTOR (MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE / 32) // The number of directory entries in a sector
246 
247 // Maximum number of UTF16 words in single Root directory entry
248 #define MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY (BYTE)13
249 
250 // Long File Name Entry
251 typedef struct
252 {
253  BYTE LFN_SequenceNo; // Sequence number,
254  BYTE LFN_Part1[10]; // File name part 1
255  BYTE LFN_Attribute; // File attribute
256  BYTE LFN_Type; // LFN Type
257  BYTE LFN_Checksum; // Checksum
258  unsigned short int LFN_Part2[6]; // File name part 2
259  unsigned short int LFN_Reserved2; // Reserved for future use
260  unsigned short int LFN_Part3[2]; // File name part 3
261 }LFN_ENTRY;
262 
263 /* Summary: Possible type of file or directory name.
264 ** Description: See the FormatFileName() & FormatDirName() function for more information.
265 */
266 typedef enum
267 {
268  NAME_8P3_ASCII_CAPS_TYPE,
269  NAME_8P3_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE,
270  NAME_8P3_UTF16_TYPE, // SUBTYPES OF 8P3 UTF16 TYPE
271  NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_CAPS_TYPE,
272  NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE,
273  NAME_8P3_UTF16_NONASCII_TYPE,
274  NAME_LFN_TYPE,
275  NAME_ERROR
276 } FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE;
277 
278 // internal errors
279 #define CE_FAT_EOF 60 // Error that indicates an attempt to read FAT entries beyond the end of the file
280 #define CE_EOF 61 // Error that indicates that the end of the file has been reached
281 
282 typedef FSFILE * FILEOBJ; // Pointer to an FSFILE object

286 #define _FLAG_MINUS 0x1 // FSfprintf minus flag indicator
287 #define _FLAG_PLUS 0x2 // FSfprintf plus flag indicator
288 #define _FLAG_SPACE 0x4 // FSfprintf space flag indicator
289 #define _FLAG_OCTO 0x8 // FSfprintf octothorpe (hash mark) flag indicator
290 #define _FLAG_ZERO 0x10 // FSfprintf zero flag indicator
291 #define _FLAG_SIGNED 0x80 // FSfprintf signed flag indicator
292 
293 #ifdef __18CXX
294  #define _FMT_UNSPECIFIED 0 // FSfprintf unspecified argument size flag
295  #define _FMT_LONG 1 // FSfprintf 32-bit argument size flag
296  #define _FMT_SHRTLONG 2 // FSfprintf 24-bit argument size flag
297  #define _FMT_BYTE 3 // FSfprintf 8-bit argument size flag
298 #else
299  #define _FMT_UNSPECIFIED 0 // FSfprintf unspecified argument size flag
300  #define _FMT_LONGLONG 1 // FSfprintf 64-bit argument size flag
301  #define _FMT_LONG 2 // FSfprintf 32-bit argument size flag
302  #define _FMT_BYTE 3 // FSfprintf 8-bit argument size flag
303 #endif

398 
399 /*************************************************************************
400  Function:
401  int FSInit(void)
402  Summary:
403  Function to initialize the device.
404  Conditions:
405  The physical device should be connected to the microcontroller.
406  Input:
407  None
408  Return Values:
409  TRUE - Initialization successful
410  FALSE - Initialization unsuccessful
411  Side Effects:
412  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
413  Description:
414  This function initializes the file system stack & the interfacing device.
415  Initializes the static or dynamic memory slots for holding file
416  structures. Initializes the device with the DISKmount function. Loads
417  MBR and boot sector information. Initializes the current working
418  directory to the root directory for the device if directory support
419  is enabled.
420  Remarks:
421  None
422  *************************************************************************/
423 
424 int FSInit(void)
425 {
426  int fIndex;
427 #ifndef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
428  for( fIndex = 0; fIndex < FS_MAX_FILES_OPEN; fIndex++ )
429  gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] = TRUE;
430 #else
431  #ifdef __18CXX
432  SRAMInitHeap();
433  #endif
434 #endif
435 
436  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
437  gNeedFATWrite = FALSE;
438  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
439  gLastDataSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
440 
441  MDD_InitIO();
442 
443  if(DISKmount(&gDiskData) == CE_GOOD)
444  {
445  // Initialize the current working directory to the root
446 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
447  cwdptr->dsk = &gDiskData;
448  cwdptr->sec = 0;
449  cwdptr->pos = 0;
450  cwdptr->seek = 0;
451  cwdptr->size = 0;
452  cwdptr->name[0] = '\\';
453  for (fIndex = 1; fIndex < 11; fIndex++)
454  {
455  cwdptr->name[fIndex] = 0x20;
456  }
457  cwdptr->entry = 0;
458  cwdptr->attributes = ATTR_DIRECTORY;
459  // "FatRootDirClusterValue" indicates the root
460  cwdptr->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
461  cwdptr->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
462  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
463  // Initialize default values for LFN support
464  cwdptr->AsciiEncodingType = TRUE;
465  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = 0x0000;
466  #endif
467 #endif
468 
469  FSerrno = 0;
470  return TRUE;
471  }
472 
473  return FALSE;
474 }
475 
476 
477 /********************************************************************************
478  Function:
479  CETYPE FILEfind (FILEOBJ foDest, FILEOBJ foCompareTo, BYTE cmd, BYTE mode)
480  Summary
481  Finds a file on the device
482  Conditions:
483  This function should not be called by the user.
484  Input:
485  foDest - FSFILE object containing information of the file found
486  foCompareTo - FSFILE object containing the name/attr of the file to be
487  found
488  cmd -
489  - LOOK_FOR_EMPTY_ENTRY: Search for empty entry.
490  - LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY: Search for matching entry.
491  mode -
492  - 0: Match file exactly with default attributes.
493  - 1: Match file to user-specified attributes.
494  Return Values:
495  CE_GOOD - File found.
496  CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND - File not found.
497  Side Effects:
498  None.
499  Description:
500  The FILEfind function will sequentially cache directory entries within
501  the current working directory into the foDest FSFILE object. If the cmd
502  parameter is specified as LOOK_FOR_EMPTY_ENTRY the search will continue
503  until an empty directory entry is found. If the cmd parameter is specified
504  as LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY these entries will be compared to the foCompareTo
505  object until a match is found or there are no more entries in the current
506  working directory. If the mode is specified a '0' the attributes of the FSFILE
507  entries are irrelevant. If the mode is specified as '1' the attributes of the
508  foDest entry must match the attributes specified in the foCompareTo file and
509  partial string search characters may bypass portions of the comparison.
510  Remarks:
511  None
512  ********************************************************************************/
513 
514 CETYPE FILEfind( FILEOBJ foDest, FILEOBJ foCompareTo, BYTE cmd, BYTE mode)
515 {
516  WORD attrib, compareAttrib;
517  WORD fHandle = foDest->entry; // current entry counter
518  CETYPE statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
519  BYTE character,test,state,index;
520 
521  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
522 
523  LFN_ENTRY lfnObject; // Long File Name Object
524  unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)&fileFoundString[0];
525  unsigned short int *templfnPtr = (unsigned short int *)foCompareTo -> utf16LFNptr;
526  UINT16_VAL tempShift;
527  short int fileCompareLfnIndex,fileFoundLfnIndex = 0,fileFoundMaxLfnIndex = 0,lfnCountIndex,fileFoundLength = 0;
528  BOOL lfnFirstCheck = FALSE,foundSFN,foundLFN,fileFoundDotPosition = FALSE,fileCompareDotPosition;
529  BYTE lfnCompareMaxSequenceNum = 0,lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum,reminder = 0;
530  char tempDst[13];
531  fileNameLength = foCompareTo->utf16LFNlength;
532 
533  // If 'fileNameLength' is non zero then it means that file name is of LFN format.
534  // If 'fileNameLength' is zero then it means that file name is of 8.3 format
535  if(fileNameLength)
536  {
537  // Find out the number of root entries for the given LFN
538  reminder = fileNameLength % MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
539 
540  index = fileNameLength/MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
541 
542  if(reminder || (fileNameLength < MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY))
543  {
544  index++;
545  }
546 
547  // The maximum sequence number of the LFN
548  lfnCompareMaxSequenceNum = index;
549  }
550  #endif
551 
552  // reset the cluster
553  foDest->dirccls = foDest->dirclus;
554  // Attribute to be compared as per application layer request
555  compareAttrib = 0xFFFF ^ foCompareTo->attributes;
556 
557  if (fHandle == 0)
558  {
559  if (Cache_File_Entry(foDest, &fHandle, TRUE) == NULL)
560  {
561  statusB = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
562  }
563  }
564  else
565  {
566  // Maximum 16 entries possible
567  if ((fHandle & MASK_MAX_FILE_ENTRY_LIMIT_BITS) != 0)
568  {
569  if (Cache_File_Entry (foDest, &fHandle, TRUE) == NULL)
570  {
571  statusB = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
572  }
573  }
574  }
575 
576  if (statusB != CE_BADCACHEREAD)
577  {
578  // Loop until you reach the end or find the file
579  while(1)
580  {
581  if(statusB != CE_GOOD) //First time entry always here
582  {
583  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
584  foundSFN = FALSE;
585  foundLFN = FALSE;
586 
587  state = Fill_LFN_Object(foDest,&lfnObject,&fHandle);
588  #else
589  state = Fill_File_Object(foDest, &fHandle);
590  #endif
591 
592  if(state == NO_MORE) // Reached the end of available files. Comparision over and file not found so quit.
593  {
594  break;
595  }
596  }
597  else // statusB == CE_GOOD then exit
598  {
599  break; // Code below intializes"statusB = CE_GOOD;" so, if no problem in the filled file, Exit the while loop.
600  }
601 
602  if(state == FOUND) // Validate the correct matching of filled file data with the required(to be found) one.
603  {
604  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
605 
606  if(lfnObject.LFN_Attribute != ATTR_LONG_NAME)
607  {
608  lfnFirstCheck = FALSE;
609 
610  *dst = lfnObject.LFN_SequenceNo;
611  for(index = 0;index < 10;index++)
612  dst[index + 1] = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[index];
613  foundSFN = TRUE;
614  }
615  else
616  {
617  if(lfnObject.LFN_SequenceNo & 0x40)
618  {
619  lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum = lfnObject.LFN_SequenceNo & 0x1F;
620 
621  if((mode == 0x00) && ((fileNameLength && (lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum != lfnCompareMaxSequenceNum)) ||
622  (!fileNameLength && (lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum != 0x01))))
623  {
624 // fHandle = fHandle + lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum + 1;
625  fHandle++;
626  continue;
627  }
628 
629  fileFoundLfnIndex = (lfnObject.LFN_SequenceNo & 0xBF) * MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY - 1;
630  fileCompareLfnIndex = fileFoundLfnIndex;
631 
632  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part3[1];
633  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part3[0];
634 
635  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[5];
636  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[4];
637  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[3];
638  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[2];
639  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[1];
640  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[0];
641 
642  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[8];
643  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[9];
644  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
645  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[6];
646  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[7];
647  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
648  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[4];
649  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[5];
650  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
651  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[2];
652  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[3];
653  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
654  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[0];
655  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[1];
656  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
657 
658 
659  fileFoundLength = fileCompareLfnIndex + 1;
660  for(index = 1;index <= MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;index++)
661  {
662  if(fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex + index] == 0x0000)
663  fileFoundLength = fileFoundLfnIndex + index;
664  }
665 
666  if(mode == 0x00)
667  {
668  if((fileNameLength != fileFoundLength) && fileNameLength)
669  {
670 // fHandle = fHandle + lfnFoundMaxSequenceNum + 1;
671  fHandle++;
672  continue;
673  }
674  }
675 
676  fileFoundMaxLfnIndex = fileFoundLength - 1;
677  lfnFirstCheck = TRUE;
678  }
679  else if(lfnFirstCheck == TRUE)
680  {
681  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part3[1];
682  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part3[0];
683 
684  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[5];
685  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[4];
686  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[3];
687  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[2];
688  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[1];
689  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = lfnObject.LFN_Part2[0];
690 
691  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[8];
692  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[9];
693  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
694  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[6];
695  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[7];
696  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
697  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[4];
698  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[5];
699  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
700  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[2];
701  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[3];
702  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
703  tempShift.byte.LB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[0];
704  tempShift.byte.HB = lfnObject.LFN_Part1[1];
705  fileFoundString[fileFoundLfnIndex--] = tempShift.Val;
706  }
707  else
708  {
709  fHandle++;
710  continue;
711  }
712 
713  if(fileFoundLfnIndex > 0)
714  {
715  fHandle++;
716  continue;
717  }
718 
719  foundLFN = TRUE;
720  }
721 
722  lfnFirstCheck = FALSE;
723  statusB = CE_GOOD;
724  switch (mode)
725  {
726  case 0:
727 
728  // Copy the contents of any SFN found to temporary string
729  // for future comparision tests
730  for(index = 0;index < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3;index++)
731  tempDst[index] = dst[index];
732 
733  // Try to deduce the original name from the found SFN
734  if(dst[8] != ' ')
735  {
736  for(index = 0;index < 8;index++)
737  {
738  if(dst[index] == ' ')
739  break;
740  }
741  tempDst[index++] = '.';
742  tempDst[index++] = dst[8];
743 
744  if(dst[9] != ' ')
745  tempDst[index++] = dst[9];
746  else
747  tempDst[index++] = 0x00;
748 
749  if(dst[10] != ' ')
750  tempDst[index++] = dst[10];
751  else
752  tempDst[index++] = 0x00;
753  }
754  else
755  {
756  for(index = 0;index < 8;index++)
757  {
758  if(tempDst[index] == ' ')
759  break;
760  }
761  }
762 
763  // Terminate the string using the NULL value
764  tempDst[index] = 0x00;
765 
766  if(fileNameLength)
767  {
768  if(foundLFN)
769  {
770  // see if we are a volume id or hidden, ignore
771  // search for one. if status = TRUE we found one
772  for(fileCompareLfnIndex = 0;fileCompareLfnIndex < fileNameLength;fileCompareLfnIndex++)
773  {
774  if(foCompareTo -> AsciiEncodingType)
775  {
776  // get the source character
777  character = (BYTE)templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex];
778  // get the destination character
779  test = (BYTE)fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex];
780  if((fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex] > 0xFF) || (tolower(character) != tolower(test)))
781  {
782  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
783  break;
784  }
785  }
786  else
787  {
788  if(templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] != fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex])
789  {
790  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
791  break;
792  }
793  }
794  }// for loop
795  }
796  else if(foundSFN && foCompareTo -> AsciiEncodingType)
797  {
798  if(strlen(tempDst) != fileNameLength)
799  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
800  else
801  {
802  for(fileCompareLfnIndex = 0;fileCompareLfnIndex < fileNameLength;fileCompareLfnIndex++)
803  {
804  // get the source character
805  character = (BYTE)templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex];
806  // get the destination character
807  test = tempDst[fileCompareLfnIndex];
808  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
809  {
810  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
811  break;
812  }
813  }// for loop
814  }
815  }
816  else
817  {
818  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
819  }
820  }
821  else
822  {
823  if(foundLFN)
824  {
825  if(strlen(tempDst) != fileFoundLength)
826  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
827  else
828  {
829  for(fileCompareLfnIndex = 0;fileCompareLfnIndex < fileFoundLength;fileCompareLfnIndex++)
830  {
831  // get the source character
832  character = (BYTE)fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex];
833  // get the destination character
834  test = tempDst[fileCompareLfnIndex];
835  if((fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex] > 0xFF) || (tolower(character) != tolower(test)))
836  {
837  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
838  break;
839  }
840  }// for loop
841  }
842  }
843  else
844  {
845  // search for one. if status = TRUE we found one
846  for(index = 0; index < DIR_NAMECOMP; index++)
847  {
848  // get the source character
849  character = dst[index];
850  // get the destination character
851  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
852  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
853  {
854  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
855  break;
856  }
857  }// for loop
858  }
859  }
860  break;
861 
862  case 1:
863  if(fileNameLength)
864  {
865  fileFoundDotPosition = FALSE;
866  if(foundLFN)
867  {
868  lfnCountIndex = fileFoundMaxLfnIndex;
869  while(lfnCountIndex > 0)
870  {
871  if(fileFoundString[lfnCountIndex] == '.')
872  {
873  fileFoundDotPosition = TRUE;
874  lfnCountIndex--;
875  break;
876  }
877  lfnCountIndex--;
878  }
879 
880  if(fileFoundDotPosition == FALSE)
881  lfnCountIndex = fileFoundMaxLfnIndex;
882  }
883  else
884  {
885  if(dst[DIR_NAMESIZE] != ' ')
886  fileFoundDotPosition = TRUE;
887  lfnCountIndex = DIR_NAMESIZE - 1;
888  }
889 
890  fileFoundLfnIndex = fileNameLength - 1;
891  fileCompareDotPosition = FALSE;
892  while(fileFoundLfnIndex > 0)
893  {
894  if(templfnPtr[fileFoundLfnIndex] == '.')
895  {
896  fileCompareDotPosition = TRUE;
897  fileFoundLfnIndex--;
898  break;
899  }
900  fileFoundLfnIndex--;
901  }
902  if(fileCompareDotPosition == FALSE)
903  fileFoundLfnIndex = fileNameLength - 1;
904 
905  // Check for attribute match
906  for(fileCompareLfnIndex = 0;;)
907  {
908  if (templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] == '*')
909  break;
910 
911  if(fileCompareLfnIndex > lfnCountIndex)
912  {
913  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
914  break;
915  }
916 
917  if (templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] != '?')
918  {
919  if(foCompareTo -> AsciiEncodingType)
920  {
921  // get the source character
922  character = (BYTE)templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex];
923  // get the destination character
924  if(foundLFN)
925  test = (BYTE)fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex];
926  else
927  test = dst[fileCompareLfnIndex];
928 
929  if((foundLFN && (fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex] > 0xFF)) ||
930  (tolower(character) != tolower(test)))
931  {
932  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
933  break;
934  }
935  }
936  else
937  {
938  if((templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] != fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex]) || foundSFN)
939  {
940  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
941  break;
942  }
943  }
944  }
945 
946  fileCompareLfnIndex++;
947  if(fileCompareLfnIndex > fileFoundLfnIndex)
948  {
949  if(fileCompareLfnIndex <= lfnCountIndex)
950  {
951  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
952  }
953  break;
954  }
955  }// for loop
956 
957  if(fileCompareDotPosition == FALSE)
958  {
959  if(fileFoundDotPosition == TRUE)
960  {
961  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
962  }
963  break;
964  }
965  else
966  {
967  if(fileFoundDotPosition == FALSE)
968  {
969  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
970  break;
971  }
972 
973  if(foundLFN)
974  lfnCountIndex = lfnCountIndex + 2;
975  else
976  lfnCountIndex = DIR_NAMESIZE;
977  }
978 
979  // Check for attribute match
980  for(fileCompareLfnIndex = fileFoundLfnIndex + 2;;)
981  {
982  if (templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] == '*')
983  break;
984 
985  if((foundLFN && (lfnCountIndex > fileFoundMaxLfnIndex)) || (foundSFN && (lfnCountIndex == 11)))
986  {
987  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
988  break;
989  }
990 
991  if (templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] != '?')
992  {
993  if(foCompareTo -> AsciiEncodingType)
994  {
995  // get the source character
996  character = (BYTE)templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex];
997  // get the destination character
998  if(foundLFN)
999  test = (BYTE)fileFoundString[lfnCountIndex];
1000  else
1001  test = dst[lfnCountIndex];
1002  if((foundLFN && (fileFoundString[lfnCountIndex] > 0xFF)) ||
1003  (tolower(character) != tolower(test)))
1004  {
1005  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
1006  break;
1007  }
1008  }
1009  else
1010  {
1011  if((templfnPtr[fileCompareLfnIndex] != fileFoundString[lfnCountIndex]) || foundSFN)
1012  {
1013  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
1014  break;
1015  }
1016  }
1017  }
1018  lfnCountIndex++;
1019  fileCompareLfnIndex++;
1020  if(fileCompareLfnIndex == fileNameLength)
1021  {
1022  if((foundLFN && (lfnCountIndex <= fileFoundMaxLfnIndex)) || (foundSFN && (lfnCountIndex < 11) && (dst[lfnCountIndex] != ' ')))
1023  {
1024  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
1025  }
1026  break;
1027  }
1028  }// for loop
1029  }
1030  else
1031  {
1032  /* We got something */
1033  if(foundLFN)
1034  {
1035  fileCompareLfnIndex = fileFoundMaxLfnIndex;
1036  fileFoundDotPosition = FALSE;
1037  while(fileCompareLfnIndex > 0)
1038  {
1039  if(fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex] == '.')
1040  {
1041  fileFoundDotPosition = TRUE;
1042  fileCompareLfnIndex--;
1043  break;
1044  }
1045  fileCompareLfnIndex--;
1046  }
1047 
1048  if(fileFoundDotPosition == FALSE)
1049  fileCompareLfnIndex = fileFoundMaxLfnIndex;
1050  }
1051  else
1052  fileCompareLfnIndex = DIR_NAMESIZE - 1; // Short File name last char position
1053 
1054  if (foCompareTo->name[0] != '*') //If "*" is passed for comparion as 1st char then don't proceed. Go back, file alreay found.
1055  {
1056  for (index = 0;;)
1057  {
1058  if(foundLFN)
1059  {
1060  if((fileFoundString[index] > 0xFF) || (index > fileCompareLfnIndex))
1061  {
1062  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1063  break;
1064  }
1065  }
1066 
1067  // Get the source character
1068  if(foundLFN)
1069  character = (BYTE)fileFoundString[index];
1070  else
1071  character = dst[index];
1072 
1073  // Get the destination character
1074  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
1075  if (test == '*')
1076  break;
1077  if (test != '?')
1078  {
1079  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
1080  {
1081  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1082  break;
1083  }
1084  }
1085 
1086  index++;
1087  if(index == DIR_NAMESIZE)
1088  {
1089  if(foundLFN && (index <= fileCompareLfnIndex))
1090  {
1091  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1092  }
1093  break;
1094  }
1095  }
1096  }
1097 
1098  // Before calling this "FILEfind" fn, "formatfilename" must be called. Hence, extn always starts from position "8".
1099  if ((foCompareTo->name[8] != '*') && (statusB == CE_GOOD))
1100  {
1101  if(foundLFN)
1102  {
1103  if(foCompareTo->name[8] == ' ')
1104  {
1105  if(fileFoundDotPosition == TRUE)
1106  {
1107  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1108  }
1109  break;
1110  }
1111  else
1112  {
1113  if(fileFoundDotPosition == FALSE)
1114  {
1115  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1116  break;
1117  }
1118  }
1119  fileCompareLfnIndex = fileCompareLfnIndex + 2;
1120  }
1121  else
1122  fileCompareLfnIndex = DIR_NAMESIZE;
1123 
1124  for (index = 8;;)
1125  {
1126  if(foundLFN)
1127  {
1128  if((fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex] > 0xFF) || (fileCompareLfnIndex > fileFoundMaxLfnIndex))
1129  {
1130  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1131  break;
1132  }
1133  }
1134  // Get the destination character
1135  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
1136  // Get the source character
1137  if(foundLFN)
1138  character = (BYTE)fileFoundString[fileCompareLfnIndex++];
1139  else
1140  character = dst[fileCompareLfnIndex++];
1141 
1142  if (test == '*')
1143  break;
1144  if (test != '?')
1145  {
1146  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
1147  {
1148  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1149  break;
1150  }
1151  }
1152 
1153  index++;
1154  if(index == DIR_NAMECOMP)
1155  {
1156  if(foundLFN && (fileCompareLfnIndex <= fileFoundMaxLfnIndex))
1157  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1158  break;
1159  }
1160  }
1161  }
1162  }
1163  break;
1164  }
1165 
1166  // If the comparision of each character in LFN is completed
1167  if(statusB == CE_GOOD)
1168  {
1169  if(foundLFN)
1170  fHandle++;
1171 
1172  state = Fill_File_Object(foDest, &fHandle);
1173 
1174  if(foundLFN)
1175  fHandle--;
1176 
1177  /* We got something get the attributes */
1178  attrib = foDest->attributes;
1179 
1180  attrib &= ATTR_MASK;
1181 
1182  switch (mode)
1183  {
1184  case 0:
1185  // see if we are a volume id or hidden, ignore
1186  if(attrib == ATTR_VOLUME)
1187  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
1188  break;
1189 
1190  case 1:
1191  // Check for attribute match
1192  if ((attrib & compareAttrib) != 0)
1193  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Indicate the already filled file data is correct and go back
1194  if(foundLFN)
1195  foDest->utf16LFNlength = fileFoundLength;
1196  else
1197  foDest->utf16LFNlength = 0;
1198  break;
1199  }
1200  }
1201  #else
1202  {
1203  /* We got something */
1204  // get the attributes
1205  attrib = foDest->attributes;
1206 
1207  attrib &= ATTR_MASK;
1208  switch (mode)
1209  {
1210  case 0:
1211  // see if we are a volume id or hidden, ignore
1212  if(attrib != ATTR_VOLUME)
1213  {
1214  statusB = CE_GOOD;
1215  character = (BYTE)'m'; // random value
1216 
1217  // search for one. if status = TRUE we found one
1218  for(index = 0; index < DIR_NAMECOMP; index++)
1219  {
1220  // get the source character
1221  character = foDest->name[index];
1222  // get the destination character
1223  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
1224  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
1225  {
1226  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // Nope its not a match
1227  break;
1228  }
1229  }// for loop
1230  } // not dir nor vol
1231  break;
1232 
1233  case 1:
1234  // Check for attribute match
1235  if (((attrib & compareAttrib) == 0) && (attrib != ATTR_LONG_NAME))
1236  {
1237  statusB = CE_GOOD; // Indicate the already filled file data is correct and go back
1238  character = (BYTE)'m'; // random value
1239  if (foCompareTo->name[0] != '*') //If "*" is passed for comparion as 1st char then don't proceed. Go back, file alreay found.
1240  {
1241  for (index = 0; index < DIR_NAMESIZE; index++)
1242  {
1243  // Get the source character
1244  character = foDest->name[index];
1245  // Get the destination character
1246  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
1247  if (test == '*')
1248  break;
1249  if (test != '?')
1250  {
1251  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
1252  {
1253  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1254  break;
1255  }
1256  }
1257  }
1258  }
1259 
1260  // Before calling this "FILEfind" fn, "formatfilename" must be called. Hence, extn always starts from position "8".
1261  if ((foCompareTo->name[8] != '*') && (statusB == CE_GOOD))
1262  {
1263  for (index = 8; index < DIR_NAMECOMP; index++)
1264  {
1265  // Get the source character
1266  character = foDest->name[index];
1267  // Get the destination character
1268  test = foCompareTo->name[index];
1269  if (test == '*')
1270  break;
1271  if (test != '?')
1272  {
1273  if(tolower(character) != tolower(test))
1274  {
1275  statusB = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND; // it's not a match
1276  break;
1277  }
1278  }
1279  }
1280  }
1281 
1282  } // Attribute match
1283 
1284  break;
1285  }
1286  }
1287  #endif
1288  } // not found
1289  else
1290  {
1291  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
1292  lfnFirstCheck = FALSE;
1293  #endif
1294  /*** looking for an empty/re-usable entry ***/
1295  if ( cmd == LOOK_FOR_EMPTY_ENTRY)
1296  statusB = CE_GOOD;
1297  } // found or not
1298 
1299  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
1300 // if(foundLFN)
1301 // fHandle = fHandle + 2;
1302 // fHandle++;
1303 // else
1304  #endif
1305  // increment it no matter what happened
1306  fHandle++;
1307 
1308  }// while
1309  }
1310 
1311  return(statusB);
1312 } // FILEFind
1313 
1314 
1315 /**************************************************************************
1316  Function:
1317  CETYPE FILEopen (FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, char type)
1318  Summary:
1319  Loads file information from the device
1320  Conditions:
1321  This function should not be called by the user.
1322  Input:
1323  fo - File to be opened
1324  fHandle - Location of file
1325  type -
1326  - FS_WRITE - Create a new file or replace an existing file
1327  - FS_READ - Read data from an existing file
1328  - FS_APPEND - Append data to an existing file
1329  Return Values:
1330  CE_GOOD - FILEopen successful
1331  CE_NOT_INIT - Device is not yet initialized
1332  CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND - Could not find the file on the device
1333  CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ - A bad read of a sector occured
1334  Side Effects:
1335  None
1336  Description:
1337  This function will cache a directory entry in the directory specified
1338  by the dirclus parameter of hte FSFILE object 'fo.' The offset of the
1339  entry in the directory is specified by fHandle. Once the directory entry
1340  has been loaded, the first sector of the file can be loaded using the
1341  cluster value specified in the directory entry. The type argument will
1342  specify the mode the files will be opened in. This will allow this
1343  function to set the correct read/write flags for the file.
1344  Remarks:
1345  If the mode the file is being opened in is a plus mode (e.g. FS_READ+) the
1346  flags will be modified further in the FSfopen function.
1347  **************************************************************************/
1348 
1349 CETYPE FILEopen (FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, char type)
1350 {
1351  DISK *dsk; //Disk structure
1352  BYTE r; //Result of search for file
1353  DWORD l; //lba of first sector of first cluster
1354  CETYPE error = CE_GOOD;
1355 
1356  dsk = (DISK *)(fo->dsk);
1357  if (dsk->mount == FALSE)
1358  {
1359  error = CE_NOT_INIT;
1360  }
1361  else
1362  {
1363  // load the sector
1364  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
1365  // Cache no matter what if it's the first entry
1366  if (*fHandle == 0)
1367  {
1368  if (Cache_File_Entry(fo, fHandle, TRUE) == NULL)
1369  {
1370  error = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
1371  }
1372  }
1373  else
1374  {
1375  // If it's not the first, only cache it if it's
1376  // not divisible by the number of entries per sector
1377  // If it is, Fill_File_Object will cache it
1378  if ((*fHandle & 0xf) != 0)
1379  {
1380  if (Cache_File_Entry (fo, fHandle, TRUE) == NULL)
1381  {
1382  error = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
1383  }
1384  }
1385  }
1386 
1387  // Fill up the File Object with the information pointed to by fHandle
1388  r = Fill_File_Object(fo, fHandle);
1389  if (r != FOUND)
1390  error = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
1391  else
1392  {
1393  fo->seek = 0; // first byte in file
1394  fo->ccls = fo->cluster; // first cluster
1395  fo->sec = 0; // first sector in the cluster
1396  fo->pos = 0; // first byte in sector/cluster
1397 
1398  if ( r == NOT_FOUND)
1399  {
1400  error = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
1401  }
1402  else
1403  {
1404  // Determine the lba of the selected sector and load
1405  l = Cluster2Sector(dsk,fo->ccls);
1406 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
1407  if (gNeedDataWrite)
1408  if (flushData())
1409  return CE_WRITE_ERROR;
1410 #endif
1411  gBufferOwner = fo;
1412  if (gLastDataSectorRead != l)
1413  {
1414  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
1415  if ( !MDD_SectorRead( l, dsk->buffer))
1416  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1417  gLastDataSectorRead = l;
1418  }
1419  } // -- found
1420 
1421  fo->flags.FileWriteEOF = FALSE;
1422  // Set flag for operation type
1423 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
1424  if ((type == 'w') || (type == 'a'))
1425  {
1426  fo->flags.write = 1; //write or append
1427  fo->flags.read = 0;
1428  }
1429  else
1430  {
1431 #endif
1432  fo->flags.write = 0; //read
1433  fo->flags.read = 1;
1434 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
1435  } // -- flags
1436 #endif
1437  } // -- r = Found
1438  } // -- Mounted
1439  return (error);
1440 } // -- FILEopen
1441 
1442 
1443 /*************************************************************************
1444  Function:
1445  BYTE FILEget_next_cluster(FSFILE *fo, DWORD n)
1446  Summary:
1447  Step through a chain of clusters
1448  Conditions:
1449  None
1450  Input:
1451  fo - The file to get the next cluster of
1452  n - Number of links in the FAT cluster chain to jump through
1453  Return Values:
1454  CE_GOOD - Operation successful
1455  CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ - A bad read occured of a sector
1456  CE_INVALID_CLUSTER - Invalid cluster value > maxcls
1457  CE_FAT_EOF - Fat attempt to read beyond EOF
1458  Side Effects:
1459  None
1460  Description:
1461  This function will load 'n' proximate clusters for a file from
1462  the FAT on the device. It will stop checking for clusters if the
1463  ReadFAT function returns an error, if it reaches the last cluster in
1464  a file, or if the device tries to read beyond the last cluster used
1465  by the device.
1466  Remarks:
1467  None
1468  *************************************************************************/
1469 
1470 BYTE FILEget_next_cluster(FSFILE *fo, DWORD n)
1471 {
1472  DWORD c, c2, ClusterFailValue, LastClustervalue;
1473  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
1474  DISK * disk;
1475 
1476  disk = fo->dsk;
1477 
1478  /* Settings based on FAT type */
1479  switch (disk->type)
1480  {
1481 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
1482  case FAT32:
1483  LastClustervalue = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32;
1484  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
1485  break;
1486 #endif
1487  case FAT12:
1488  LastClustervalue = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT12;
1489  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
1490  break;
1491  case FAT16:
1492  default:
1493  LastClustervalue = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16;
1494  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
1495  break;
1496  }
1497 
1498  // loop n times
1499  do
1500  {
1501  // get the next cluster link from FAT
1502  c2 = fo->ccls;
1503  if ( (c = ReadFAT( disk, c2)) == ClusterFailValue)
1504  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1505  else
1506  {
1507  // check if cluster value is valid
1508  if ( c >= (disk->maxcls + 2))
1509  {
1510  error = CE_INVALID_CLUSTER;
1511  }
1512 
1513  // compare against max value of a cluster in FAT
1514  // return if eof
1515  if ( c >= LastClustervalue) // check against eof
1516  {
1517  error = CE_FAT_EOF;
1518  }
1519  }
1520 
1521  // update the FSFILE structure
1522  fo->ccls = c;
1523 
1524  } while ((--n > 0) && (error == CE_GOOD));// loop end
1525 
1526  return(error);
1527 } // get next cluster
1528 
1529 
1530 /**************************************************************************
1531  Function:
1532  BYTE DISKmount ( DISK *dsk)
1533  Summary:
1534  Initialies the device and loads MBR and boot sector information
1535  Conditions:
1536  This function should not be called by the user.
1537  Input:
1538  dsk - The disk structure to be initialized.
1539  Return Values:
1540  CE_GOOD - Disk mounted
1541  CE_INIT_ERROR - Initialization error has occured
1542  CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE - Media sector size bigger than
1543  MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE as defined in FSconfig.h.
1544  Side Effects:
1545  None
1546  Description:
1547  This function will use the function pointed to by the MDD_MediaInitialize
1548  function pointer to initialize the device (if any initialization is
1549  required). It then attempts to load the master boot record with the
1550  LoadMBR function and the boot sector with the LoadBootSector function.
1551  These two functions will be used to initialize a global DISK structure
1552  that will be used when accessing file information in the future.
1553  Remarks:
1554  None
1555  **************************************************************************/
1556 
1557 BYTE DISKmount( DISK *dsk)
1558 {
1559  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
1560  MEDIA_INFORMATION *mediaInformation;
1561 
1562  dsk->mount = FALSE; // default invalid
1563  dsk->buffer = gDataBuffer; // assign buffer
1564 
1565  // Initialize the device
1566  mediaInformation = MDD_MediaInitialize();
1567  if (mediaInformation->errorCode != MEDIA_NO_ERROR)
1568  {
1569  error = CE_INIT_ERROR;
1570  FSerrno = CE_INIT_ERROR;
1571  }
1572  else
1573  {
1574  // If the media initialization routine determined the sector size,
1575  // check it and make sure we can support it.
1576  if (mediaInformation->validityFlags.bits.sectorSize)
1577  {
1578  dsk->sectorSize = mediaInformation->sectorSize;
1579  if (mediaInformation->sectorSize > MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE)
1580  {
1581  error = CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE;
1582  FSerrno = CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE;
1583  return error;
1584  }
1585  }
1586 
1587  // Load the Master Boot Record (partition)
1588  if((error = LoadMBR(dsk)) == CE_GOOD)
1589  {
1590  // Now the boot sector
1591  if((error = LoadBootSector(dsk)) == CE_GOOD)
1592  dsk->mount = TRUE; // Mark that the DISK mounted successfully
1593  }
1594  } // -- Load file parameters
1595 
1596  return(error);
1597 } // -- mount
1598 
1599 
1600 
1601 /********************************************************************
1602  Function:
1603  CETYPE LoadMBR ( DISK *dsk)
1604  Summary:
1605  Loads the MBR and extracts necessary information
1606  Conditions:
1607  This function should not be called by the user.
1608  Input:
1609  dsk - The disk containing the master boot record to be loaded
1610  Return Values:
1611  CE_GOOD - MBR loaded successfully
1612  CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ - A bad read occured of a sector
1613  CE_BAD_PARTITION - The boot record is bad
1614  Side Effects:
1615  None
1616  Description:
1617  The LoadMBR function will use the function pointed to by the
1618  MDD_SectorRead function pointer to read the 0 sector from the
1619  device. If a valid boot signature is obtained, this function
1620  will compare fields in that cached sector to the values that
1621  would be present if that sector was a boot sector. If all of
1622  those values match, it will be assumed that the device does not
1623  have a master boot record and the 0 sector is actually the boot
1624  sector. Otherwise, data about the partition and the actual
1625  location of the boot sector will be loaded from the MBR into
1626  the DISK structure pointed to by 'dsk.'
1627  Remarks:
1628  None
1629  ********************************************************************/
1630 
1631 BYTE LoadMBR(DISK *dsk)
1632 {
1633  PT_MBR Partition;
1634  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
1635  BYTE type;
1636  BootSec BSec;
1637 
1638  // Get the partition table from the MBR
1639  if ( MDD_SectorRead( FO_MBR, dsk->buffer) != TRUE)
1640  {
1641  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1642  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1643  }
1644  else
1645  {
1646  // Check if the card has no MBR
1647  BSec = (BootSec) dsk->buffer;
1648 
1649  if((BSec->Signature0 == FAT_GOOD_SIGN_0) && (BSec->Signature1 == FAT_GOOD_SIGN_1))
1650  {
1651  // Technically, the OEM name is not for indication
1652  // The alternative is to read the CIS from attribute
1653  // memory. See the PCMCIA metaformat for more details
1654 #if defined (__C30__) || defined (__PIC32MX__)
1655  if ((ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE ) == 'F') && \
1656  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 1 ) == 'A') && \
1657  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 2 ) == 'T') && \
1658  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 3 ) == '1') && \
1659  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_BOOTSIG) == 0x29))
1660 #else
1661  if ((BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[0] == 'F') && \
1662  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[1] == 'A') && \
1663  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[2] == 'T') && \
1664  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[3] == '1') && \
1665  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BootSig == 0x29))
1666 #endif
1667  {
1668  dsk->firsts = 0;
1669  dsk->type = FAT16;
1670  return CE_GOOD;
1671  }
1672  else
1673  {
1674 #if defined (__C30__) || defined (__PIC32MX__)
1675  if ((ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FAT32_FSTYPE ) == 'F') && \
1676  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FAT32_FSTYPE + 1 ) == 'A') && \
1677  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FAT32_FSTYPE + 2 ) == 'T') && \
1678  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FAT32_FSTYPE + 3 ) == '3') && \
1679  (ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FAT32_BOOTSIG) == 0x29))
1680 #else
1681  if ((BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_FilSysType[0] == 'F') && \
1682  (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_FilSysType[1] == 'A') && \
1683  (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_FilSysType[2] == 'T') && \
1684  (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_FilSysType[3] == '3') && \
1685  (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BootSig == 0x29))
1686 #endif
1687  {
1688  dsk->firsts = 0;
1689  dsk->type = FAT32;
1690  return CE_GOOD;
1691  }
1692  }
1693  }
1694  // assign it the partition table strucutre
1695  Partition = (PT_MBR)dsk->buffer;
1696 
1697  // Ensure its good
1698  if((Partition->Signature0 != FAT_GOOD_SIGN_0) || (Partition->Signature1 != FAT_GOOD_SIGN_1))
1699  {
1700  FSerrno = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
1701  error = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
1702  }
1703  else
1704  {
1705  BYTE i;
1706  PTE_MBR* partitionEntry = &Partition->Partition0;
1707 
1708  for(i=0; i<4; i++)
1709  {
1710  /* Valid Master Boot Record Loaded */
1711 
1712  // Get the 32 bit offset to the first partition
1713  dsk->firsts = partitionEntry->PTE_FrstSect;
1714 
1715  // check if the partition type is acceptable
1716  type = partitionEntry->PTE_FSDesc;
1717 
1718  switch (type)
1719  {
1720  case 0x01:
1721  dsk->type = FAT12;
1722  break;
1723 
1724  case 0x04:
1725  case 0x06:
1726  case 0x0E:
1727  dsk->type = FAT16;
1728  return(error);
1729 
1730  case 0x0B:
1731  case 0x0C:
1732  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
1733  dsk->type = FAT32; // FAT32 is supported too
1734  return(error);
1735  #endif
1736  } // switch
1737 
1738  /* If we are here, we didn't find a matching partition. We
1739  should increment to the next partition table entry */
1740  partitionEntry++;
1741  }
1742 
1743  FSerrno = CE_UNSUPPORTED_FS;
1744  error = CE_UNSUPPORTED_FS;
1745  }
1746  }
1747 
1748  return(error);
1749 }// -- LoadMBR
1750 
1751 
1752 /**************************************************************************
1753  Function:
1754  BYTE LoadBootSector (DISK *dsk)
1755  Summary:
1756  Load the boot sector and extract the necessary information
1757  Conditions:
1758  This function should not be called by the user.
1759  Input:
1760  dsk - The disk containing the boot sector
1761  Return Values:
1762  CE_GOOD - Boot sector loaded
1763  CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ - A bad read occured of a sector
1764  CE_NOT_FORMATTED - The disk is of an unsupported format
1765  CE_CARDFAT32 - FAT 32 device not supported
1766  CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE - The sector size is not supported
1767  Side Effects:
1768  None
1769  Description:
1770  LoadBootSector will use the function pointed to by the MDD_SectorWrite
1771  function pointer to load the boot sector, whose location was obtained
1772  by a previous call of LoadMBR. If the boot sector is loaded successfully,
1773  partition information will be calcualted from it and copied into the DISK
1774  structure pointed to by 'dsk.'
1775  Remarks:
1776  None
1777  **************************************************************************/
1778 
1779 
1780 BYTE LoadBootSector(DISK *dsk)
1781 {
1782  DWORD RootDirSectors;
1783  DWORD TotSec,DataSec;
1784  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
1785  BootSec BSec;
1786  WORD BytesPerSec;
1787  WORD ReservedSectorCount;
1788 
1789  #if defined(SUPPORT_FAT32)
1790  BOOL TriedSpecifiedBackupBootSec = FALSE;
1791  BOOL TriedBackupBootSecAtAddress6 = FALSE;
1792  #endif
1793  // Get the Boot sector
1794  if ( MDD_SectorRead( dsk->firsts, dsk->buffer) != TRUE)
1795  {
1796  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1797  }
1798  else
1799  {
1800  BSec = (BootSec)dsk->buffer;
1801 
1802  do //test each possible boot sector (FAT32 can have backup boot sectors)
1803  {
1804 
1805  //Verify the Boot Sector has a valid signature
1806  if( (BSec->Signature0 != FAT_GOOD_SIGN_0)
1807  || (BSec->Signature1 != FAT_GOOD_SIGN_1)
1808  )
1809  {
1810  error = CE_NOT_FORMATTED;
1811  }
1812  else
1813  {
1814 
1815  do //loop just to allow a break to jump out of this section of code
1816  {
1817  #ifdef __18CXX
1818  // Load count of sectors per cluster
1819  dsk->SecPerClus = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_SPC;
1820  // Load the sector number of the first FAT sector
1821  dsk->fat = dsk->firsts + BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_ResrvSec;
1822  // Load the count of FAT tables
1823  dsk->fatcopy = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FATCount;
1824  // Load the size of the FATs
1825  dsk->fatsize = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_SPF;
1826  if(dsk->fatsize == 0)
1827  dsk->fatsize = BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_FATSz32;
1828  // Calculate the location of the root sector (for FAT12/16)
1829  dsk->root = dsk->fat + (DWORD)(dsk->fatcopy * (DWORD)dsk->fatsize);
1830  // Determine the max size of the root (will be 0 for FAT32)
1831  dsk->maxroot = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_RootDirEnts;
1832 
1833  // Determine the total number of sectors in the partition
1834  if(BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_TotSec16 != 0)
1835  {
1836  TotSec = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_TotSec16;
1837  }
1838  else
1839  {
1840  TotSec = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_TotSec32;
1841  }
1842 
1843  // Calculate the number of bytes in each sector
1844  BytesPerSec = BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BPS;
1845  if( (BytesPerSec == 0) || ((BytesPerSec & 1) == 1) )
1846  {
1847  error = CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE;
1848  break; //break out of the do while loop
1849  }
1850 
1851  // Calculate the number of sectors in the root (will be 0 for FAT32)
1852  RootDirSectors = ((BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_RootDirEnts * 32) + (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BPS - 1)) / BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BPS;
1853  // Calculate the number of data sectors on the card
1854  DataSec = TotSec - (dsk->root + RootDirSectors);
1855  // Calculate the maximum number of clusters on the card
1856  dsk->maxcls = DataSec / dsk->SecPerClus;
1857 
1858  #else // PIC24/30/33
1859 
1860  // Read the count of reserved sectors
1861  ReservedSectorCount = ReadWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_RESRVSEC );
1862  // Load the count of sectors per cluster
1863  dsk->SecPerClus = ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_SPC );
1864  // Load the sector number of the first FAT sector
1865  dsk->fat = dsk->firsts + ReservedSectorCount;
1866  // Load the count of FAT tables
1867  dsk->fatcopy = ReadByte( dsk->buffer, BSI_FATCOUNT );
1868  // Load the size of the FATs
1869  dsk->fatsize = ReadWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_SPF );
1870  if(dsk->fatsize == 0)
1871  dsk->fatsize = ReadDWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_FATSZ32 );
1872  // Calculate the location of the root sector (for FAT12/16)
1873  dsk->root = dsk->fat + (DWORD)(dsk->fatcopy * (DWORD)dsk->fatsize);
1874  // Determine the max size of the root (will be 0 for FAT32)
1875  dsk->maxroot = ReadWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_ROOTDIRENTS );
1876 
1877  // Determine the total number of sectors in the partition
1878  TotSec = ReadWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_TOTSEC16 );
1879  if( TotSec == 0 )
1880  TotSec = ReadDWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_TOTSEC32 );
1881 
1882  // Calculate the number of bytes in each sector
1883  BytesPerSec = ReadWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_BPS );
1884  if( (BytesPerSec == 0) || ((BytesPerSec & 1) == 1) )
1885  {
1886  error = CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE;
1887  break;
1888  }
1889 
1890  // Calculate the number of sectors in the root (will be 0 for FAT32)
1891  RootDirSectors = ((dsk->maxroot * NUMBER_OF_BYTES_IN_DIR_ENTRY) + (BytesPerSec - 1)) / BytesPerSec;
1892  // Calculate the number of data sectors on the card
1893  DataSec = TotSec - (ReservedSectorCount + (dsk->fatcopy * dsk->fatsize ) + RootDirSectors);
1894  // Calculate the maximum number of clusters on the card
1895  dsk->maxcls = DataSec / dsk->SecPerClus;
1896 
1897  #endif
1898 
1899  // Determine the file system type based on the number of clusters used
1900  if(dsk->maxcls < 4085)
1901  {
1902  dsk->type = FAT12;
1903  }
1904  else
1905  {
1906  if(dsk->maxcls < 65525)
1907  {
1908  dsk->type = FAT16;
1909  }
1910  else
1911  {
1912  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32
1913  dsk->type = FAT32;
1914  #else
1915  error = CE_CARDFAT32;
1916  #endif
1917  }
1918  }
1919 
1920  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32
1921  if (dsk->type == FAT32)
1922  {
1923  #ifdef __18CXX
1924  FatRootDirClusterValue = BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_RootClus;
1925  #else
1926  FatRootDirClusterValue = ReadDWord( dsk->buffer, BSI_ROOTCLUS );
1927  #endif
1928  dsk->data = dsk->root + RootDirSectors;
1929  }
1930  else
1931  #endif
1932  {
1933  FatRootDirClusterValue = 0;
1934  dsk->data = dsk->root + ( dsk->maxroot >> 4);
1935  }
1936 
1937  #ifdef __18CXX
1938  if(BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BPS > MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE)
1939  #else
1940  if(BytesPerSec > MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE)
1941  #endif
1942  {
1943  error = CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE;
1944  }
1945 
1946  }while(0); // do/while loop designed to allow to break out if
1947  // there is an error detected without returning
1948  // from the function.
1949 
1950  }
1951 
1952  #if defined(SUPPORT_FAT32)
1953  if ((dsk->type == FAT32) || ((error != CE_GOOD) && ((BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BootSig == 0x29) || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BootSig == 0x28))))
1954  {
1955  //Check for possible errors in the formatting
1956  if( (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_TotSec16 != 0)
1957  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[0] != 0)
1958  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[1] != 0)
1959  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[2] != 0)
1960  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[3] != 0)
1961  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[4] != 0)
1962  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[5] != 0)
1963  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[6] != 0)
1964  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[7] != 0)
1965  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[8] != 0)
1966  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[9] != 0)
1967  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[10] != 0)
1968  || (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_Reserved[11] != 0)
1969  || ((BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BootSig != 0x29) && (BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BootSig != 0x28))
1970  )
1971  {
1972  error = CE_NOT_FORMATTED;
1973  }
1974 
1975  //If there were formatting errors then in FAT32 we can try to use
1976  // the backup boot sector
1977  if((error != CE_GOOD) && (TriedSpecifiedBackupBootSec == FALSE))
1978  {
1979  TriedSpecifiedBackupBootSec = TRUE;
1980 
1981  if ( MDD_SectorRead( dsk->firsts + BSec->FAT.FAT_32.BootSec_BkBootSec, dsk->buffer) != TRUE)
1982  {
1983  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1984  return CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
1985  }
1986  else
1987  {
1988  error = CE_GOOD;
1989  continue;
1990  }
1991  }
1992 
1993  if((error != CE_GOOD) && (TriedBackupBootSecAtAddress6 == FALSE))
1994  {
1995  TriedBackupBootSecAtAddress6 = TRUE;
1996 
1997  //Here we are using the magic number 6 because the FAT32 specification
1998  // recommends that "No value other than 6 is recommended." We've
1999  // already tried using the value specified in the BPB_BkBootSec
2000  // field and it must have failed
2001  if ( MDD_SectorRead( dsk->firsts + 6, dsk->buffer) != TRUE)
2002  {
2003  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
2004  return CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
2005  }
2006  else
2007  {
2008  error = CE_GOOD;
2009  continue;
2010  }
2011  }
2012 
2013  } //type == FAT32
2014  #endif //SUPPORT_FAT32
2015  break;
2016  }
2017  while(1);
2018  }
2019 
2020  if(error != CE_GOOD)
2021  {
2022  FSerrno = error;
2023  }
2024 
2025  return(error);
2026 }
2027 
2028 
2029 
2030 /*************************************************************************
2031  Function:
2032  DWORD GetFullClusterNumber (DIRENTRY entry)
2033  Summary:
2034  Gets the cluster number from a directory entry
2035  Conditions:
2036  This function should not be called by the user.
2037  Input:
2038  entry - The cached directory entry to get the cluster number from
2039  Returns:
2040  The cluster value from the passed directory entry
2041  Side Effects:
2042  None.
2043  Description:
2044  This function will load both the high and low 16-bit first cluster
2045  values of a file from a directory entry and copy them into a 32-bit
2046  cluster number variable, which will be returned.
2047  Remarks:
2048  None
2049  *************************************************************************/
2050 
2051 DWORD GetFullClusterNumber(DIRENTRY entry)
2052 {
2053 
2054  DWORD TempFullClusterCalc = 0;
2055 
2056 #ifndef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 Not supported.
2057  entry->DIR_FstClusHI = 0; // If FAT32 is not supported then Higher Word of the address is "0"
2058 #endif
2059 
2060  // Get the cluster
2061  TempFullClusterCalc = (entry->DIR_FstClusHI);
2062  TempFullClusterCalc = TempFullClusterCalc << 16;
2063  TempFullClusterCalc |= entry->DIR_FstClusLO;
2064 
2065  return TempFullClusterCalc;
2066 }
2067 
2068 
2069 #ifdef ALLOW_FORMATS
2070 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
2071 
2072 
2073 /*********************************************************************************
2074  Function:
2075  int FSCreateMBR (unsigned long firstSector, unsigned long numSectors)
2076  Summary:
2077  Creates a master boot record
2078  Conditions:
2079  The I/O pins for the device have been initialized by the InitIO function.
2080  Input:
2081  firstSector - The first sector of the partition on the device (cannot
2082  be 0; that's the MBR)
2083  numSectors - The number of sectors available in memory (including the
2084  MBR)
2085  Return Values:
2086  0 - MBR was created successfully
2087  EOF - MBR could not be created
2088  Side Effects:
2089  None
2090  Description:
2091  This function can be used to create a master boot record for a device. Note
2092  that this function should not be used on a device that is already formatted
2093  with a master boot record (i.e. most SD cards, CF cards, USB keys). This
2094  function will fill the global data buffer with appropriate partition information
2095  for a FAT partition with a type determined by the number of sectors available
2096  to the partition. It will then write the MBR information to the first sector
2097  on the device. This function should be followed by a call to FSformat, which
2098  will create a boot sector, root dir, and FAT appropriate the the information
2099  contained in the new master boot record. Note that FSformat only supports
2100  FAT12 and FAT16 formatting at this time, and so cannot be used to format a
2101  device with more than 0x3FFD5F sectors.
2102  Remarks:
2103  This function can damage the device being used, and should not be called
2104  unless the user is sure about the size of the device and the first sector value.
2105  *********************************************************************************/
2106 
2107 int FSCreateMBR (unsigned long firstSector, unsigned long numSectors)
2108 {
2109  PT_MBR Partition;
2110  DWORD CyHdSc = 0x00000000;
2111  DWORD tempSector;
2112 
2113  if ((firstSector == 0) || (numSectors <= 1))
2114  return EOF;
2115 
2116  if (firstSector > (numSectors - 1))
2117  return EOF;
2118 
2119  if (gNeedDataWrite)
2120  if (flushData())
2121  return EOF;
2122 
2123  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE);
2124 
2125  Partition = (PT_MBR) gDataBuffer;
2126 
2127  // Set Cylinder-head-sector address of the first sector
2128  tempSector = firstSector;
2129  CyHdSc = (tempSector / (unsigned int)16065 ) << 14;
2130  tempSector %= 16065;
2131  CyHdSc |= (tempSector / 63) << 6;
2132  tempSector %= 63;
2133  CyHdSc |= tempSector + 1;
2134  gDataBuffer[447] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc >> 16) & 0xFF);
2135  gDataBuffer[448] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc >> 8) & 0xFF);
2136  gDataBuffer[449] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc) & 0xFF);
2137 
2138  // Set the count of sectors
2139  Partition->Partition0.PTE_NumSect = numSectors - firstSector;
2140 
2141  // Set the partition type
2142  // We only support creating FAT12 and FAT16 MBRs at this time
2143  if (Partition->Partition0.PTE_NumSect < 0x1039)
2144  {
2145  // FAT12
2146  Partition->Partition0.PTE_FSDesc = 0x01;
2147  }
2148  else if (Partition->Partition0.PTE_NumSect <= 0x3FFD5F)
2149  {
2150  // FAT16
2151  Partition->Partition0.PTE_FSDesc = 0x06;
2152  }
2153  else
2154  return EOF;
2155 
2156  // Set the LBA of the first sector
2157  Partition->Partition0.PTE_FrstSect = firstSector;
2158 
2159  // Set the Cylinder-head-sector address of the last sector
2160  tempSector = firstSector + numSectors - 1;
2161  CyHdSc = (tempSector / (unsigned int)16065 ) << 14;
2162  tempSector %= 16065;
2163  CyHdSc |= (tempSector / 63) << 6;
2164  tempSector %= 63;
2165  CyHdSc |= tempSector + 1;
2166  gDataBuffer[451] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc >> 16) & 0xFF);
2167  gDataBuffer[452] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc >> 8) & 0xFF);
2168  gDataBuffer[453] = (BYTE)((CyHdSc) & 0xFF);
2169 
2170  // Set the boot descriptor. This will be 0, since we won't
2171  // be booting anything from our device probably
2172  Partition->Partition0.PTE_BootDes = 0x00;
2173 
2174  // Set the signature codes
2175  Partition->Signature0 = 0x55;
2176  Partition->Signature1 = 0xAA;
2177 
2178  if (MDD_SectorWrite (0x00, gDataBuffer, TRUE) != TRUE)
2179  return EOF;
2180  else
2181  return 0;
2182 
2183 }
2184 
2185 
2186 /*******************************************************************
2187  Function:
2188  int FSformat (char mode, long int serialNumber, char * volumeID)
2189  Summary:
2190  Formats a device
2191  Conditions:
2192  The device must possess a valid master boot record.
2193  Input:
2194  mode - - 0 - Just erase the FAT and root
2195  - 1 - Create a new boot sector
2196  serialNumber - Serial number to write to the card
2197  volumeID - Name of the card
2198  Return Values:
2199  0 - Format was successful
2200  EOF - Format was unsuccessful
2201  Side Effects:
2202  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
2203  Description:
2204  The FSformat function can be used to create a new boot sector
2205  on a device, based on the information in the master boot record.
2206  This function will first initialize the I/O pins and the device,
2207  and then attempts to read the master boot record. If the MBR
2208  cannot be loaded successfully, the function will fail. Next, if
2209  the 'mode' argument is specified as '0' the existing boot sector
2210  information will be loaded. If the 'mode' argument is '1' an
2211  entirely new boot sector will be constructed using the disk
2212  values from the master boot record. Once the boot sector has
2213  been successfully loaded/created, the locations of the FAT and
2214  root will be loaded from it, and they will be completely
2215  erased. If the user has specified a volumeID parameter, a
2216  VOLUME attribute entry will be created in the root directory
2217  to name the device.
2218 
2219  FAT12, FAT16 and FAT32 formatting are supported.
2220 
2221  Based on the number of sectors, the format function automatically
2222  compute the smallest possible value for the cluster size in order to
2223  accommodate the physical size of the media. In this case, if a media
2224  with a big capacity is formatted, the format function may take a very
2225  long time to write all the FAT tables.
2226 
2227  Therefore, the FORMAT_SECTORS_PER_CLUSTER macro may be used to
2228  specify the exact cluster size (in multiples of sector size). This
2229  macro can be defined in FSconfig.h
2230 
2231  Remarks:
2232  Only devices with a sector size of 512 bytes are supported by the
2233  format function
2234  *******************************************************************/
2235 
2236 int FSformat (char mode, long int serialNumber, char * volumeID)
2237 {
2238  PT_MBR masterBootRecord;
2239  DWORD secCount, DataClusters, RootDirSectors;
2240  BootSec BSec;
2241  DISK d;
2242  DISK * disk = &d;
2243  WORD j;
2244  DWORD fatsize, test;
2245  DWORD Index;
2246  MEDIA_INFORMATION * mediaInfo;
2247 #ifdef __18CXX
2248  // This is here because of a C18 compiler feature
2249  BYTE * dataBufferPointer = gDataBuffer;
2250 #endif
2251 
2252  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
2253 
2254  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
2255  gNeedFATWrite = FALSE;
2256  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
2257  gLastDataSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
2258 
2259  disk->buffer = gDataBuffer;
2260 
2261  MDD_InitIO();
2262 
2263  mediaInfo = MDD_MediaInitialize();
2264  if (mediaInfo->errorCode != MEDIA_NO_ERROR)
2265  {
2266  FSerrno = CE_INIT_ERROR;
2267  return EOF;
2268  }
2269 
2270  if (MDD_SectorRead (0x00, gDataBuffer) == FALSE)
2271  {
2272  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
2273  return EOF;
2274  }
2275 
2276  // Check if the card has no MBR
2277  BSec = (BootSec) disk->buffer;
2278  if((BSec->Signature0 == FAT_GOOD_SIGN_0) && (BSec->Signature1 == FAT_GOOD_SIGN_1))
2279  {
2280  // Technically, the OEM name is not for indication
2281  // The alternative is to read the CIS from attribute
2282  // memory. See the PCMCIA metaformat for more details
2283 #if defined (__C30__) || defined (__PIC32MX__)
2284  if ((ReadByte( disk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE ) == 'F') && \
2285  (ReadByte( disk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 1 ) == 'A') && \
2286  (ReadByte( disk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 2 ) == 'T') && \
2287  (ReadByte( disk->buffer, BSI_FSTYPE + 3 ) == '1') && \
2288  (ReadByte( disk->buffer, BSI_BOOTSIG) == 0x29))
2289 #else
2290  if ((BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[0] == 'F') && \
2291  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[1] == 'A') && \
2292  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[2] == 'T') && \
2293  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_FSType[3] == '1') && \
2294  (BSec->FAT.FAT_16.BootSec_BootSig == 0x29))
2295 #endif
2296  {
2297  /* Mark that we do not have a MBR;
2298  this is not actualy used - is here only to remove a compilation warning */
2299  masterBootRecord = (PT_MBR) NULL;
2300  switch (mode)
2301  {
2302  case 1:
2303  // not enough info to construct our own boot sector
2304  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
2305  return EOF;
2306  case 0:
2307  // We have to determine the operating system, and the
2308  // locations and sizes of the root dir and FAT, and the
2309  // count of FATs
2310  disk->firsts = 0;
2311  if (LoadBootSector (disk) != CE_GOOD)
2312  {
2313  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
2314  return EOF;
2315  }
2316  default:
2317  break;
2318  }
2319  }
2320  else
2321  {
2322  masterBootRecord = (PT_MBR) &gDataBuffer;
2323  disk->firsts = masterBootRecord->Partition0.PTE_FrstSect;
2324  }
2325  }
2326  else
2327  {
2328  /* If the signature is not correct, this is neither a MBR, nor a VBR */
2329  FSerrno = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
2330  return EOF;
2331  }
2332 
2333  switch (mode)
2334  {
2335  // True: Rewrite the whole boot sector
2336  case 1:
2337  secCount = masterBootRecord->Partition0.PTE_NumSect;
2338 
2339  if (secCount < 0x1039)
2340  {
2341  disk->type = FAT12;
2342  // Format to FAT12 only if there are too few sectors to format
2343  // as FAT16
2344  masterBootRecord->Partition0.PTE_FSDesc = 0x01;
2345  if (MDD_SectorWrite (0x00, gDataBuffer, TRUE) == FALSE)
2346  {
2347  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
2348  return EOF;
2349  }
2350 
2351  if (secCount >= 0x1028)
2352  {
2353  // More than 0x18 sectors for FATs, 0x20 for root dir,
2354  // 0x8 reserved, and 0xFED for data
2355  // So double the number of sectors in a cluster to reduce
2356  // the number of data clusters used
2357  disk->SecPerClus = 2;
2358  }
2359  else
2360  {
2361  // One sector per cluster
2362  disk->SecPerClus = 1;
2363  }
2364 
2365  // Prepare a boot sector
2366  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE);
2367 
2368  // Last digit of file system name (FAT12 )
2369  gDataBuffer[58] = '2';
2370 
2371  // Calculate the size of the FAT
2372  fatsize = (secCount - 0x21 + (2*disk->SecPerClus));
2373  test = (341 * disk->SecPerClus) + 2;
2374  fatsize = (fatsize + (test-1)) / test;
2375 
2376  disk->fatcopy = 0x02;
2377  disk->maxroot = 0x200;
2378 
2379  disk->fatsize = fatsize;
2380 
2381  }
2382  else if (secCount <= 0x3FFD5F)
2383  {
2384  disk->type = FAT16;
2385  // Format to FAT16
2386  masterBootRecord->Partition0.PTE_FSDesc = 0x06;
2387  if (MDD_SectorWrite (0x00, gDataBuffer, TRUE) == FALSE)
2388  {
2389  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
2390  return EOF;
2391  }
2392 
2393  DataClusters = secCount - 0x218;
2394  // Figure out how many sectors per cluster we need
2395  disk->SecPerClus = 1;
2396  while (DataClusters > 0xFFED)
2397  {
2398  disk->SecPerClus *= 2;
2399  DataClusters /= 2;
2400  }
2401  // This shouldnt happen
2402  if (disk->SecPerClus > 128)
2403  {
2404  FSerrno = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
2405  return EOF;
2406  }
2407 
2408  // Prepare a boot sector
2409  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE);
2410 
2411  // Last digit of file system name (FAT16 )
2412  gDataBuffer[58] = '6';
2413 
2414  // Calculate the size of the FAT
2415  fatsize = (secCount - 0x21 + (2*disk->SecPerClus));
2416  test = (256 * disk->SecPerClus) + 2;
2417  fatsize = (fatsize + (test-1)) / test;
2418 
2419  disk->fatcopy = 0x02;
2420  disk->maxroot = 0x200;
2421 
2422  disk->fatsize = fatsize;
2423  }
2424  else
2425  {
2426  disk->type = FAT32;
2427  // Format to FAT32
2428  masterBootRecord->Partition0.PTE_FSDesc = 0x0B;
2429  if (MDD_SectorWrite (0x00, gDataBuffer, TRUE) == FALSE)
2430  {
2431  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
2432  return EOF;
2433  }
2434 
2435  #ifdef FORMAT_SECTORS_PER_CLUSTER
2436  disk->SecPerClus = FORMAT_SECTORS_PER_CLUSTER;
2437  DataClusters = secCount / disk->SecPerClus;
2438 
2439  /* FAT32: 65526 < Number of clusters < 4177918 */
2440  if ((DataClusters <= 65526) || (DataClusters >= 4177918))
2441  {
2442  FSerrno = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
2443  return EOF;
2444  }
2445  #else
2446  /* FAT32: 65526 < Number of clusters < 4177918 */
2447  DataClusters = secCount;
2448  // Figure out how many sectors per cluster we need
2449  disk->SecPerClus = 1;
2450  while (DataClusters > 0x3FBFFE)
2451  {
2452  disk->SecPerClus *= 2;
2453  DataClusters /= 2;
2454  }
2455  #endif
2456  // Check the cluster size: FAT32 supports 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16K, 32K, 64K
2457  if (disk->SecPerClus > 128)
2458  {
2459  FSerrno = CE_BAD_PARTITION;
2460  return EOF;
2461  }
2462 
2463  // Prepare a boot sector
2464  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE);
2465 
2466  // Calculate the size of the FAT
2467  fatsize = (secCount - 0x20);
2468  test = (128 * disk->SecPerClus) + 1;
2469  fatsize = (fatsize + (test-1)) / test;
2470 
2471  disk->fatcopy = 0x02;
2472  disk->maxroot = 0x200;
2473 
2474  disk->fatsize = fatsize;
2475  }
2476 
2477  // Non-file system specific values
2478  gDataBuffer[0] = 0xEB; //Jump instruction
2479  gDataBuffer[1] = 0x3C;
2480  gDataBuffer[2] = 0x90;
2481  gDataBuffer[3] = 'M'; //OEM Name "MCHP FAT"
2482  gDataBuffer[4] = 'C';
2483  gDataBuffer[5] = 'H';
2484  gDataBuffer[6] = 'P';
2485  gDataBuffer[7] = ' ';
2486  gDataBuffer[8] = 'F';
2487  gDataBuffer[9] = 'A';
2488  gDataBuffer[10] = 'T';
2489 
2490  gDataBuffer[11] = 0x00; //Sector size
2491  gDataBuffer[12] = 0x02;
2492 
2493  gDataBuffer[13] = disk->SecPerClus; //Sectors per cluster
2494 
2495  if ((disk->type == FAT12) || (disk->type == FAT16))
2496  {
2497  gDataBuffer[14] = 0x08; //Reserved sector count
2498  gDataBuffer[15] = 0x00;
2499  disk->fat = 0x08 + disk->firsts;
2500 
2501  gDataBuffer[16] = 0x02; //number of FATs
2502 
2503  gDataBuffer[17] = 0x00; //Max number of root directory entries - 512 files allowed
2504  gDataBuffer[18] = 0x02;
2505 
2506  gDataBuffer[19] = 0x00; //total sectors
2507  gDataBuffer[20] = 0x00;
2508 
2509  gDataBuffer[21] = 0xF8; //Media Descriptor
2510 
2511  gDataBuffer[22] = fatsize & 0xFF; //Sectors per FAT
2512  gDataBuffer[23] = (fatsize >> 8) & 0xFF;
2513 
2514  gDataBuffer[24] = 0x3F; //Sectors per track
2515  gDataBuffer[25] = 0x00;
2516 
2517  gDataBuffer[26] = 0xFF; //Number of heads
2518  gDataBuffer[27] = 0x00;
2519 
2520  // Hidden sectors = sectors between the MBR and the boot sector
2521  gDataBuffer[28] = (BYTE)(disk->firsts & 0xFF);
2522  gDataBuffer[29] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x100) & 0xFF);
2523  gDataBuffer[30] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2524  gDataBuffer[31] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2525 
2526  // Total Sectors = same as sectors in the partition from MBR
2527  gDataBuffer[32] = (BYTE)(secCount & 0xFF);
2528  gDataBuffer[33] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x100) & 0xFF);
2529  gDataBuffer[34] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2530  gDataBuffer[35] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2531 
2532  gDataBuffer[36] = 0x00; // Physical drive number
2533 
2534  gDataBuffer[37] = 0x00; // Reserved (current head)
2535 
2536  gDataBuffer[38] = 0x29; // Signature code
2537 
2538  gDataBuffer[39] = (BYTE)(serialNumber & 0xFF);
2539  gDataBuffer[40] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x100) & 0xFF);
2540  gDataBuffer[41] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2541  gDataBuffer[42] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2542 
2543  // Volume ID
2544  if (volumeID != NULL)
2545  {
2546  for (Index = 0; (*(volumeID + Index) != 0) && (Index < 11); Index++)
2547  {
2548  gDataBuffer[Index + 43] = *(volumeID + Index);
2549  }
2550  while (Index < 11)
2551  {
2552  gDataBuffer[43 + Index++] = 0x20;
2553  }
2554  }
2555  else
2556  {
2557  for (Index = 0; Index < 11; Index++)
2558  {
2559  gDataBuffer[Index+43] = 0;
2560  }
2561  }
2562 
2563  gDataBuffer[54] = 'F';
2564  gDataBuffer[55] = 'A';
2565  gDataBuffer[56] = 'T';
2566  gDataBuffer[57] = '1';
2567  gDataBuffer[59] = ' ';
2568  gDataBuffer[60] = ' ';
2569  gDataBuffer[61] = ' ';
2570 
2571  }
2572  else //FAT32
2573  {
2574  gDataBuffer[14] = 0x20; //Reserved sector count
2575  gDataBuffer[15] = 0x00;
2576  disk->fat = 0x20 + disk->firsts;
2577 
2578  gDataBuffer[16] = 0x02; //number of FATs
2579 
2580  gDataBuffer[17] = 0x00; //Max number of root directory entries - 512 files allowed
2581  gDataBuffer[18] = 0x00;
2582 
2583  gDataBuffer[19] = 0x00; //total sectors
2584  gDataBuffer[20] = 0x00;
2585 
2586  gDataBuffer[21] = 0xF8; //Media Descriptor
2587 
2588  gDataBuffer[22] = 0x00; //Sectors per FAT
2589  gDataBuffer[23] = 0x00;
2590 
2591  gDataBuffer[24] = 0x3F; //Sectors per track
2592  gDataBuffer[25] = 0x00;
2593 
2594  gDataBuffer[26] = 0xFF; //Number of heads
2595  gDataBuffer[27] = 0x00;
2596 
2597  // Hidden sectors = sectors between the MBR and the boot sector
2598  gDataBuffer[28] = (BYTE)(disk->firsts & 0xFF);
2599  gDataBuffer[29] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x100) & 0xFF);
2600  gDataBuffer[30] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2601  gDataBuffer[31] = (BYTE)((disk->firsts / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2602 
2603  // Total Sectors = same as sectors in the partition from MBR
2604  gDataBuffer[32] = (BYTE)(secCount & 0xFF);
2605  gDataBuffer[33] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x100) & 0xFF);
