2606  gDataBuffer[34] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2607  gDataBuffer[35] = (BYTE)((secCount / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2608 
2609  gDataBuffer[36] = fatsize & 0xFF; //Sectors per FAT
2610  gDataBuffer[37] = (fatsize >> 8) & 0xFF;
2611  gDataBuffer[38] = (fatsize >> 16) & 0xFF;
2612  gDataBuffer[39] = (fatsize >> 24) & 0xFF;
2613 
2614  gDataBuffer[40] = 0x00; //Active FAT
2615  gDataBuffer[41] = 0x00;
2616 
2617  gDataBuffer[42] = 0x00; //File System version
2618  gDataBuffer[43] = 0x00;
2619 
2620  gDataBuffer[44] = 0x02; //First cluster of the root directory
2621  gDataBuffer[45] = 0x00;
2622  gDataBuffer[46] = 0x00;
2623  gDataBuffer[47] = 0x00;
2624 
2625  gDataBuffer[48] = 0x01; //FSInfo
2626  gDataBuffer[49] = 0x00;
2627 
2628  gDataBuffer[50] = 0x00; //Backup Boot Sector
2629  gDataBuffer[51] = 0x00;
2630 
2631  gDataBuffer[52] = 0x00; //Reserved for future expansion
2632  gDataBuffer[53] = 0x00;
2633  gDataBuffer[54] = 0x00;
2634  gDataBuffer[55] = 0x00;
2635  gDataBuffer[56] = 0x00;
2636  gDataBuffer[57] = 0x00;
2637  gDataBuffer[58] = 0x00;
2638  gDataBuffer[59] = 0x00;
2639  gDataBuffer[60] = 0x00;
2640  gDataBuffer[61] = 0x00;
2641  gDataBuffer[62] = 0x00;
2642  gDataBuffer[63] = 0x00;
2643 
2644  gDataBuffer[64] = 0x00; // Physical drive number
2645 
2646  gDataBuffer[65] = 0x00; // Reserved (current head)
2647 
2648  gDataBuffer[66] = 0x29; // Signature code
2649 
2650  gDataBuffer[67] = (BYTE)(serialNumber & 0xFF);
2651  gDataBuffer[68] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x100) & 0xFF);
2652  gDataBuffer[69] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x10000) & 0xFF);
2653  gDataBuffer[70] = (BYTE)((serialNumber / 0x1000000) & 0xFF);
2654 
2655  // Volume ID
2656  if (volumeID != NULL)
2657  {
2658  for (Index = 0; (*(volumeID + Index) != 0) && (Index < 11); Index++)
2659  {
2660  gDataBuffer[Index + 71] = *(volumeID + Index);
2661  }
2662  while (Index < 11)
2663  {
2664  gDataBuffer[71 + Index++] = 0x20;
2665  }
2666  }
2667  else
2668  {
2669  for (Index = 0; Index < 11; Index++)
2670  {
2671  gDataBuffer[Index+71] = 0;
2672  }
2673  }
2674 
2675  gDataBuffer[82] = 'F';
2676  gDataBuffer[83] = 'A';
2677  gDataBuffer[84] = 'T';
2678  gDataBuffer[85] = '3';
2679  gDataBuffer[86] = '2';
2680  gDataBuffer[87] = ' ';
2681  gDataBuffer[88] = ' ';
2682  gDataBuffer[89] = ' ';
2683 
2684 
2685  }
2686 
2687 #ifdef __18CXX
2688  // C18 can't reference a value greater than 256
2689  // using an array name pointer
2690  *(dataBufferPointer + 510) = 0x55;
2691  *(dataBufferPointer + 511) = 0xAA;
2692 #else
2693  gDataBuffer[510] = 0x55;
2694  gDataBuffer[511] = 0xAA;
2695 #endif
2696 
2697  disk->root = disk->fat + (disk->fatcopy * disk->fatsize);
2698 
2699  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->firsts, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2700  {
2701  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
2702  return EOF;
2703  }
2704 
2705  break;
2706  case 0:
2707  if (LoadBootSector (disk) != CE_GOOD)
2708  {
2709  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
2710  return EOF;
2711  }
2712  break;
2713  default:
2714  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
2715  return EOF;
2716  }
2717 
2718  // Erase the FAT
2719  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE);
2720 
2721  if (disk->type == FAT32)
2722  {
2723  gDataBuffer[0] = 0xF8; //BPB_Media byte value in its low 8 bits, and all other bits are set to 1
2724  gDataBuffer[1] = 0xFF;
2725  gDataBuffer[2] = 0xFF;
2726  gDataBuffer[3] = 0xFF;
2727 
2728  gDataBuffer[4] = 0x00; //Disk is clean and no read/write errors were encountered
2729  gDataBuffer[5] = 0x00;
2730  gDataBuffer[6] = 0x00;
2731  gDataBuffer[7] = 0x0C;
2732 
2733  gDataBuffer[8] = 0xFF; //Root Directory EOF
2734  gDataBuffer[9] = 0xFF;
2735  gDataBuffer[10] = 0xFF;
2736  gDataBuffer[11] = 0xFF;
2737 
2738  for (j = disk->fatcopy - 1; j != 0xFFFF; j--)
2739  {
2740  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->fat + (j * disk->fatsize), gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2741  return EOF;
2742  }
2743 
2744  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, 12);
2745 
2746  for (Index = disk->fat + 1; Index < (disk->fat + disk->fatsize); Index++)
2747  {
2748  for (j = disk->fatcopy - 1; j != 0xFFFF; j--)
2749  {
2750  if (MDD_SectorWrite (Index + (j * disk->fatsize), gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2751  return EOF;
2752  }
2753  }
2754 
2755  // Erase the root directory
2756  for (Index = 1; Index < disk->SecPerClus; Index++)
2757  {
2758  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root + Index, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2759  return EOF;
2760  }
2761 
2762  if (volumeID != NULL)
2763  {
2764  // Create a drive name entry in the root dir
2765  Index = 0;
2766  while ((*(volumeID + Index) != 0) && (Index < 11))
2767  {
2768  gDataBuffer[Index] = *(volumeID + Index);
2769  Index++;
2770  }
2771  while (Index < 11)
2772  {
2773  gDataBuffer[Index++] = ' ';
2774  }
2775  gDataBuffer[11] = 0x08;
2776  gDataBuffer[17] = 0x11;
2777  gDataBuffer[19] = 0x11;
2778  gDataBuffer[23] = 0x11;
2779 
2780  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2781  return EOF;
2782  }
2783  else
2784  {
2785  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2786  return EOF;
2787  }
2788 
2789  return 0;
2790  }
2791  else
2792  {
2793  gDataBuffer[0] = 0xF8;
2794  gDataBuffer[1] = 0xFF;
2795  gDataBuffer[2] = 0xFF;
2796  if (disk->type == FAT16)
2797  gDataBuffer[3] = 0xFF;
2798 
2799  for (j = disk->fatcopy - 1; j != 0xFFFF; j--)
2800  {
2801  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->fat + (j * disk->fatsize), gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2802  return EOF;
2803  }
2804 
2805  memset (gDataBuffer, 0x00, 4);
2806 
2807  for (Index = disk->fat + 1; Index < (disk->fat + disk->fatsize); Index++)
2808  {
2809  for (j = disk->fatcopy - 1; j != 0xFFFF; j--)
2810  {
2811  if (MDD_SectorWrite (Index + (j * disk->fatsize), gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2812  return EOF;
2813  }
2814  }
2815 
2816  // Initialize the sector size
2817  disk->sectorSize = MEDIA_SECTOR_SIZE;
2818 
2819  // Erase the root directory
2820  RootDirSectors = ((disk->maxroot * 32) + (disk->sectorSize - 1)) / disk->sectorSize;
2821 
2822  for (Index = 1; Index < RootDirSectors; Index++)
2823  {
2824  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root + Index, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2825  return EOF;
2826  }
2827 
2828  if (volumeID != NULL)
2829  {
2830  // Create a drive name entry in the root dir
2831  Index = 0;
2832  while ((*(volumeID + Index) != 0) && (Index < 11))
2833  {
2834  gDataBuffer[Index] = *(volumeID + Index);
2835  Index++;
2836  }
2837  while (Index < 11)
2838  {
2839  gDataBuffer[Index++] = ' ';
2840  }
2841  gDataBuffer[11] = 0x08;
2842  gDataBuffer[17] = 0x11;
2843  gDataBuffer[19] = 0x11;
2844  gDataBuffer[23] = 0x11;
2845 
2846  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2847  return EOF;
2848  }
2849  else
2850  {
2851  if (MDD_SectorWrite (disk->root, gDataBuffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
2852  return EOF;
2853  }
2854 
2855  return 0;
2856  }
2857 }
2858 #endif
2859 #endif
2860 
2861 
2862 /*******************************************************
2863  Function:
2864  BYTE Write_File_Entry( FILEOBJ fo, WORD * curEntry)
2865  Summary:
2866  Write dir entry info into a specified entry
2867  Conditions:
2868  This function should not be called by the user.
2869  Input:
2870  fo - \File structure
2871  curEntry - Write destination
2872  Return Values:
2873  TRUE - Operation successful
2874  FALSE - Operation failed
2875  Side Effects:
2876  None
2877  Description:
2878  This function will calculate the sector of the
2879  directory (whose base sector is pointed to by the
2880  dirccls value in the FSFILE object 'fo') that contains
2881  a directory entry whose offset is indicated by the
2882  curEntry parameter. It will then write the data
2883  in the global data buffer (which should already
2884  contain the entries for that sector) to the device.
2885  Remarks:
2886  None
2887  *******************************************************/
2888 
2889 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
2890 BYTE Write_File_Entry( FILEOBJ fo, WORD * curEntry)
2891 {
2892  DISK *dsk;
2893  BYTE status;
2894  BYTE offset2;
2895  DWORD sector;
2896  DWORD ccls;
2897 
2898  dsk = fo->dsk;
2899 
2900  // get the cluster of this entry
2901  ccls = fo->dirccls;
2902 
2903  // figure out the offset from the base sector
2904  offset2 = (*curEntry / (dsk->sectorSize/32));
2905 
2906  /* Settings based on FAT type */
2907  switch (dsk->type)
2908  {
2909 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
2910  case FAT32:
2911  // Root is always cluster-based in FAT32
2912  offset2 = offset2 % (dsk->SecPerClus);
2913  break;
2914 #endif
2915  case FAT12:
2916  case FAT16:
2917  if(ccls != FatRootDirClusterValue)
2918  offset2 = offset2 % (dsk->SecPerClus);
2919  break;
2920  }
2921 
2922  sector = Cluster2Sector(dsk,ccls);
2923 
2924  // Now write it
2925  // "Offset" ensures writing of data belonging to a file entry only. Hence it doesn't change other file entries.
2926  if ( !MDD_SectorWrite( sector + offset2, dsk->buffer, FALSE))
2927  status = FALSE;
2928  else
2929  status = TRUE;
2930 
2931  return(status);
2932 } // Write_File_Entry
2933 #endif
2934 
2935 
2936 /**********************************************************
2937  Function:
2938  BYTE FAT_erase_cluster_chain (WORD cluster, DISK * dsk)
2939  Summary:
2940  Erase a chain of clusters
2941  Conditions:
2942  This function should not be called by the user.
2943  Input:
2944  cluster - The cluster number
2945  dsk - The disk structure
2946  Return Values:
2947  TRUE - Operation successful
2948  FALSE - Operation failed
2949  Side Effects:
2950  None
2951  Description:
2952  This function will parse through a cluster chain
2953  starting with the cluster pointed to by 'cluster' and
2954  mark all of the FAT entries as empty until the end of
2955  the chain has been reached or an error occurs.
2956  Remarks:
2957  None
2958  **********************************************************/
2959 
2960 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
2961 BYTE FAT_erase_cluster_chain (DWORD cluster, DISK * dsk)
2962 {
2963  DWORD c,c2,ClusterFailValue;
2964  enum _status {Good, Fail, Exit}status;
2965 
2966  status = Good;
2967 
2968  /* Settings based on FAT type */
2969  switch (dsk->type)
2970  {
2971 
2972 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
2973  case FAT32:
2974  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
2975  c2 = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32;
2976  break;
2977 #endif
2978  case FAT12:
2979  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16; // FAT16 value itself
2980  c2 = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT12;
2981  break;
2982  case FAT16:
2983  default:
2984  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
2985  c2 = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16;
2986  break;
2987  }
2988 
2989  // Make sure there is actually a cluster assigned
2990  if((cluster == 0) || (cluster == 1)) // Cluster assigned can't be "0" and "1"
2991  {
2992  status = Exit;
2993  }
2994  else
2995  {
2996  while(status == Good)
2997  {
2998  // Get the FAT entry
2999  if((c = ReadFAT( dsk, cluster)) == ClusterFailValue)
3000  status = Fail;
3001  else
3002  {
3003  if((c == 0) || (c == 1)) // Cluster assigned can't be "0" and "1"
3004  {
3005  status = Exit;
3006  }
3007  else
3008  {
3009  // compare against max value of a cluster in FATxx
3010  // look for the last cluster in the chain
3011  if ( c >= c2)
3012  status = Exit;
3013 
3014  // Now erase this FAT entry
3015  if(WriteFAT(dsk, cluster, CLUSTER_EMPTY, FALSE) == ClusterFailValue)
3016  status = Fail;
3017 
3018  // now update what the current cluster is
3019  cluster = c;
3020  }
3021  }
3022  }// while status
3023  }// cluster == 0
3024 
3025  WriteFAT (dsk, 0, 0, TRUE);
3026 
3027  if(status == Exit)
3028  return(TRUE);
3029  else
3030  return(FALSE);
3031 } // Erase cluster
3032 #endif
3033 
3034 /**************************************************************************
3035  Function:
3036  DIRENTRY Cache_File_Entry( FILEOBJ fo, WORD * curEntry, BYTE ForceRead)
3037  Summary:
3038  Load a file entry
3039  Conditions:
3040  This function should not be called by the user.
3041  Input:
3042  fo - File information
3043  curEntry - Offset of the directory entry to load.
3044  ForceRead - Forces loading of a new sector of the directory.
3045  Return:
3046  DIRENTRY - Pointer to the directory entry that was loaded.
3047  Side Effects:
3048  Any unwritten data in the data buffer will be written to the device.
3049  Description:
3050  Load the sector containing the file entry pointed to by 'curEntry'
3051  from the directory pointed to by the variables in 'fo.'
3052  Remarks:
3053  Any modification of this function is extremely likely to
3054  break something.
3055  **************************************************************************/
3056 
3057 DIRENTRY Cache_File_Entry( FILEOBJ fo, WORD * curEntry, BYTE ForceRead)
3058 {
3059  DIRENTRY dir;
3060  DISK *dsk;
3061  DWORD sector;
3062  DWORD cluster, LastClusterLimit;
3063  DWORD ccls;
3064  BYTE offset2;
3065  BYTE numofclus;
3066  BYTE dirEntriesPerSector;
3067 
3068  dsk = fo->dsk;
3069 
3070  // get the base sector of this directory
3071  cluster = fo->dirclus;
3072  ccls = fo->dirccls;
3073 
3074  dirEntriesPerSector = dsk->sectorSize/32;
3075 
3076  // figure out the offset from the base sector
3077  offset2 = (*curEntry / dirEntriesPerSector);
3078 
3079  /* Settings based on FAT type */
3080  switch (dsk->type)
3081  {
3082 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
3083  case FAT32:
3084  // the ROOT is always cluster based in FAT32
3085  /* In FAT32: There is no ROOT region. Root etries are made in DATA region only.
3086  Every cluster of DATA which is accupied by ROOT is tracked by FAT table/entry so the ROOT can grow
3087  to an amount which is restricted only by available free DATA region. */
3088  offset2 = offset2 % (dsk->SecPerClus); // figure out the offset
3089  LastClusterLimit = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32;
3090  break;
3091 #endif
3092  case FAT12:
3093  case FAT16:
3094  default:
3095  // if its the root its not cluster based
3096  if(cluster != 0)
3097  offset2 = offset2 % (dsk->SecPerClus); // figure out the offset
3098  LastClusterLimit = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16;
3099  break;
3100  }
3101 
3102  // check if a new sector of the root must be loaded
3103  if (ForceRead || ((*curEntry & MASK_MAX_FILE_ENTRY_LIMIT_BITS) == 0)) // only 16 entries per sector
3104  {
3105  // see if we have to load a new cluster
3106  if(((offset2 == 0) && (*curEntry >= dirEntriesPerSector)) || ForceRead)
3107  {
3108  if(cluster == 0)
3109  {
3110  ccls = 0;
3111  }
3112  else
3113  {
3114  // If ForceRead, read the number of sectors from 0
3115  if(ForceRead)
3116  numofclus = ((WORD)(*curEntry) / (WORD)(((WORD)dirEntriesPerSector) * (WORD)dsk->SecPerClus));
3117  // Otherwise just read the next sector
3118  else
3119  numofclus = 1;
3120 
3121  // move to the correct cluster
3122  while(numofclus)
3123  {
3124  ccls = ReadFAT(dsk, ccls);
3125 
3126  if(ccls >= LastClusterLimit)
3127  break;
3128  else
3129  numofclus--;
3130  }
3131  }
3132  }
3133 
3134  // see if that we have a valid cluster number
3135  if(ccls < LastClusterLimit)
3136  {
3137  fo->dirccls = ccls; // write it back
3138 
3139  sector = Cluster2Sector(dsk,ccls);
3140 
3141  /* see if we are root and about to go pass our boundaries
3142  FAT32 stores the root directory in the Data Region along with files and other directories,
3143  allowing it to grow without such a restraint */
3144  if((ccls == FatRootDirClusterValue) && ((sector + offset2) >= dsk->data) && (FAT32 != dsk->type))
3145  {
3146  dir = ((DIRENTRY)NULL); // reached the end of the root
3147  }
3148  else
3149  {
3150 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
3151  if (gNeedDataWrite)
3152  if (flushData())
3153  return NULL;
3154 #endif
3155  gBufferOwner = NULL;
3156  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
3157 
3158  if ( MDD_SectorRead( sector + offset2, dsk->buffer) != TRUE) // if FALSE: sector could not be read.
3159  {
3160  dir = ((DIRENTRY)NULL);
3161  }
3162  else // Sector has been read properly, Copy the root entry info of the file searched.
3163  {
3164  if(ForceRead) // Buffer holds all 16 root entry info. Point to the one required.
3165  dir = (DIRENTRY)((DIRENTRY)dsk->buffer) + ((*curEntry)%dirEntriesPerSector);
3166  else
3167  dir = (DIRENTRY)dsk->buffer;
3168  }
3169  gLastDataSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
3170  }
3171  }
3172  else
3173  {
3174  nextClusterIsLast = TRUE;
3175  dir = ((DIRENTRY)NULL);
3176  }
3177  }
3178  else
3179  dir = (DIRENTRY)((DIRENTRY)dsk->buffer) + ((*curEntry)%dirEntriesPerSector);
3180 
3181  return(dir);
3182 } // Cache_File_Entry
3183 
3184 
3185 /*************************************************************************
3186  Function:
3187  CETYPE CreateFileEntry(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE mode, BOOL createFirstCluster)
3188  Summary:
3189  Create a new file entry
3190  Conditions:
3191  Should not be called by the user.
3192  Input:
3193  fo - Pointer to file structure
3194  fHandle - Location to create file
3195  mode - DIRECTORY mode or ARCHIVE mode
3196  createFirstCluster - If set to TRUE, first cluster is created
3197  Return Values:
3198  CE_GOOD - File Creation successful
3199  CE_DIR_FULL - All root directory entries are taken
3200  CE_WRITE_ERROR - The head cluster of the file could not be created.
3201  Side Effects:
3202  Modifies the FSerrno variable.
3203  Description:
3204  With the data passed within fo, create a new file entry in the current
3205  directory. This function will first search for empty file entries.
3206  Once an empty entry is found, the entry will be populated with data
3207  for a file or directory entry. Finally, the first cluster of the
3208  new file will be located and allocated, and its value will be
3209  written into the file entry.
3210  Remarks:
3211  None
3212  *************************************************************************/
3213 
3214 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
3215 CETYPE CreateFileEntry(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE mode, BOOL createFirstCluster)
3216 {
3217  CETYPE error = CE_GOOD;
3218 
3219  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
3220  LFN_ENTRY *lfno;
3221  unsigned short int *templfnPtr = (unsigned short int *)fo -> utf16LFNptr,*dest;
3222  unsigned short int tempString[MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY];
3223  UINT16_VAL tempShift;
3224  BOOL firstTime = TRUE;
3225  BYTE checksum,sequenceNumber,reminder,tempCalc1,numberOfFileEntries;
3226  char index;
3227  char *src;
3228  #endif
3229 
3230  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
3231 
3232  *fHandle = 0;
3233 
3234  // figure out where to put this file in the directory stucture
3235  if(FindEmptyEntries(fo, fHandle) == FOUND)
3236  {
3237  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
3238  // If LFN entry
3239  if(fo->utf16LFNlength)
3240  {
3241  // Alias the LFN to short file name
3242  if(!Alias_LFN_Object(fo))
3243  {
3244  // If Aliasing of LFN is unsucessful
3245  error = FSerrno = CE_FILENAME_EXISTS;
3246  return(error);
3247  }
3248 
3249  src = fo -> name;
3250 
3251  // Find the checksum for Short file name of LFN
3252  checksum = 0;
3253  for (index = 11; index != 0; index--)
3254  {
3255  checksum = ((checksum & 1) ? 0x80 : 0) + (checksum >> 1) + *src++;
3256  }
3257 
3258  // File Name + NULL character is file name length in LFN
3259  fileNameLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
3260 
3261  // Determine the number of entries for LFN
3262  reminder = tempCalc1 = fileNameLength % MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
3263 
3264  numberOfFileEntries = fileNameLength/MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
3265 
3266  if(tempCalc1 || (fileNameLength < MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY))
3267  {
3268  numberOfFileEntries++;
3269  }
3270 
3271  // Max sequence number for LFN root entry
3272  sequenceNumber = numberOfFileEntries | 0x40;
3273 
3274  // Store the max sequence number entries in tempString
3275  if(tempCalc1)
3276  {
3277  index = 0;
3278  while(tempCalc1)
3279  {
3280  tempString[(BYTE)index++] = templfnPtr[fileNameLength - tempCalc1];
3281  tempCalc1--;
3282  }
3283 
3284  tempString[(BYTE)index++] = 0x0000;
3285 
3286  // Store the remaining bytes of max sequence number entries with 0xFF
3287  for(;index < MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;index++)
3288  {
3289  tempString[(BYTE)index] = 0xFFFF;
3290  }
3291  }
3292  else
3293  {
3294  // Store the remaining bytes of max sequence number entries with 0xFF
3295  for(index = MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;index > 0;index--)
3296  {
3297  tempString[MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY - (BYTE)index] = templfnPtr[fileNameLength - (BYTE)index];
3298  }
3299  }
3300 
3301  dest = &tempString[12];
3302 
3303  while(numberOfFileEntries)
3304  {
3305  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
3306  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, TRUE);
3307 
3308  if (lfno == NULL)
3309  {
3310  return CE_BADCACHEREAD;
3311  }
3312 
3313  // Write the 32 byte LFN Object as per FAT specification
3314  lfno->LFN_SequenceNo = sequenceNumber--; // Sequence number,
3315 
3316  lfno->LFN_Part3[1] = *dest--;
3317  lfno->LFN_Part3[0] = *dest--;
3318 
3319  lfno->LFN_Part2[5] = *dest--;
3320  lfno->LFN_Part2[4] = *dest--;
3321  lfno->LFN_Part2[3] = *dest--;
3322  lfno->LFN_Part2[2] = *dest--;
3323  lfno->LFN_Part2[1] = *dest--;
3324  lfno->LFN_Part2[0] = *dest--;
3325 
3326  tempShift.Val = *dest--;
3327  lfno->LFN_Part1[9] = tempShift.byte.HB;
3328  lfno->LFN_Part1[8] = tempShift.byte.LB;
3329  tempShift.Val = *dest--;
3330  lfno->LFN_Part1[7] = tempShift.byte.HB;
3331  lfno->LFN_Part1[6] = tempShift.byte.LB;
3332  tempShift.Val = *dest--;
3333  lfno->LFN_Part1[5] = tempShift.byte.HB;
3334  lfno->LFN_Part1[4] = tempShift.byte.LB;
3335  tempShift.Val = *dest--;
3336  lfno->LFN_Part1[3] = tempShift.byte.HB;
3337  lfno->LFN_Part1[2] = tempShift.byte.LB;
3338  tempShift.Val = *dest--;
3339  lfno->LFN_Part1[1] = tempShift.byte.HB;
3340  lfno->LFN_Part1[0] = tempShift.byte.LB;
3341 
3342  lfno->LFN_Attribute = ATTR_LONG_NAME;
3343  lfno->LFN_Type = 0;
3344  lfno->LFN_Checksum = checksum;
3345  lfno->LFN_Reserved2 = 0;
3346 
3347  // just write the last entry in
3348  if (Write_File_Entry(fo,fHandle) != TRUE)
3349  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
3350 
3351  // 0x40 should be ORed with only max sequence number & in
3352  // all other cases it should not be present
3353  sequenceNumber &= (~0x40);
3354  *fHandle = *fHandle + 1;
3355  numberOfFileEntries--;
3356 
3357  // Load the destination address only once and during first time,
3358  if(firstTime)
3359  {
3360  if(reminder)
3361  dest = (unsigned short int *)(fo -> utf16LFNptr + fileNameLength - reminder - 1);
3362  else
3363  dest = (unsigned short int *)(fo -> utf16LFNptr + fileNameLength - MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY - 1);
3364  firstTime = FALSE;
3365  }
3366  }
3367  }
3368  #endif
3369 
3370  // found the entry, now populate it
3371  if((error = PopulateEntries(fo, fHandle, mode)) == CE_GOOD)
3372  {
3373  if(createFirstCluster)
3374  // if everything is ok, create a first cluster
3375  error = CreateFirstCluster(fo);
3376  else
3377  {
3378 
3379  }
3380  }
3381  }
3382  else
3383  {
3384  error = CE_DIR_FULL;
3385  }
3386 
3387  FSerrno = error;
3388 
3389  return(error);
3390 }
3391 #endif
3392 
3393 /******************************************************
3394  Function:
3395  CETYPE CreateFirstCluster(FILEOBJ fo)
3396  Summary:
3397  Create the first cluster for a file
3398  Conditions:
3399  This function should not be called by the user.
3400  Input:
3401  fo - The file that contains the first cluster
3402  Return Values:
3403  CE_GOOD - First cluster created successfully
3404  CE_WRITE_ERROR - Cluster creation failed
3405  Side Effects:
3406  None
3407  Description:
3408  This function will find an unused cluster, link it to
3409  a file's directory entry, and write the entry back
3410  to the device.
3411  Remarks:
3412  None.
3413  ******************************************************/
3414 
3415 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
3416 CETYPE CreateFirstCluster(FILEOBJ fo)
3417 {
3418  CETYPE error;
3419  DWORD cluster,TempMsbCluster;
3420  WORD fHandle;
3421  DIRENTRY dir;
3422  fHandle = fo->entry;
3423 
3424  // Now create the first cluster (head cluster)
3425  if((error = FILECreateHeadCluster(fo,&cluster)) == CE_GOOD)
3426  {
3427  // load the file entry so the new cluster can be linked to it
3428  dir = LoadDirAttrib(fo, &fHandle);
3429 
3430  // Now update the new cluster
3431  dir->DIR_FstClusLO = (cluster & 0x0000FFFF);
3432 
3433 
3434 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
3435  // Get the higher part of cluster and store it in directory entry.
3436  TempMsbCluster = (cluster & 0x0FFF0000); // Since only 28 bits usedin FAT32. Mask the higher MSB nibble.
3437  TempMsbCluster = TempMsbCluster >> 16; // Get the date into Lsb place.
3438  dir->DIR_FstClusHI = TempMsbCluster;
3439 #else // If FAT32 support not enabled
3440  TempMsbCluster = 0; // Just to avoid compiler warnigng.
3441  dir->DIR_FstClusHI = 0;
3442 #endif
3443 
3444  // now write it
3445  if(Write_File_Entry(fo, &fHandle) != TRUE)
3446  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
3447  } // Create Cluster
3448 
3449  return(error);
3450 }// End of CreateFirstCluster
3451 #endif
3452 
3453 /**********************************************************
3454  Function:
3455  BYTE FindEmptyEntries(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
3456  Summary:
3457  Find an empty dir entry
3458  Conditions:
3459  This function should not be called by the user.
3460  Input:
3461  fo - Pointer to file structure
3462  fHandle - Start of entries
3463  Return Values:
3464  TRUE - One found
3465  FALSE - None found
3466  Side Effects:
3467  None
3468  Description:
3469  This function will cache directory entries, starting
3470  with the one pointed to by the fHandle argument. It will
3471  then search through the entries until an unused one
3472  is found. If the end of the cluster chain for the
3473  directory is reached, a new cluster will be allocated
3474  to the directory (unless it's a FAT12 or FAT16 root)
3475  and the first entry of the new cluster will be used.
3476  Remarks:
3477  None.
3478  **********************************************************/
3479 
3480 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
3481 BYTE FindEmptyEntries(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
3482 {
3483  BYTE status = NOT_FOUND;
3484  BYTE amountfound,numberOfFileEntries;
3485  BYTE a = 0;
3486  WORD bHandle = *fHandle;
3487  DWORD b;
3488  DIRENTRY dir;
3489 
3490  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
3491  if((dir = Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, TRUE)) != NULL)
3492  {
3493  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
3494  // If LFN entry
3495  if(fo->utf16LFNlength)
3496  {
3497  // File Name + NULL character is file name length in LFN
3498  fileNameLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
3499 
3500  // Determine the number of entries for LFN
3501  a = fileNameLength % MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
3502 
3503  numberOfFileEntries = fileNameLength/MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
3504 
3505  if(a || (fileNameLength < MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY))
3506  {
3507  numberOfFileEntries++;
3508  }
3509 
3510  // Increment by 1 so that you have space to store for assosciated short file name
3511  numberOfFileEntries = numberOfFileEntries + 1;
3512  }
3513  else
3514  #endif
3515  numberOfFileEntries = 1;
3516 
3517  // while its still not found
3518  while(status == NOT_FOUND)
3519  {
3520  amountfound = 0;
3521  bHandle = *fHandle;
3522 
3523  // find (number) continuous entries
3524  do
3525  {
3526  // Get the entry
3527  dir = Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, FALSE);
3528 
3529  // Read the first char of the file name
3530  if(dir != NULL) // Last entry of the cluster
3531  {
3532  a = dir->DIR_Name[0];
3533  }
3534  // increase number
3535  (*fHandle)++;
3536  }while((dir != (DIRENTRY)NULL) && ((a == DIR_DEL) || (a == DIR_EMPTY)) && (++amountfound < numberOfFileEntries));
3537 
3538  // --- now why did we exit?
3539  if(dir == NULL) // Last entry of the cluster
3540  {
3541  //setup the current cluster
3542  b = fo->dirccls; // write it back
3543 
3544  // make sure we are not the root directory
3545  if(b == FatRootDirClusterValue)
3546  {
3547  if (fo->dsk->type != FAT32)
3548  status = NO_MORE;
3549  else
3550  {
3551  fo->ccls = b;
3552 
3553  if(FILEallocate_new_cluster(fo, 1) == CE_DISK_FULL)
3554  status = NO_MORE;
3555  else
3556  status = FOUND; // a new cluster will surely hold a new file name
3557  }
3558  }
3559  else
3560  {
3561  fo->ccls = b;
3562 
3563  if(FILEallocate_new_cluster(fo, 1) == CE_DISK_FULL)
3564  status = NO_MORE;
3565  else
3566  {
3567  status = FOUND; // a new cluster will surely hold a new file name
3568  }
3569  }
3570  }
3571  else
3572  {
3573  if(amountfound == numberOfFileEntries)
3574  status = FOUND;
3575  }
3576  }// while
3577  }
3578 
3579  // copy the base handle over
3580  *fHandle = bHandle;
3581 
3582  return(status);
3583 }
3584 #endif
3585 
3586 /**************************************************************************
3587  Function:
3588  BYTE PopulateEntries(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE mode)
3589  Summary:
3590  Populate a dir entry with data
3591  Conditions:
3592  Should not be called by the user.
3593  Input:
3594  fo - Pointer to file structure
3595  fHandle - Location of the file
3596  mode - DIRECTORY mode or ARCHIVE mode
3597  Return Values:
3598  CE_GOOD - Population successful
3599  Side Effects:
3600  None
3601  Description:
3602  This function will write data into a new file entry. It will also
3603  load timestamp data (based on the method selected by the user) and
3604  update the timestamp variables.
3605  Remarks:
3606  None.
3607  **************************************************************************/
3608 
3609 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
3610 BYTE PopulateEntries(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE mode)
3611 {
3612  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
3613  DIRENTRY dir;
3614 
3615  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
3616  dir = Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, TRUE);
3617 
3618  if (dir == NULL)
3619  return CE_BADCACHEREAD;
3620 
3621  // copy the contents over
3622  strncpy(dir->DIR_Name,fo->name,DIR_NAMECOMP);
3623 
3624  // setup no attributes
3625  if (mode == DIRECTORY)
3626  dir->DIR_Attr = ATTR_DIRECTORY;
3627  else
3628  dir->DIR_Attr = ATTR_ARCHIVE;
3629 
3630  dir->DIR_NTRes = 0x00; // nt reserved
3631  dir->DIR_FstClusHI = 0x0000; // high word of this enty's first cluster number
3632  dir->DIR_FstClusLO = 0x0000; // low word of this entry's first cluster number
3633  dir->DIR_FileSize = 0x0; // file size in DWORD
3634 
3635  // Timing information for uncontrolled clock mode
3636 #ifdef INCREMENTTIMESTAMP
3637  dir->DIR_CrtTimeTenth = 0xB2; // millisecond stamp
3638  dir->DIR_CrtTime = 0x7278; // time created
3639  dir->DIR_CrtDate = 0x32B0; // date created
3640  dir->DIR_LstAccDate = 0x32B0; // Last Access date
3641  dir->DIR_WrtTime = 0x7279; // last update time
3642  dir->DIR_WrtDate = 0x32B0; // last update date
3643 #endif
3644 
3645 #ifdef USEREALTIMECLOCK
3646  CacheTime();
3647  dir->DIR_CrtTimeTenth = gTimeCrtMS; // millisecond stamp
3648  dir->DIR_CrtTime = gTimeCrtTime; // time created //
3649  dir->DIR_CrtDate = gTimeCrtDate; // date created (1/1/2004)
3650  dir->DIR_LstAccDate = gTimeAccDate; // Last Access date
3651  dir->DIR_WrtTime = gTimeWrtTime; // last update time
3652  dir->DIR_WrtDate = gTimeWrtDate; // last update date
3653 #endif
3654 
3655 #ifdef USERDEFINEDCLOCK
3656  // The user will have set the time before this funciton is called
3657  dir->DIR_CrtTimeTenth = gTimeCrtMS;
3658  dir->DIR_CrtTime = gTimeCrtTime;
3659  dir->DIR_CrtDate = gTimeCrtDate;
3660  dir->DIR_LstAccDate = gTimeAccDate;
3661  dir->DIR_WrtTime = gTimeWrtTime;
3662  dir->DIR_WrtDate = gTimeWrtDate;
3663 #endif
3664 
3665  fo->size = dir->DIR_FileSize;
3666  fo->time = dir->DIR_CrtTime;
3667  fo->date = dir->DIR_CrtDate;
3668  fo->attributes = dir->DIR_Attr;
3669  fo->entry = *fHandle;
3670 
3671  // just write the last entry in
3672  if (Write_File_Entry(fo,fHandle) != TRUE)
3673  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
3674 
3675  return(error);
3676 }
3677 
3678 /*****************************************************************
3679  Function:
3680  BOOL Alias_LFN_Object(FILEOBJ fo)
3681  Summary:
3682  Find the Short file name of the LFN entry
3683  Conditions:
3684  Long file name should be present.
3685  Input:
3686  fo - Pointer to file structure
3687  Return Values:
3688  FOUND - Operation successful
3689  NOT_FOUND - Operation failed
3690  Side Effects:
3691  None
3692  Description:
3693  This function will find the short file name
3694  of the long file name as mentioned in the FAT
3695  specs.
3696  Remarks:
3697  None.
3698  *****************************************************************/
3699 #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
3700 BOOL Alias_LFN_Object(FILEOBJ fo)
3701 {
3702  FSFILE filePtr1;
3703  FSFILE filePtr2;
3704  unsigned long int index4;
3705  short int lfnIndex,index1,index2;
3706  BYTE tempVariable,index;
3707  char tempString[8];
3708  char *lfnAliasPtr;
3709  unsigned short int *templfnPtr;
3710  BOOL result = FALSE;
3711 
3712  // copy file object over
3713  FileObjectCopy(&filePtr1, fo);
3714 
3715  lfnAliasPtr = (char *)&filePtr1.name[0];
3716 
3717  templfnPtr = (unsigned short int *)filePtr1.utf16LFNptr;
3718 
3719  fileNameLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
3720 
3721  // Initially fill the alias name with space characters
3722  for(index1 = 0;index1 < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3;index1++)
3723  {
3724  lfnAliasPtr[index1] = ' ';
3725  }
3726 
3727  // find the location where '.' is present
3728  for(lfnIndex = fileNameLength - 1;lfnIndex > 0;lfnIndex--)
3729  {
3730  if (templfnPtr[lfnIndex] == '.')
3731  {
3732  break;
3733  }
3734  }
3735 
3736  index1 = lfnIndex + 1;
3737 
3738  tempVariable = 0;
3739  if(lfnIndex)
3740  {
3741  index2 = 8;
3742  // Complete the extension part as per the FAT specifications
3743  for(;((index1 < fileNameLength) && (tempVariable < 3));index1++)
3744  {
3745  // Convert lower-case to upper-case
3746  index = (BYTE)templfnPtr[index1];
3747  if ((index >= 0x61) && (index <= 0x7A))
3748  {
3749  lfnAliasPtr[index2++] = index - 0x20;
3750  }
3751  else if(index == ' ')
3752  {
3753  continue;
3754  }
3755  else if ((index == 0x2B) || (index == 0x2C) || (index == 0x3B) ||
3756  (index == 0x3D) || (index == 0x5B) || (index == 0x5D) ||
3757  (templfnPtr[index1] > 0xFF))
3758  {
3759  lfnAliasPtr[index2++] = '_';
3760  }
3761  else
3762  {
3763  lfnAliasPtr[index2++] = index;
3764  }
3765 
3766  tempVariable++;
3767  }
3768 
3769  index2 = lfnIndex;
3770  tempVariable = 0;
3771  }
3772  else
3773  {
3774  index2 = fileNameLength;
3775  }
3776 
3777  // Fill the base part as per the FAT specifications
3778  for(index1 = 0;((index1 < index2) && (tempVariable < 6));index1++)
3779  {
3780  // Convert lower-case to upper-case
3781  index = (BYTE)templfnPtr[index1];
3782  if ((index >= 0x61) && (index <= 0x7A))
3783  {
3784  lfnAliasPtr[tempVariable] = index - 0x20;
3785  }
3786  else if(index == ' ')
3787  {
3788  continue;
3789  }
3790  else if ((index == 0x2B) || (index == 0x2C) || (index == 0x3B) ||
3791  (index == 0x3D) || (index == 0x5B) || (index == 0x5D) ||
3792  (templfnPtr[index1] > 0xFF))
3793  {
3794  lfnAliasPtr[tempVariable] = '_';
3795  }
3796  else
3797  {
3798  lfnAliasPtr[tempVariable] = index;
3799  }
3800  tempVariable++;
3801  }
3802 
3803  // Aliasing of the predicted name should append ~1
3804  lfnAliasPtr[tempVariable] = '~';
3805  lfnAliasPtr[tempVariable + 1] = '1';
3806 
3807  filePtr1.attributes = ATTR_ARCHIVE;
3808 
3809  filePtr1.utf16LFNlength = 0;
3810 
3811  // Try for 9999999 combinations before telling error to the user
3812  for(index4 = 1;index4 < (unsigned long int)10000000;index4++)
3813  {
3814  filePtr1.cluster = 0;
3815  filePtr1.ccls = 0;
3816  filePtr1.entry = 0;
3817 
3818  // start at the current directory
3819  #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
3820  filePtr1.dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
3821  filePtr1.dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
3822  #else
3823  filePtr1.dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
3824  filePtr1.dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
3825  #endif
3826 
3827  // copy file object over
3828  FileObjectCopy(&filePtr2, &filePtr1);
3829 
3830  // See if the file is found
3831  if(FILEfind (&filePtr2, &filePtr1, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) == CE_GOOD)
3832  {
3833  tempString[7] = index4 % (BYTE)10 + '0';
3834  tempString[6] = (index4 % (BYTE)100)/10 + '0';
3835  tempString[5] = (index4 % 1000)/100 + '0';
3836  tempString[4] = (index4 % 10000)/1000 + '0';
3837  tempString[3] = (index4 % 100000)/10000 + '0';
3838  tempString[2] = (index4 % 1000000)/100000 + '0';
3839  if((tempString[1] = ((index4 % 10000000)/1000000 + '0')) != '0')
3840  {
3841  tempString[index = 0] = '~';
3842  }
3843  else
3844  {
3845  for(index = 6;index > 0;index--)
3846  {
3847  if((tempString[index] == '0') && (tempString[index - 1] == '0'))
3848  {
3849  tempString[index] = '~';
3850  if(!filePtr1.AsciiEncodingType)
3851  {
3852  if(index % 2)
3853  {
3854  for(index2 = index - 1;index2 < 7;index2++)
3855  {
3856  tempString[index2] = tempString[index2 + 1];
3857  }
3858  tempString[7] = ' ';
3859  index--;
3860  }
3861  }
3862  break;
3863  }
3864  }
3865  }
3866 
3867  if(index >= tempVariable)
3868  {
3869  index1 = tempVariable;
3870  }
3871  else
3872  {
3873  index1 = index;
3874  }
3875 
3876  while(index < 8)
3877  {
3878  filePtr1.name[index1++] = tempString[index++];
3879  }
3880 
3881  // Store the remaining bytes with leading spaces
3882  while(index1 < 8)
3883  {
3884  filePtr1.name[index1++] = ' ';
3885  }
3886 
3887  }
3888  else
3889  {
3890  // short file name is found.Store it & quit
3891  lfnAliasPtr = &fo->name[0];
3892 
3893  for(index = 0;index < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3;index++)
3894  {
3895  lfnAliasPtr[index] = filePtr1.name[index];
3896  }
3897 
3898  result = TRUE;
3899  break;
3900  }
3901  }
3902 
3903  return(result);
3904 
3905 } // Alias_LFN_Object
3906 #endif
3907 
3908 #ifdef USEREALTIMECLOCK
3909 
3910 /*************************************************************************
3911  Function:
3912  void CacheTime (void)
3913  Summary:
3914  Automatically store timestamp information from the RTCC
3915  Conditions:
3916  RTCC module enabled. Should not be called by the user.
3917  Return Values:
3918  None
3919  Side Effects:
3920  Modifies global timing variables
3921  Description:
3922  This function will automatically load information from an RTCC
3923  module and use it to update the global timing variables. These can
3924  then be used to update file timestamps.
3925  Remarks:
3926  None.
3927  *************************************************************************/
3928 
3929 void CacheTime (void)
3930 {
3931  WORD year, monthday, weekhour, minsec, c, result;
3932 
3933 #if defined (__PIC32MX__) // Added support for PIC32. -Bud (3/4/2008)
3934 
3935  unsigned int t0, t1;
3936  unsigned int d0, d1;
3937 
3938  do // Get the time
3939  {
3940  t0=RTCTIME;
3941  t1=RTCTIME;
3942  }while(t0!=t1);
3943 
3944  do // Get the date
3945  {
3946  d0=RTCDATE;
3947  d1=RTCDATE;
3948  }while(d0!=d1);
3949 
3950  // Put them in place.
3951  year = (WORD)(d0 >> 24);
3952  monthday = (WORD)(d0 >> 8);
3953  weekhour = (WORD)((d0 & 0x0F) << 8);
3954  weekhour |= (WORD)(t0 >> 24);
3955  minsec = (WORD)(t0 >> 8);
3956 
3957 #else
3958  BYTE ptr1, ptr0;
3959  if(RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR0)
3960  ptr0 = 1;
3961  else
3962  ptr0 = 0;
3963  if (RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR1)
3964  ptr1 = 1;
3965  else
3966  ptr1 = 0;
3967 
3968  RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR0 = 1;
3969  RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR1 = 1;
3970  year = RTCVAL;
3971  monthday = RTCVAL;
3972  weekhour = RTCVAL;
3973  minsec = RTCVAL;
3974 
3975  if (ptr0 == 1)
3976  RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR0 = 1;
3977 
3978  if (ptr1 == 1)
3979  RCFGCALbits.RTCPTR1 = 1;
3980 
3981 #endif
3982 
3983  c = 0;
3984  c += (year & 0x0F);
3985  c += ((year & 0xF0) >> 4) * 10;
3986  // c equals the last 2 digits of the year from 2000 to 2099
3987  // Add 20 to adjust it to FAT time (from 1980 to 2107)
3988  c += 20;
3989  // shift the result to bits
3990  result = c << 9;
3991 
3992  if ((monthday & 0x1000) == 0x1000)
3993  {
3994  c = 10;
3995  }
3996  else
3997  {
3998  c = 0;
3999  }
4000  c += ((monthday & 0x0F00) >> 8);
4001  c <<= 5;
4002  result |= c;
4003 
4004  c = (monthday & 0x00F0) >> 4;
4005  c *= 10;
4006  c += (monthday & 0x000F);
4007 
4008  result |= c;
4009 
4010  gTimeCrtDate = result;
4011  gTimeWrtDate = result;
4012  gTimeAccDate = result;
4013 
4014  c = ((weekhour & 0x00F0) >> 4) * 10;
4015  c += (weekhour & 0x000F);
4016  result = c << 11;
4017  c = ((minsec & 0xF000) >> 12) * 10;
4018  c += (minsec & 0x0F00) >> 8;
4019  result |= (c << 5);
4020  c = ((minsec & 0x00F0) >> 4) * 10;
4021  c += (minsec & 0x000F);
4022 
4023  // If seconds mod 2 is 1, add 1000 ms
4024  if (c % 2)
4025  gTimeCrtMS = 100;
4026  else
4027  gTimeCrtMS = 0;
4028 
4029  c >>= 1;
4030  result |= c;
4031 
4032  gTimeCrtTime = result;
4033  gTimeWrtTime = result;
4034 }
4035 #endif
4036 
4037 #ifdef USERDEFINEDCLOCK
4038 
4039 /***********************************************************************************************************
4040  Function:
4041  int SetClockVars (unsigned int year, unsigned char month, unsigned char day, unsigned char hour, unsigned char minute, unsigned char second)
4042  Summary:
4043  Manually set timestamp variables
4044  Conditions:
4045  USERDEFINEDCLOCK macro defined in FSconfig.h.
4046  Input:
4047  year - The year (1980\-2107)
4048  month - The month (1\-12)
4049  day - The day of the month (1\-31)
4050  hour - The hour (0\-23)
4051  minute - The minute (0\-59)
4052  second - The second (0\-59)
4053  Return Values:
4054  None
4055  Side Effects:
4056  Modifies global timing variables
4057  Description:
4058  Lets the user manually set the timing variables. The values passed in will be converted to the format
4059  used by the FAT timestamps.
4060  Remarks:
4061  Call this before creating a file or directory (set create time) and
4062  before closing a file (set last access time, last modified time)
4063  ***********************************************************************************************************/
4064 
4065 int SetClockVars (unsigned int year, unsigned char month, unsigned char day, unsigned char hour, unsigned char minute, unsigned char second)
4066 {
4067  unsigned int result;
4068 
4069  if ((year < 1980) || (year > 2107) || (month < 1) || (month > 12) ||
4070  (day < 1) || (day > 31) || (hour > 23) || (minute > 59) || (second > 59))
4071  {
4072  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
4073  return -1;
4074  }
4075 
4076  result = (year - 1980) << 9;
4077  result |= (unsigned int)((unsigned int)month << 5);
4078  result |= (day);
4079 
4080  gTimeAccDate = result;
4081  gTimeCrtDate = result;
4082  gTimeWrtDate = result;
4083 
4084  result = ((unsigned int)hour << 11);
4085  result |= (unsigned int)((unsigned int)minute << 5);
4086  result |= (second/2);
4087 
4088  gTimeCrtTime = result;
4089  gTimeWrtTime = result;
4090 
4091  if (second % 2)
4092  gTimeCrtMS = 100;
4093  else
4094  gTimeCrtMS = 0;
4095 
4096  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
4097  return 0;
4098 }
4099 #endif
4100 
4101 #endif
4102 
4103 /***********************************************************************
4104  Function:
4105  BYTE FILEallocate_new_cluster( FILEOBJ fo, BYTE mode)
4106  Summary;
4107  Allocate a new cluster to a file
4108  Conditions:
4109  Should not be called by the user.
4110  Input:
4111  fo - Pointer to file structure
4112  mode -
4113  - 0 - Allocate a cluster to a file
4114  - 1 - Allocate a cluster to a directory
4115  Return Values:
4116  CE_GOOD - Cluster allocated
4117  CE_DISK_FULL - No clusters available
4118  Side Effects:
4119  None
4120  Description:
4121  This function will find an empty cluster on the device using the
4122  FATfindEmptyCluster function. It will then mark it as the last
4123  cluster in the file in the FAT chain, and link the current last
4124  cluster of the passed file to the new cluster. If the new
4125  cluster is a directory cluster, it will be erased (so there are no
4126  extraneous directory entries). If it's allocated to a non-directory
4127  file, it doesn't need to be erased; extraneous data in the cluster
4128  will be unviewable because of the file size parameter.
4129  Remarks:
4130  None.
4131  ***********************************************************************/
4132 
4133 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
4134 BYTE FILEallocate_new_cluster( FILEOBJ fo, BYTE mode)
4135 {
4136  DISK * dsk;
4137  DWORD c,curcls;
4138 
4139  dsk = fo->dsk;
4140  c = fo->ccls;
4141 
4142  // find the next empty cluster
4143  c = FATfindEmptyCluster(fo);
4144  if (c == 0) // "0" is just an indication as Disk full in the fn "FATfindEmptyCluster()"
4145  return CE_DISK_FULL;
4146 
4147 
4148  // mark the cluster as taken, and last in chain
4149  if(dsk->type == FAT12)
4150  WriteFAT( dsk, c, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT12, FALSE);
4151  else if (dsk->type == FAT16)
4152  WriteFAT( dsk, c, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16, FALSE);
4153 
4154 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
4155  else
4156  WriteFAT( dsk, c, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32, FALSE);
4157 #endif
4158 
4159  // link current cluster to the new one
4160  curcls = fo->ccls;
4161 
4162  WriteFAT( dsk, curcls, c, FALSE);
4163 
4164  // update the FILE structure
4165  fo->ccls = c;
4166 
4167  // IF this is a dir, we need to erase the cluster
4168  // If it's a file, we can leave it- the file size
4169  // will limit the data we see to the data that's been
4170  // written
4171  if (mode == 1)
4172  return (EraseCluster(dsk, c));
4173  else
4174  return CE_GOOD;
4175 
4176 } // allocate new cluster
4177 #endif
4178 
4179 /***********************************************
4180  Function:
4181  DWORD FATfindEmptyCluster(FILEOBJ fo)
4182  Summary:
4183  Find the next available cluster on the device
4184  Conditions:
4185  This function should not be called by the
4186  user.
4187  Input:
4188  fo - Pointer to file structure
4189  Return Values:
4190  DWORD - Address of empty cluster
4191  0 - Could not find empty cluster
4192  Side Effects:
4193  None
4194  Description:
4195  This function will search through the FAT to
4196  find the next available cluster on the device.
4197  Remarks:
4198  Should not be called by user
4199  ***********************************************/
4200 
4201 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
4202 DWORD FATfindEmptyCluster(FILEOBJ fo)
4203 {
4204  DISK * disk;
4205  DWORD value = 0x0;
4206  DWORD c,curcls, EndClusterLimit, ClusterFailValue;
4207 
4208  disk = fo->dsk;
4209  c = fo->ccls;
4210 
4211  /* Settings based on FAT type */
4212  switch (disk->type)
4213  {
4214 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
4215  case FAT32:
4216  EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT32;
4217  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
4218  break;
4219 #endif
4220  case FAT12:
4221  EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT12;
4222  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
4223  break;
4224  case FAT16:
4225  default:
4226  EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT16;
4227  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
4228  break;
4229  }
4230 
4231  // just in case
4232  if(c < 2)
4233  c = 2;
4234 
4235  curcls = c;
4236  ReadFAT(disk, c);
4237 
4238  // sequentially scan through the FAT looking for an empty cluster
4239  while(c)
4240  {
4241  // look at its value
4242  if ( (value = ReadFAT(disk, c)) == ClusterFailValue)
4243  {
4244  c = 0;
4245  break;
4246  }
4247 
4248  // check if empty cluster found
4249  if (value == CLUSTER_EMPTY)
4250  break;
4251 
4252  c++; // check next cluster in FAT
4253  // check if reached last cluster in FAT, re-start from top
4254  if ((value == EndClusterLimit) || (c >= (disk->maxcls+2)))
4255  c = 2;
4256 
4257  // check if full circle done, disk full
4258  if ( c == curcls)
4259  {
4260  c = 0;
4261  break;
4262  }
4263  } // scanning for an empty cluster
4264 
4265  return(c);
4266 }
4267 #endif
4268 
4269 
4270 /*********************************************************************************
4271  Function:
4272  void FSGetDiskProperties(FS_DISK_PROPERTIES* properties)
4273  Summary:
4274  Allows user to get the disk properties (size of disk, free space, etc)
4275  Conditions:
4276  1) ALLOW_GET_DISK_PROPERTIES must be defined in FSconfig.h
4277  2) a FS_DISK_PROPERTIES object must be created before the function is called
4278  3) the new_request member of the FS_DISK_PROPERTIES object must be set before
4279  calling the function for the first time. This will start a new search.
4280  4) this function should not be called while there is a file open. Close all
4281  files before calling this function.
4282  Input:
4283  properties - a pointer to a FS_DISK_PROPERTIES object where the results should
4284  be stored.
4285  Return Values:
4286  This function returns void. The properties_status of the previous call of this
4287  function is located in the properties.status field. This field has the
4288  following possible values:
4289 
4290  FS_GET_PROPERTIES_NO_ERRORS - operation completed without error. Results
4291  are in the properties object passed into the function.
4292  FS_GET_PROPERTIES_DISK_NOT_MOUNTED - there is no mounted disk. Results in
4293  properties object is not valid
4294  FS_GET_PROPERTIES_CLUSTER_FAILURE - there was a failure trying to read a
4295  cluster from the drive. The results in the properties object is a partial
4296  result up until the point of the failure.
4297  FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING - the search for free sectors is still in
4298  process. Continue calling this function with the same properties pointer
4299  until either the function completes or until the partial results meets the
4300  application needs. The properties object contains the partial results of
4301  the search and can be used by the application.
4302  Side Effects:
4303  Can cause errors if called when files are open. Close all files before
4304  calling this function.
4305 
4306  Calling this function without setting the new_request member on the first
4307  call can result in undefined behavior and results.
4308 
4309  Calling this function after a result is returned other than
4310  FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING can result in undefined behavior and results.
4311  Description:
4312  This function returns the information about the mounted drive. The results
4313  member of the properties object passed into the function is populated with
4314  the information about the drive.
4315 
4316  Before starting a new request, the new_request member of the properties
4317  input parameter should be set to TRUE. This will initiate a new search
4318  request.
4319 
4320  This function will return before the search is complete with partial results.
4321  All of the results except the free_clusters will be correct after the first
4322  call. The free_clusters will contain the number of free clusters found up
4323  until that point, thus the free_clusters result will continue to grow until
4324  the entire drive is searched. If an application only needs to know that a
4325  certain number of bytes is available and doesn't need to know the total free
4326  size, then this function can be called until the required free size is
4327  verified. To continue a search, pass a pointer to the same FS_DISK_PROPERTIES
4328  object that was passed in to create the search.
4329 
4330  A new search request sould be made once this function has returned a value
4331  other than FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING. Continuing a completed search
4332  can result in undefined behavior or results.
4333 
4334  Typical Usage:
4335  <code>
4336  FS_DISK_PROPERTIES disk_properties;
4337 
4338  disk_properties.new_request = TRUE;
4339 
4340  do
4341  {
4342  FSGetDiskProperties(&disk_properties);
4343  } while (disk_properties.properties_status == FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING);
4344  </code>
4345 
4346  results.disk_format - contains the format of the drive. Valid results are
4347  FAT12(1), FAT16(2), or FAT32(3).
4348 
4349  results.sector_size - the sector size of the mounted drive. Valid values are
4350  512, 1024, 2048, and 4096.
4351 
4352  results.sectors_per_cluster - the number sectors per cluster.
4353 
4354  results.total_clusters - the number of total clusters on the drive. This
4355  can be used to calculate the total disk size (total_clusters *
4356  sectors_per_cluster * sector_size = total size of drive in bytes)
4357 
4358  results.free_clusters - the number of free (unallocated) clusters on the drive.
4359  This can be used to calculate the total free disk size (free_clusters *
4360  sectors_per_cluster * sector_size = total size of drive in bytes)
4361 
4362  Remarks:
4363  PIC24F size estimates:
4364  Flash - 400 bytes (-Os setting)
4365 
4366  PIC24F speed estimates:
4367  Search takes approximately 7 seconds per Gigabyte of drive space. Speed
4368  will vary based on the number of sectors per cluster and the sector size.
4369  *********************************************************************************/
4370 #if defined(ALLOW_GET_DISK_PROPERTIES)
4371 void FSGetDiskProperties(FS_DISK_PROPERTIES* properties)
4372 {
4373  BYTE i;
4374  DWORD value = 0x0;
4375 
4376  if(properties->new_request == TRUE)
4377  {
4378  properties->disk = &gDiskData;
4379  properties->results.free_clusters = 0;
4380  properties->new_request = FALSE;
4381 
4382  if(properties->disk->mount != TRUE)
4383  {
4384  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_DISK_NOT_MOUNTED;
4385  return;
4386  }
4387 
4388  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING;
4389 
4390  properties->results.disk_format = properties->disk->type;
4391  properties->results.sector_size = properties->disk->sectorSize;
4392  properties->results.sectors_per_cluster = properties->disk->SecPerClus;
4393  properties->results.total_clusters = properties->disk->maxcls;
4394 
4395  /* Settings based on FAT type */
4396  switch (properties->disk->type)
4397  {
4398  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
4399  case FAT32:
4400  properties->private.EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT32;
4401  properties->private.ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
4402  break;
4403  #endif
4404  case FAT16:
4405  properties->private.EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT16;
4406  properties->private.ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
4407  break;
4408  case FAT12:
4409  properties->private.EndClusterLimit = END_CLUSTER_FAT12;
4410  properties->private.ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
4411  break;
4412  }
4413 
4414  properties->private.c = 2;
4415 
4416  properties->private.curcls = properties->private.c;
4417  ReadFAT(properties->disk, properties->private.c);
4418  }
4419 
4420  if(properties->disk == NULL)
4421  {
4422  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_DISK_NOT_MOUNTED;
4423  return;
4424  }
4425 
4426  if(properties->properties_status != FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING)
4427  {
4428  return;
4429  }
4430 
4431  // sequentially scan through the FAT looking for an empty cluster
4432  for(i=0;i<255;i++)
4433  {
4434  // look at its value
4435  if ( (value = ReadFAT(properties->disk, properties->private.c)) == properties->private.ClusterFailValue)
4436  {
4437  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_CLUSTER_FAILURE;
4438  return;
4439  }
4440 
4441  // check if empty cluster found
4442  if (value == CLUSTER_EMPTY)
4443  {
4444  properties->results.free_clusters++;
4445  }
4446 
4447  properties->private.c++; // check next cluster in FAT
4448  // check if reached last cluster in FAT, re-start from top
4449  if ((value == properties->private.EndClusterLimit) || (properties->private.c >= (properties->results.total_clusters + 2)))
4450  properties->private.c = 2;
4451 
4452  // check if full circle done, disk full
4453  if ( properties->private.c == properties->private.curcls)
4454  {
4455  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_NO_ERRORS;
4456  return;
4457  }
4458  } // scanning for an empty cluster
4459 
4460  properties->properties_status = FS_GET_PROPERTIES_STILL_WORKING;
4461  return;
4462 }
4463 #endif
4464 
4465 /************************************************************
4466  Function:
4467  int FSfclose(FSFILE *fo)
4468  Summary:
4469  Update file information and free FSFILE objects
4470  Conditions:
4471  File opened
4472  Input:
4473  fo - Pointer to the file to close
4474  Return Values:
4475  0 - File closed successfully
4476  EOF - Error closing the file
4477  Side Effects:
4478  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
4479  Description:
4480  This function will update the directory entry for the
4481  file pointed to by 'fo' with the information contained
4482  in 'fo,' including the new file size and attributes.
4483  Timestamp information will also be loaded based on the
4484  method selected by the user and written to the entry
4485  as the last modified time and date. The file entry will
4486  then be written to the device. Finally, the memory
4487  used for the specified file object will be freed from
4488  the dynamic heap or the array of FSFILE objects.
4489  Remarks:
4490  A function to flush data to the device without closing the
4491  file can be created by removing the portion of this
4492  function that frees the memory and the line that clears
4493  the write flag.
4494  ************************************************************/
4495 
4496 int FSfclose(FSFILE *fo)
4497 {
4498  WORD fHandle;
4499 #ifndef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
4500  WORD fIndex;
4501 #endif
4502  int error = 72;
4503 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
4504  DIRENTRY dir;
4505 #endif
4506 
4507  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
4508  fHandle = fo->entry;
4509 
4510 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
4511  if(fo->flags.write)
4512  {
4513  if (gNeedDataWrite)
4514  {
4515  if (flushData())
4516  {
4517  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
4518  return EOF;
4519  }
4520  }
4521 
4522  // Write the current FAT sector to the disk
4523  WriteFAT (fo->dsk, 0, 0, TRUE);
4524 
4525  // Invalidate the currently cached FAT entry so that the next read will
4526  // result in an acutal read from the physical media instead of a read
4527  // from the RAM cache.
4528  gLastFATSectorRead = 0;
4529 
4530  // Read the FAT entry from the physical media. This is required because
4531  // some physical media cache the entries in RAM and only write them
4532  // after a time expires for until the sector is accessed again.
4533  ReadFAT (fo->dsk, fo->ccls);
4534 
4535  // Get the file entry
4536  dir = LoadDirAttrib(fo, &fHandle);
4537 
4538  if (dir == NULL)
4539  {
4540  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
4541  error = EOF;
4542  return error;
4543  }
4544 
4545  // update the time
4546 #ifdef INCREMENTTIMESTAMP
4547  IncrementTimeStamp(dir);
4548 #elif defined USERDEFINEDCLOCK
4549  dir->DIR_WrtTime = gTimeWrtTime;
4550  dir->DIR_WrtDate = gTimeWrtDate;
4551 #elif defined USEREALTIMECLOCK
4552  CacheTime();
4553  dir->DIR_WrtTime = gTimeWrtTime;
4554  dir->DIR_WrtDate = gTimeWrtDate;
4555 #endif
4556 
4557  dir->DIR_FileSize = fo->size;
4558 
4559  dir->DIR_Attr = fo->attributes;
4560 
4561  // just write the last entry in
4562  if(Write_File_Entry(fo,&fHandle))
4563  {
4564  // Read the folder entry from the physical media. This is required because
4565  // some physical media cache the entries in RAM and only write them
4566  // after a time expires for until the sector is accessed again.
4567  dir = LoadDirAttrib(fo, &fHandle);
4568  error = 0;
4569  }
4570  else
4571  {
4572  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
4573  error = EOF;
4574  }
4575 
4576  // Clear the write acess to file
4577  fo->flags.write = FALSE;
4578  }
4579 #endif
4580 
4581  // Clear the read acess to file
4582  fo->flags.read = FALSE;
4583 
4584 #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
4585  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
4586  FS_free((unsigned char *)fo->utf16LFNptr);
4587  #endif
4588  FS_free((unsigned char *)fo);
4589 #else
4590 
4591  for( fIndex = 0; fIndex < FS_MAX_FILES_OPEN; fIndex++ )
4592  {
4593  if( fo == &gFileArray[fIndex] )
4594  {
4595  gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] = TRUE;
4596  break;
4597  }
4598  }
4599 
4600  // Set Null pointer to close the file, to prevent inadvertent acess
4601  fo = NULL;
4602 #endif
4603 
4604  // File opened in read mode
4605  if (error == 72)
4606  error = 0;
4607 
4608  return(error);
4609 } // FSfclose
4610 
4611 
4612 /*******************************************************
4613  Function:
4614  void IncrementTimeStamp(DIRENTRY dir)
4615  Summary:
4616  Automatically set the timestamp to "don't care" data
4617  Conditions:
4618  Should not be called by the user.
4619  Input:
4620  dir - Pointer to directory structure
4621  Return Values:
4622  None
4623  Side Effects:
4624  None
4625  Description:
4626  This function will increment the timestamp variable in
4627  the 'dir' directory entry. This is used for the
4628  don't-care timing method.
4629  Remarks:
4630  None
4631  *******************************************************/
4632 #ifdef INCREMENTTIMESTAMP
4633 void IncrementTimeStamp(DIRENTRY dir)
4634 {
4635  BYTE seconds;
4636  BYTE minutes;
4637  BYTE hours;
4638 
4639  BYTE day;
4640  BYTE month;
4641  BYTE year;
4642 
4643  seconds = (dir->DIR_WrtTime & 0x1f);
4644  minutes = ((dir->DIR_WrtTime & 0x07E0) >> 5);
4645  hours = ((dir->DIR_WrtTime & 0xF800) >> 11);
4646 
4647  day = (dir->DIR_WrtDate & 0x1f);
4648  month = ((dir->DIR_WrtDate & 0x01E0) >> 5);
4649  year = ((dir->DIR_WrtDate & 0xFE00) >> 9);
4650 
4651  if(seconds < 29)
4652  {
4653  // Increment number of seconds by 2
4654  // This clock method isn't intended to be accurate anyway
4655  seconds++;
4656  }
4657  else
4658  {
4659  seconds = 0x00;
4660 
4661  if(minutes < 59)
4662  {
4663  minutes++;
4664  }
4665  else
4666  {
4667  minutes = 0;
4668 
4669  if(hours < 23)
4670  {
4671  hours++;
4672  }
4673  else
4674  {
4675  hours = 0;
4676  if(day < 30)
4677  {
4678  day++;
4679  }
4680  else
4681  {
4682  day = 1;
4683 
4684  if(month < 12)
4685  {
4686  month++;
4687  }
4688  else
4689  {
4690  month = 1;
4691  // new year
4692  year++;
4693  // This is only valid until 2107
4694  }
4695  }
4696  }
4697  }
4698  }
4699 
4700  dir->DIR_WrtTime = (WORD)(seconds);
4701  dir->DIR_WrtTime |= ((WORD)(minutes) << 5);
4702  dir->DIR_WrtTime |= ((WORD)(hours) << 11);
4703 
4704  dir->DIR_WrtDate = (WORD)(day);
4705  dir->DIR_WrtDate |= ((WORD)(month) << 5);
4706  dir->DIR_WrtDate |= ((WORD)(year) << 9);
4707 }
4708 #endif
4709 
4710 /*****************************************************************
4711  Function:
4712  BYTE Fill_File_Object(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
4713  Summary:
4714  Fill a file object with specified dir entry data
4715  Conditions:
4716  This function should not be called by the user.
4717  Input:
4718  fo - Pointer to file structure
4719  fHandle - Passed member's location
4720  Return Values:
4721  FOUND - Operation successful
4722  NOT_FOUND - Operation failed
4723  Side Effects:
4724  None
4725  Description:
4726  This function will cache the sector of directory entries
4727  in the directory pointed to by the dirclus value in
4728  the FSFILE object 'fo' that contains the entry that
4729  corresponds to the fHandle offset. It will then copy
4730  the file information for that entry into the 'fo' FSFILE
4731  object.
4732  Remarks:
4733  None.
4734  *****************************************************************/
4735 
4736 BYTE Fill_File_Object(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
4737 {
4738  DIRENTRY dir;
4739  BYTE index, a;
4740  BYTE character;
4741  BYTE status;
4742  BYTE test = 0;
4743 
4744  // Get the entry
4745  if (((*fHandle & MASK_MAX_FILE_ENTRY_LIMIT_BITS) == 0) && (*fHandle != 0)) // 4-bit mask because 16-root entries max per sector
4746  {
4747  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
4748  dir = Cache_File_Entry(fo, fHandle, TRUE);
4749  }
4750  else
4751  {
4752  dir = Cache_File_Entry (fo, fHandle, FALSE);
4753  }
4754 
4755 
4756  // Make sure there is a directory left
4757  if(dir == (DIRENTRY)NULL)
4758  {
4759  status = NO_MORE;
4760  }
4761  else
4762  {
4763  // Read the first char of the file name
4764  a = dir->DIR_Name[0];
4765 
4766  // Check for empty or deleted directory
4767  if ( a == DIR_DEL)
4768  {
4769  status = NOT_FOUND;
4770  }
4771  else if ( a == DIR_EMPTY)
4772  {
4773  status = NO_MORE;
4774  }
4775  else
4776  {
4777  // Get the attributes
4778  a = dir->DIR_Attr;
4779 
4780  // print the file name and extension
4781  for (index=0; index < DIR_NAMESIZE; index++)
4782  {
4783  character = dir->DIR_Name[index];
4784  character = (BYTE)toupper(character);
4785  fo->name[test++] = character;
4786  }
4787 
4788  // Get the attributes
4789  a = dir->DIR_Attr;
4790 
4791  // its possible to have an extension in a directory
4792  character = dir->DIR_Extension[0];
4793 
4794  // Get the file extension if its there
4795  for (index=0; index < DIR_EXTENSION; index++)
4796  {
4797  character = dir->DIR_Extension[index];
4798  character = (BYTE)toupper(character);
4799  fo->name[test++] = character;
4800  }
4801 
4802  // done and done with the name
4803  // fo->name[++test] = (BYTE)'\0';
4804 
4805  // Now store the identifier
4806  fo->entry = *fHandle;
4807 
4808  // see if we are still a good file
4809  a = dir->DIR_Name[0];
4810 
4811  if(a == DIR_DEL)
4812  status = NOT_FOUND;
4813  else
4814  status = FOUND;
4815 
4816  // Now store the size
4817  fo->size = (dir->DIR_FileSize);
4818 
4819  fo->cluster = GetFullClusterNumber(dir); // Get Complete Cluster number.
4820 
4822  a = dir->DIR_Attr;
4823  fo->attributes = a;
4824 
4825  // get the date and time
4826  if ((a & ATTR_DIRECTORY) != 0)
4827  {
4828  fo->time = dir->DIR_CrtTime;
4829  fo->date = dir->DIR_CrtDate;
4830  }
4831  else
4832  {
4833  fo->time = dir->DIR_WrtTime;
4834  fo->date = dir->DIR_WrtDate;
4835  }
4836 
4837  }// deleted directory
4838  }// Ensure we are still good
4839  return(status);
4840 } // Fill_File_Object
4841 
4842 /*****************************************************************
4843  Function:
4844  BYTE Fill_LFN_Object(FILEOBJ fo, LFN_ENTRY *lfno, WORD *fHandle)
4845  Summary:
4846  Fill a LFN object with specified entry data
4847  Conditions:
4848  This function should not be called by the user.
4849  Input:
4850  fo - Pointer to file structure
4851  lfno - Pointer to Long File Name Object
4852  fHandle - Passed member's location
4853  Return Values:
4854  FOUND - Operation successful
4855  NOT_FOUND - Operation failed
4856  Side Effects:
4857  None
4858  Description:
4859  This function will cache the sector of LFN entries
4860  in the directory pointed to by the dirclus value in
4861  the FSFILE object 'fo' that contains the entry that
4862  corresponds to the fHandle offset. It will then copy
4863  the file information for that entry into the 'fo' FSFILE
4864  object.
4865  Remarks:
4866  None.
4867  *****************************************************************/
4868 #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
4869 BYTE Fill_LFN_Object(FILEOBJ fo, LFN_ENTRY *lfno, WORD *fHandle)
4870 {
4871  DIRENTRY dir;
4872  BYTE tempVariable;
4873  BYTE *src,*dst;
4874  BYTE status;
4875 
4876  // Get the entry
4877  if (((*fHandle & MASK_MAX_FILE_ENTRY_LIMIT_BITS) == 0) && (*fHandle != 0)) // 4-bit mask because 16-root entries max per sector
4878  {
4879  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
4880  dir = Cache_File_Entry(fo, fHandle, TRUE);
4881  }
4882  else
4883  {
4884  dir = Cache_File_Entry (fo, fHandle, FALSE);
4885  }
4886 
4887 
4888  // Make sure there is a directory left
4889  if(dir == (DIRENTRY)NULL)
4890  {
4891  status = NO_MORE;
4892  }
4893  else
4894  {
4895  // Read the first char of the file name
4896  tempVariable = dir->DIR_Name[0];
4897 
4898  // Check for empty or deleted directory
4899  if ( tempVariable == DIR_DEL)
4900  {
4901  status = NOT_FOUND;
4902  }
4903  else if ( tempVariable == DIR_EMPTY)
4904  {
4905  status = NO_MORE;
4906  }
4907  else
4908  {
4909  status = FOUND;
4910 
4911  dst = (BYTE *)lfno;
4912  src = (BYTE *)dir;
4913 
4914  // Copy the entry in the lfno object
4915  for(tempVariable = 0;tempVariable < 32;tempVariable++)
4916  {
4917  *dst++ = *src++;
4918  }
4919  }// deleted directory
4920  }// Ensure we are still good
4921  return(status);
4922 } // Fill_File_Object
4923 #endif
4924 /************************************************************************
4925  Function:
4926  DIRENTRY LoadDirAttrib(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
4927  Summary:
4928  Load file information from a directory entry and cache the entry
4929  Conditions:
4930  This function should not be called by the user.
4931  Input:
4932  fo - Pointer to file structure
4933  fHandle - Information location
4934  Return Values:
4935  DIRENTRY - Pointer to the directory entry
4936  NULL - Directory entry could not be loaded
4937  Side Effects:
4938  None
4939  Description:
4940  This function will cache the sector of directory entries
4941  in the directory pointed to by the dirclus value in
4942  the FSFILE object 'fo' that contains the entry that
4943  corresponds to the fHandle offset. It will then return a pointer
4944  to the directory entry in the global data buffer.
4945  Remarks:
4946  None.
4947  ************************************************************************/
4948 
4949 DIRENTRY LoadDirAttrib(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle)
4950 {
4951  DIRENTRY dir;
4952  BYTE a;
4953 
4954  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
4955  // Get the entry
4956  dir = Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, TRUE);
4957  if (dir == NULL)
4958  return NULL;
4959 
4960  // Read the first char of the file name
4961  a = dir->DIR_Name[0];
4962 
4963  // Make sure there is a directory left
4964  if(a == DIR_EMPTY)
4965  dir = (DIRENTRY)NULL;
4966 
4967  if(dir != (DIRENTRY)NULL)
4968  {
4969  // Check for empty or deleted directory
4970  if ( a == DIR_DEL)
4971  dir = (DIRENTRY)NULL;
4972  else
4973  {
4974  // Get the attributes
4975  a = dir->DIR_Attr;
4976 
4977  // scan through all the long dir entries
4978  while(a == ATTR_LONG_NAME)
4979  {
4980  (*fHandle)++;
4981  dir = Cache_File_Entry( fo, fHandle, FALSE);
4982  if (dir == NULL)
4983  return NULL;
4984  a = dir->DIR_Attr;
4985  } // long file name while loop
4986  } // deleted dir
4987  }// Ensure we are still good
4988 
4989  return(dir);
4990 } // LoadDirAttrib
4991 
4992 
4993 /**************************************************************************
4994  Function:
4995  CETYPE FILEerase( FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE EraseClusters)
4996  Summary:
4997  Erase a file
4998  Conditions:
4999  This function should not be called by the user.
5000  Input:
5001  fo - Pointer to file structure
5002  fHandle - Location of file information
5003  EraseClusters - If set to TRUE, delete the corresponding cluster of file
5004  Return Values:
5005  CE_GOOD - File erased successfully
5006  CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND - Could not find the file on the card
5007  CE_ERASE_FAIL - Internal Card erase failed
5008  Side Effects:
5009  None
5010  Description:
5011  This function will cache the sector of directory entries in the directory
5012  pointed to by the dirclus value in the FSFILE object 'fo' that contains
5013  the entry that corresponds to the fHandle offset. It will then mark that
5014  entry as deleted. If the EraseClusters argument is TRUE, the chain of
5015  clusters for that file will be marked as unused in the FAT by the
5016  FAT_erase_cluster_chain function.
5017  Remarks:
5018  None.
5019  **************************************************************************/
5020 
5021 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5022 CETYPE FILEerase( FILEOBJ fo, WORD *fHandle, BYTE EraseClusters)
5023 {
5024  DIRENTRY dir;
5025  BYTE a;
5026  CETYPE status = CE_GOOD;
5027  DWORD clus = 0;
5028  DISK * disk;
5029 
5030  BYTE numberOfFileEntries;
5031  BOOL forFirstTime = TRUE;
5032  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
5033  BYTE tempCalc1;
5034  #endif
5035 
5036  disk = fo->dsk;
5037 
5038  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
5039 
5040  fileNameLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
5041 
5042  // Find the number of entries of LFN in the root directory
5043  if(fileNameLength)
5044  {
5045  tempCalc1 = fileNameLength % 13;
5046 
5047  numberOfFileEntries = fileNameLength/13;
5048 
5049  if(tempCalc1 || (fileNameLength < 13))
5050  {
5051  numberOfFileEntries = numberOfFileEntries + 2;
5052  }
5053  else
5054  {
5055  numberOfFileEntries++;
5056  }
5057  }
5058  else
5059  #endif
5060  {
5061  numberOfFileEntries = 1;
5062  }
5063 
5064  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
5065 
5066  // delete all the entries of LFN in root directory
5067  while(numberOfFileEntries--)
5068  {
5069  // reset the cluster
5070  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
5071 
5072  // load the sector
5073  dir = Cache_File_Entry(fo, fHandle, TRUE);
5074 
5075  if (dir == NULL)
5076  {
5077  return CE_BADCACHEREAD;
5078  }
5079 
5080  // Fill up the File Object with the information pointed to by fHandle
5081  a = dir->DIR_Name[0];
5082 
5083  // see if there is something in the dir
5084  if((dir == (DIRENTRY)NULL) || (a == DIR_EMPTY) || (a == DIR_DEL))
5085  {
5086  status = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
5087  break;
5088  }
5089  else
5090  {
5091  /* 8.3 File Name - entry*/
5092  dir->DIR_Name[0] = DIR_DEL; // mark as deleted
5093 
5094  if(!(Write_File_Entry( fo, fHandle)))
5095  {
5096  status = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
5097  break;
5098  }
5099  }
5100 
5101  if(forFirstTime)
5102  {
5103  // Get the starting cluster
5104  clus = GetFullClusterNumber(dir); // Get Complete Cluster number.
5105  forFirstTime = FALSE;
5106  }
5107 
5108  *fHandle = *fHandle - 1;
5109  }
5110 
5111  if(status == CE_GOOD)
5112  {
5113  if (clus != FatRootDirClusterValue) //
5114  {
5115  // If 'EraseClusters' is set to TRUE, erase the cluster chain corresponding to file
5116  if(EraseClusters)
5117  {
5118  /* Now remove the cluster allocation from the FAT */
5119  status = ((FAT_erase_cluster_chain(clus, disk)) ? CE_GOOD : CE_ERASE_FAIL);
5120  }
5121  }
5122 
5123  FSerrno = status;
5124  }
5125 
5126  return (status);
5127 }
5128 #endif
5129 
5130 /***************************************************************
5131  Function:
5132  int FSrename (const rom char * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
5133  Summary:
5134  Renames the Ascii name of the file or directory on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices
5135  Conditions:
5136  File opened.
5137  Input:
5138  fileName - The new name of the file
5139  fo - The file to rename
5140  Return Values:
5141  0 - File was renamed successfully
5142  EOF - File was not renamed
5143  Side Effects:
5144  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5145  Description:
5146  Renames the Ascii name of the file or directory on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices.
5147  First, it will search through the current working directory to ensure the
5148  specified new filename is not already in use. If it isn't, the new filename
5149  will be written to the file entry of the file pointed to by 'fo.'
5150  Remarks:
5151  None
5152  ***************************************************************/
5153 
5154 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5155 
5156 int FSrename (const char * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
5157 {
5158  WORD fHandle;
5159  FSFILE tempFo1,tempFo2;
5160  DIRENTRY dir;
5161  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5162  DWORD TempMsbCluster;
5163  #else
5164  BYTE j;
5165  #endif
5166 
5167  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
5168 
5169  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
5170  {
5171  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
5172  return (-1);
5173  }
5174 
5175  // copy file object over
5176  FileObjectCopy(&tempFo1, fo);
5177 
5178  //Format the source string
5179  if(!FormatFileName(fileName, &tempFo1, 0) )
5180  {
5181  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
5182  return -1;
5183  }
5184 
5185  tempFo1.entry = 0;
5186 
5187  // start at the current directory
5188  tempFo1.dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
5189  tempFo1.dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
5190 
5191  // copy file object over
5192  FileObjectCopy(&tempFo2, &tempFo1);
5193 
5194  // See if the file is found
5195  if(FILEfind (&tempFo2, &tempFo1, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) == CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND)
5196  {
5197  fHandle = fo->entry;
5198 
5199  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5200 
5201  if(CE_GOOD != FILEerase(fo, &fHandle, FALSE))
5202  {
5203  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
5204  return -1;
5205  }
5206 
5207  // Create the new entry as per the user requested name
5208  FSerrno = CreateFileEntry (&tempFo1, &fHandle, tempFo1.attributes, FALSE);
5209 
5210  // load the file entry so the new cluster can be linked to it
5211  dir = LoadDirAttrib(&tempFo1, &fHandle);
5212 
5213  // Now update the new cluster
5214  dir->DIR_FstClusLO = (fo->cluster & 0x0000FFFF);
5215 
5216  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
5217  // Get the higher part of cluster and store it in directory entry.
5218  TempMsbCluster = (fo->cluster & 0x0FFF0000); // Since only 28 bits usedin FAT32. Mask the higher MSB nibble.
5219  TempMsbCluster = TempMsbCluster >> 16; // Get the date into Lsb place.
5220  dir->DIR_FstClusHI = TempMsbCluster;
5221  #else // If FAT32 support not enabled
5222  TempMsbCluster = 0; // Just to avoid compiler warnigng.
5223  dir->DIR_FstClusHI = 0;
5224  #endif
5225 
5226  // Update the file size
5227  dir->DIR_FileSize = fo->size;
5228 
5229  // now write it
5230  if(Write_File_Entry(&tempFo1, &fHandle) != TRUE)
5231  {
5232  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
5233  return -1;
5234  }
5235 
5236  tempFo1.size = fo->size;
5237 
5238  // copy file object over
5239  FileObjectCopy(fo, &tempFo1);
5240 
5241  #else
5242 
5243  // Get the file entry
5244  dir = LoadDirAttrib(fo, &fHandle);
5245 
5246  for (j = 0; j < 11; j++)
5247  {
5248  fo->name[j] = tempFo1.name[j];
5249  if (j < 8)
5250  {
5251  dir->DIR_Name[j] = tempFo1.name[j];
5252  }
5253  else
5254  {
5255  dir->DIR_Extension[j-8] = tempFo1.name[j];
5256  }
5257  }
5258 
5259  // just write the last entry in
5260  if(!Write_File_Entry(fo,&fHandle))
5261  {
5262  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
5263  return -1;
5264  }
5265 
5266  #endif
5267  }
5268  else
5269  {
5270  FSerrno = CE_FILENAME_EXISTS;
5271  return -1;
5272  }
5273 
5274  return 0;
5275 }
5276 
5277 /***************************************************************
5278  Function:
5279  int wFSrename (const rom unsigned short int * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
5280  Summary:
5281  Renames the name of the file or directory to the UTF16 input fileName
5282  on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices
5283  Conditions:
5284  File opened.
5285  Input:
5286  fileName - The new name of the file
5287  fo - The file to rename
5288  Return Values:
5289  0 - File was renamed successfully
5290  EOF - File was not renamed
5291  Side Effects:
5292  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5293  Description:
5294  Renames the name of the file or directory to the UTF16 input fileName
5295  on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices. First, it will search through the current
5296  working directory to ensure the specified new UTF16 filename is not
5297  already in use. If it isn't, the new filename will be written to the
5298  file entry of the file pointed to by 'fo.'
5299  Remarks:
5300  None
5301  ***************************************************************/
5302 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5303 int wFSrename (const unsigned short int * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
5304 {
5305  int result;
5306  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
5307  result = FSrename ((const char *)fileName,fo);
5308  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
5309  return result;
5310 }
5311 #endif
5312 
5313 #endif // Allow writes
5314 
5315 /*********************************************************************
5316  Function:
5317  FSFILE * wFSfopen (const unsigned short int * fileName, const char *mode)
5318  Summary:
5319  Opens a file with UTF16 input 'fileName' on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC MCU's.
5320  Conditions:
5321  For read modes, file exists; FSInit performed
5322  Input:
5323  fileName - The name of the file to open
5324  mode -
5325  - FS_WRITE - Create a new file or replace an existing file
5326  - FS_READ - Read data from an existing file
5327  - FS_APPEND - Append data to an existing file
5328  - FS_WRITEPLUS - Create a new file or replace an existing file (reads also enabled)
5329  - FS_READPLUS - Read data from an existing file (writes also enabled)
5330  - FS_APPENDPLUS - Append data to an existing file (reads also enabled)
5331  Return Values:
5332  FSFILE * - The pointer to the file object
5333  NULL - The file could not be opened
5334  Side Effects:
5335  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5336  Description:
5337  This function opens a file with UTF16 input 'fileName' on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC MCU's.
