5338  First, RAM in the dynamic heap or static array will be allocated to a
5339  new FSFILE object. Then, the specified file name will be formatted to
5340  ensure that it's in 8.3 format or LFN format. Next, the FILEfind function
5341  will be used to search for the specified file name. If the name is found,
5342  one of three things will happen: if the file was opened in read mode, its
5343  file info will be loaded using the FILEopen function; if it was opened in
5344  write mode, it will be erased, and a new file will be constructed in
5345  its place; if it was opened in append mode, its file info will be
5346  loaded with FILEopen and the current location will be moved to the
5347  end of the file using the FSfseek function. If the file was not
5348  found by FILEfind, a new file will be created if the mode was specified as
5349  a write or append mode. In these cases, a pointer to the heap or
5350  static FSFILE object array will be returned. If the file was not
5351  found and the mode was specified as a read mode, the memory
5352  allocated to the file will be freed and the NULL pointer value
5353  will be returned.
5354  Remarks:
5355  None.
5356  *********************************************************************/
5357 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5358 FSFILE * wFSfopen( const unsigned short int * fileName, const char *mode )
5359 {
5360  FSFILE *result;
5361  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
5362  result = FSfopen((const char *)fileName,mode);
5363  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
5364  return result;
5365 }
5366 #endif
5367 
5368 /*********************************************************************
5369  Function:
5370  FSFILE * FSfopen (const char * fileName, const char *mode)
5371  Summary:
5372  Opens a file with ascii input 'fileName' on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC MCU's.
5373  Conditions:
5374  For read modes, file exists; FSInit performed
5375  Input:
5376  fileName - The name of the file to open
5377  mode -
5378  - FS_WRITE - Create a new file or replace an existing file
5379  - FS_READ - Read data from an existing file
5380  - FS_APPEND - Append data to an existing file
5381  - FS_WRITEPLUS - Create a new file or replace an existing file (reads also enabled)
5382  - FS_READPLUS - Read data from an existing file (writes also enabled)
5383  - FS_APPENDPLUS - Append data to an existing file (reads also enabled)
5384  Return Values:
5385  FSFILE * - The pointer to the file object
5386  NULL - The file could not be opened
5387  Side Effects:
5388  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5389  Description:
5390  This function will open a ascii name file or directory on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC MCU's.
5391  First, RAM in the dynamic heap or static array will be allocated to a
5392  new FSFILE object. Then, the specified file name will be formatted to
5393  ensure that it's in 8.3 format or LFN format. Next, the FILEfind function
5394  will be used to search for the specified file name. If the name is found,
5395  one of three things will happen: if the file was opened in read mode, its
5396  file info will be loaded using the FILEopen function; if it was opened in
5397  write mode, it will be erased, and a new file will be constructed in
5398  its place; if it was opened in append mode, its file info will be
5399  loaded with FILEopen and the current location will be moved to the
5400  end of the file using the FSfseek function. If the file was not
5401  found by FILEfind, a new file will be created if the mode was specified as
5402  a write or append mode. In these cases, a pointer to the heap or
5403  static FSFILE object array will be returned. If the file was not
5404  found and the mode was specified as a read mode, the memory
5405  allocated to the file will be freed and the NULL pointer value
5406  will be returned.
5407  Remarks:
5408  None.
5409  *********************************************************************/
5410 
5411 FSFILE * FSfopen( const char * fileName, const char *mode )
5412 {
5413  FILEOBJ filePtr;
5414 #ifndef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
5415  int fIndex;
5416 #endif
5417  BYTE ModeC;
5418  WORD fHandle;
5419  CETYPE final;
5420 
5421  //Read the mode character
5422  ModeC = mode[0];
5423 
5424  if(MDD_WriteProtectState() && (ModeC != 'r') && (ModeC != 'R'))
5425  {
5426  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
5427  return NULL;
5428  }
5429 
5430 #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
5431  filePtr = (FILEOBJ) FS_malloc(sizeof(FSFILE));
5432 #else
5433 
5434  filePtr = NULL;
5435 
5436  //Pick available file structure
5437  for( fIndex = 0; fIndex < FS_MAX_FILES_OPEN; fIndex++ )
5438  {
5439  if( gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] ) //this slot is available
5440  {
5441  gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] = FALSE;
5442  filePtr = &gFileArray[fIndex];
5443  break;
5444  }
5445  }
5446 
5447  if( filePtr == NULL )
5448  {
5449  FSerrno = CE_TOO_MANY_FILES_OPEN;
5450  return NULL; //no file structure slot available
5451  }
5452 #endif
5453 
5454  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
5455  #if defined(FS_DYNAMIC_MEM)
5456  filePtr -> utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)FS_malloc(514);
5457  #else
5458  filePtr->utf16LFNptr = &lfnData[fIndex][0];
5459  #endif
5460  #endif
5461 
5462  //Format the source string.
5463  if( !FormatFileName(fileName, filePtr, 0) )
5464  {
5465  #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
5466  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
5467  FS_free((unsigned char *)filePtr->utf16LFNptr);
5468  #endif
5469  FS_free( (unsigned char *)filePtr );
5470  #else
5471  gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] = TRUE; //put this slot back to the pool
5472  #endif
5473 
5474  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
5475  return NULL; //bad filename
5476  }
5477 
5478  filePtr->dsk = &gDiskData;
5479  filePtr->cluster = 0;
5480  filePtr->ccls = 0;
5481  filePtr->entry = 0;
5482  filePtr->attributes = ATTR_ARCHIVE;
5483 
5484  // start at the current directory
5485 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
5486  filePtr->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
5487  filePtr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
5488 #else
5489  filePtr->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
5490  filePtr->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
5491 #endif
5492 
5493  // copy file object over
5494  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, filePtr);
5495 
5496  // See if the file is found
5497  if(FILEfind (filePtr, &gFileTemp, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) == CE_GOOD)
5498  {
5499  // File is Found
5500  switch(ModeC)
5501  {
5502 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5503  case 'w':
5504  case 'W':
5505  {
5506  // File exists, we want to create a new one, remove it first
5507  fHandle = filePtr->entry;
5508  final = FILEerase(filePtr, &fHandle, TRUE);
5509 
5510  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5511  {
5512  // now create a new one
5513  final = CreateFileEntry (filePtr, &fHandle, 0, TRUE);
5514 
5515  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5516  {
5517  final = FILEopen (filePtr, &fHandle, 'w');
5518 
5519  if (filePtr->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
5520  {
5521  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
5522  final = 0xFF;
5523  }
5524 
5525  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5526  {
5527  final = FSfseek (filePtr, 0, SEEK_END);
5528  if (mode[1] == '+')
5529  filePtr->flags.read = 1;
5530  }
5531  }
5532  }
5533  break;
5534  }
5535 
5536  case 'A':
5537  case 'a':
5538  {
5539  if(filePtr->size != 0)
5540  {
5541  fHandle = filePtr->entry;
5542 
5543  final = FILEopen (filePtr, &fHandle, 'w');
5544 
5545  if (filePtr->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
5546  {
5547  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
5548  final = 0xFF;
5549  }
5550 
5551  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5552  {
5553  final = FSfseek (filePtr, 0, SEEK_END);
5554  if (final != CE_GOOD)
5555  FSerrno = CE_SEEK_ERROR;
5556  else
5557  ReadFAT (&gDiskData, filePtr->ccls);
5558  if (mode[1] == '+')
5559  filePtr->flags.read = 1;
5560  }
5561  }
5562  else
5563  {
5564  fHandle = filePtr->entry;
5565  final = FILEerase(filePtr, &fHandle, TRUE);
5566 
5567  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5568  {
5569  // now create a new one
5570  final = CreateFileEntry (filePtr, &fHandle, 0, TRUE);
5571 
5572  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5573  {
5574  final = FILEopen (filePtr, &fHandle, 'w');
5575 
5576  if (filePtr->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
5577  {
5578  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
5579  final = 0xFF;
5580  }
5581 
5582  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5583  {
5584  final = FSfseek (filePtr, 0, SEEK_END);
5585  if (final != CE_GOOD)
5586  FSerrno = CE_SEEK_ERROR;
5587  if (mode[1] == '+')
5588  filePtr->flags.read = 1;
5589  }
5590  }
5591  }
5592  }
5593  break;
5594  }
5595 #endif
5596  case 'R':
5597  case 'r':
5598  {
5599  fHandle = filePtr->entry;
5600 
5601  final = FILEopen (filePtr, &fHandle, 'r');
5602 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5603  if ((final == CE_GOOD) && (mode[1] == '+') )
5604  {
5605  // Refresh FAT Table Entry
5606  ReadFAT (&gDiskData, filePtr->ccls);
5607  // In r+ mode, allow write acess to file
5608  if(!(filePtr->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY))
5609  filePtr->flags.write = 1;
5610  }
5611 #endif
5612  break;
5613  }
5614 
5615  default:
5616  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
5617  final = 0xFF;; //indicate error condition
5618  break;
5619  }
5620  }
5621  else
5622  {
5623 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5624  // the file was not found, reset to the default asked
5625  FileObjectCopy(filePtr, &gFileTemp);
5626 
5627  // File is not Found
5628  if((ModeC == 'w') || (ModeC == 'W') || (ModeC == 'a') || (ModeC == 'A'))
5629  {
5630  // use the user requested name
5631  fHandle = 0;
5632  final = CreateFileEntry (filePtr, &fHandle, 0, TRUE);
5633 
5634  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5635  {
5636  final = FILEopen (filePtr, &fHandle, 'w');
5637  if (filePtr->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
5638  {
5639  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
5640  final = 0xFF;
5641  }
5642 
5643  if (final == CE_GOOD)
5644  {
5645  final = FSfseek (filePtr, 0, SEEK_END);
5646  if (final != CE_GOOD)
5647  FSerrno = CE_SEEK_ERROR;
5648  if (mode[1] == '+')
5649  filePtr->flags.read = 1;
5650  }
5651  }
5652  }
5653  else
5654 #endif
5655  {
5656  final = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
5657  FSerrno = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
5658  }
5659  }
5660 
5661  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
5662  {
5663  filePtr->flags.write = 0;;
5664  }
5665 
5666 #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
5667  if( final != CE_GOOD )
5668  {
5669  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5670  FS_free((unsigned char *)filePtr->utf16LFNptr);
5671  #endif
5672  FS_free( (unsigned char *)filePtr );
5673  filePtr = NULL;
5674  }
5675 #else
5676  if( final != CE_GOOD )
5677  {
5678  gFileSlotOpen[fIndex] = TRUE; //put this slot back to the pool
5679  filePtr = NULL;
5680  }
5681 #endif
5682  else
5683  {
5684  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
5685  }
5686 
5687  return filePtr;
5688 }
5689 
5690 /*******************************************************************
5691  Function:
5692  long FSftell (FSFILE * fo)
5693  Summary:
5694  Determine the current location in a file
5695  Conditions:
5696  File opened
5697  Input:
5698  fo - Pointer to file structure
5699  Return: Current location in the file
5700  Side Effects:
5701  The FSerrno variable will be changed
5702  Description:
5703  The FSftell function will return the current position in the
5704  file pointed to by 'fo' by returning the 'seek' variable in the
5705  FSFILE object, which is used to keep track of the absolute
5706  location of the current position in the file.
5707  Remarks:
5708  None
5709  *******************************************************************/
5710 
5711 long FSftell (FSFILE * fo)
5712 {
5713  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
5714  return (fo->seek);
5715 }
5716 
5717 
5718 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5719 
5720 /*********************************************************************
5721  Function:
5722  int FSremove (const char * fileName)
5723  Summary:
5724  Deletes the file on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC device.The 'fileName' is in ascii format.
5725  Conditions:
5726  File not opened, file exists
5727  Input:
5728  fileName - Name of the file to erase
5729  Return Values:
5730  0 - File removed
5731  EOF - File was not removed
5732  Side Effects:
5733  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5734  Description:
5735  Deletes the file on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC device.The 'fileName' is in ascii format.
5736  The FSremove function will attempt to find the specified file with the FILEfind
5737  function. If the file is found, it will be erased using the FILEerase function.
5738  The user can also provide ascii alias name of the ascii long file name as the
5739  input to this function to get it erased from the memory.
5740  Remarks:
5741  None
5742  **********************************************************************/
5743 
5744 int FSremove (const char * fileName)
5745 {
5746  FILEOBJ fo = &tempCWDobj;
5747 
5748  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5749  FSFILE cwdTemp;
5750  char tempArray[514];
5751  LFN_ENTRY *lfno;
5752  WORD prevHandle;
5753  unsigned short int i = 0;
5754  #endif
5755  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
5756 
5757  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
5758  {
5759  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
5760  return (-1);
5761  }
5762 
5763  //Format the source string
5764  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
5765  fo->utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
5766  #endif
5767 
5768  if( !FormatFileName(fileName, fo, 0) )
5769  {
5770  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
5771  return -1;
5772  }
5773 
5774  fo->dsk = &gDiskData;
5775  fo->cluster = 0;
5776  fo->ccls = 0;
5777  fo->entry = 0;
5778  fo->attributes = ATTR_ARCHIVE;
5779 
5780 #ifndef ALLOW_DIRS
5781  // start at the root directory
5782  fo->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
5783  fo->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
5784 #else
5785  fo->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
5786  fo->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
5787 #endif
5788 
5789  // copy file object over
5790  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, fo);
5791 
5792  // See if the file is found
5793  if (FILEfind (fo, &gFileTemp, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) != CE_GOOD)
5794  {
5795  FSerrno = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
5796  return -1;
5797  }
5798 
5799  if (fo->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
5800  {
5801  FSerrno = CE_DELETE_DIR;
5802  return -1;
5803  }
5804 
5805  // Find the long file name assosciated with the short file name if present
5806  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5807  if(!fo->utf16LFNlength)
5808  {
5809  FileObjectCopy (&cwdTemp, fo);
5810  prevHandle = fo->entry - 1;
5811 
5812  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (fo, &prevHandle, FALSE);
5813 
5814 
5815  while((lfno->LFN_Attribute == ATTR_LONG_NAME) && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_DEL)
5816 
5817  && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_EMPTY))
5818 
5819  {
5820 
5821 
5822  i = i + MAX_UTF16_CHARS_IN_LFN_ENTRY;
5823 
5824  prevHandle = prevHandle - 1;
5825 
5826  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (fo, &prevHandle, FALSE);
5827 
5828  }
5829 
5830 
5831 
5832  FileObjectCopy (fo, &cwdTemp);
5833 
5834  // Find the length of LFN file
5835  fo->utf16LFNlength = i;
5836 
5837  }
5838  #endif
5839 
5840  // Erase the file
5841  if( FILEerase(fo, &fo->entry, TRUE) == CE_GOOD )
5842  return 0;
5843  else
5844  {
5845  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
5846  return -1;
5847  }
5848 }
5849 
5850 /*********************************************************************
5851  Function:
5852  int wFSremove (const unsigned short int * fileName)
5853  Summary:
5854  Deletes the file on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC device.The 'fileName' is in UTF16 format.
5855  Conditions:
5856  File not opened, file exists
5857  Input:
5858  fileName - Name of the file to erase
5859  Return Values:
5860  0 - File removed
5861  EOF - File was not removed
5862  Side Effects:
5863  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
5864  Description:
5865  Deletes the file on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC device.The 'fileName' is in UTF16 format.
5866  The wFSremove function will attempt to find the specified UTF16 file
5867  name with the FILEfind function. If the file is found, it will be erased
5868  using the FILEerase function.
5869  Remarks:
5870  None
5871  **********************************************************************/
5872 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
5873 int wFSremove (const unsigned short int * fileName)
5874 {
5875  int result;
5876  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
5877  result = FSremove ((const char *)fileName);
5878  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
5879  return result;
5880 }
5881 #endif
5882 
5883 #endif
5884 
5885 /*********************************************************
5886  Function:
5887  void FSrewind (FSFILE * fo)
5888  Summary:
5889  Set the current position in a file to the beginning
5890  Conditions:
5891  File opened.
5892  Input:
5893  fo - Pointer to file structure
5894  Return Values:
5895  None
5896  Side Effects:
5897  None.
5898  Description:
5899  The FSrewind funciton will reset the position of the
5900  specified file to the beginning of the file. This
5901  functionality is faster than using FSfseek to reset
5902  the position in the file.
5903  Remarks:
5904  None.
5905  *********************************************************/
5906 
5907 void FSrewind (FSFILE * fo)
5908 {
5909 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
5910  if (gNeedDataWrite)
5911  flushData();
5912 #endif
5913  fo->seek = 0;
5914  fo->pos = 0;
5915  fo->sec = 0;
5916  fo->ccls = fo->cluster;
5917  gBufferOwner = NULL;
5918  return;
5919 }
5920 
5921 /**************************************************************************
5922  Function:
5923  int FSerror (void)
5924  Summary:
5925  Return an error code for the last function call
5926  Conditions:
5927  The return value depends on the last function called.
5928  Input:
5929  None
5930  Side Effects:
5931  None.
5932  Return Values:
5933  FSInit -
5934  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5935  - CE_INIT_ERROR � The physical media could not be initialized
5936  - CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ � The MBR or the boot sector could not be
5937  read correctly
5938  - CE_BAD_PARITION � The MBR signature code was incorrect.
5939  - CE_NOT_FORMATTED � The boot sector signature code was incorrect or
5940  indicates an invalid number of bytes per sector.
5941  - CE_UNSUPPORTED_SECTOR_SIZE - The number of bytes per sector is unsupported
5942  - CE_CARDFAT32 � The physical media is FAT32 type (only an error
5943  when FAT32 support is disabled).
5944  - CE_UNSUPPORTED_FS � The device is formatted with an unsupported file
5945  system (not FAT12 or 16).
5946  FSfopen -
5947  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5948  - CE_NOT_INIT � The device has not been initialized.
5949  - CE_TOO_MANY_FILES_OPEN � The function could not allocate any
5950  additional file information to the array
5951  of FSFILE structures or the heap.
5952  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � The file name argument was invalid.
5953  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The user attempted to open a directory in a
5954  write mode or specified an invalid mode argument.
5955  - CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND � The specified file (which was to be opened in read
5956  mode) does not exist on the device.
5957  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � A read from the device failed.
5958  - CE_ERASE_FAIL � The existing file could not be erased (when opening
5959  a file in FS_WRITE mode).
5960  - CE_DIR_FULL � The directory is full.
5961  - CE_DISK_FULL� The data memory section is full.
5962  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � A write to the device failed.
5963  - CE_SEEK_ERROR � The current position in the file could not be set to
5964  the end (when the file was opened in FS_APPEND mode).
5965  FSfclose -
5966  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5967  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The existing data in the data buffer or the new file
5968  entry information could not be written to the device.
5969  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The file entry information could not be cached
5970  FSfread -
5971  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5972  - CE_WRITEONLY � The file was opened in a write-only mode.
5973  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The existing data in the data buffer could not be
5974  written to the device.
5975  - CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ � The data sector could not be read.
5976  - CE_EOF � The end of the file was reached.
5977  - CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER � Additional clusters in the file could not be loaded.
5978  FSfwrite -
5979  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5980  - CE_READONLY � The file was opened in a read-only mode.
5981  - CE_WRITE_PROTECTED � The device write-protect check function indicated
5982  that the device has been write-protected.
5983  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � There was an error writing data to the device.
5984  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The data sector to be modified could not be read from
5985  the device.
5986  - CE_DISK_FULL � All data clusters on the device are in use.
5987  FSfseek -
5988  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5989  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The existing data in the data buffer could not be
5990  written to the device.
5991  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The specified offset exceeds the size of the file.
5992  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The sector that contains the new current position
5993  could not be loaded.
5994  - CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER � Additional clusters in the file could not be
5995  loaded/allocated.
5996  FSftell -
5997  - CE_GOOD � No Error
5998  FSattrib -
5999  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6000  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The attribute argument was invalid.
6001  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The existing file entry information could not be
6002  loaded.
6003  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The file entry information could not be written to
6004  the device.
6005  FSrename -
6006  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6007  - CE_FILENOTOPENED � A null file pointer was passed into the function.
6008  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � The file name passed into the function was invalid.
6009  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � A read from the device failed.
6010  - CE_FILENAME_EXISTS � A file with the specified name already exists.
6011  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The new file entry data could not be written to the
6012  device.
6013  FSfeof -
6014  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6015  FSformat -
6016  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6017  - CE_INIT_ERROR � The device could not be initialized.
6018  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The master boot record or boot sector could not be
6019  loaded successfully.
6020  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The user selected to create their own boot sector on
6021  a device that has no master boot record, or the mode
6022  argument was invalid.
6023  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The updated MBR/Boot sector could not be written to
6024  the device.
6025  - CE_BAD_PARTITION � The calculated number of sectors per clusters was
6026  invalid.
6027  - CE_NONSUPPORTED_SIZE � The card has too many sectors to be formatted as
6028  FAT12 or FAT16.
6029  FSremove -
6030  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6031  - CE_WRITE_PROTECTED � The device write-protect check function indicated
6032  that the device has been write-protected.
6033  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � The specified filename was invalid.
6034  - CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND � The specified file could not be found.
6035  - CE_ERASE_FAIL � The file could not be erased.
6036  FSchdir -
6037  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6038  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The path string was mis-formed or the user tried to
6039  change to a non-directory file.
6040  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � A directory entry could not be cached.
6041  - CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND � Could not find a directory in the path.
6042  FSgetcwd -
6043  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6044  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The user passed a 0-length buffer into the function.
6045  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � A directory entry could not be cached.
6046  - CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ � The function could not determine a previous directory
6047  of the current working directory.
6048  FSmkdir -
6049  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6050  - CE_WRITE_PROTECTED � The device write-protect check function indicated
6051  that the device has been write-protected.
6052  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The path string was mis-formed.
6053  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � Could not successfully change to a recently created
6054  directory to store its dir entry information, or
6055  could not cache directory entry information.
6056  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � One or more of the directory names has an invalid
6057  format.
6058  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � The existing data in the data buffer could not be
6059  written to the device or the dot/dotdot entries could
6060  not be written to a newly created directory.
6061  - CE_DIR_FULL � There are no available dir entries in the CWD.
6062  - CE_DISK_FULL � There are no available clusters in the data region of
6063  the device.
6064  FSrmdir -
6065  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6066  - CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND � The directory specified could not be found or the
6067  function could not change to a subdirectory within
6068  the directory to be deleted (when recursive delete is
6069  enabled).
6070  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The user tried to remove the CWD or root directory.
6071  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � A directory entry could not be cached.
6072  - CE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY � The directory to be deleted was not empty and
6073  recursive subdirectory removal was disabled.
6074  - CE_ERASE_FAIL � The directory or one of the directories or files
6075  within it could not be deleted.
6076  - CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ � The function could not determine a previous directory
6077  of the CWD.
6078  SetClockVars -
6079  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6080  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The time values passed into the function were
6081  invalid.
6082  FindFirst -
6083  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6084  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � The specified filename was invalid.
6085  - CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND � No file matching the specified criteria was found.
6086  - CE_BADCACHEREAD � The file information for the file that was found
6087  could not be cached.
6088  FindNext -
6089  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6090  - CE_NOT_INIT � The SearchRec object was not initialized by a call to
6091  FindFirst.
6092  - CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT � The SearchRec object was initialized in a different
6093  directory from the CWD.
6094  - CE_INVALID_FILENAME � The filename is invalid.
6095  - CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND � No file matching the specified criteria was found.
6096  FSfprintf -
6097  - CE_GOOD � No Error
6098  - CE_WRITE_ERROR � Characters could not be written to the file.
6099  Description:
6100  The FSerror function will return the FSerrno variable. This global
6101  variable will have been set to an error value during the last call of a
6102  library function.
6103  Remarks:
6104  None
6105  **************************************************************************/
6106 
6107 int FSerror (void)
6108 {
6109  return FSerrno;
6110 }
6111 
6112 
6113 /**************************************************************
6114  Function:
6115  void FileObjectCopy(FILEOBJ foDest,FILEOBJ foSource)
6116  Summary:
6117  Copy a file object
6118  Conditions:
6119  This function should not be called by the user.
6120  Input:
6121  foDest - The destination
6122  foSource - the source
6123  Return:
6124  None
6125  Side Effects:
6126  None
6127  Description:
6128  The FileObjectCopy function will make an exacy copy of
6129  a specified FSFILE object.
6130  Remarks:
6131  None
6132  **************************************************************/
6133 
6134 void FileObjectCopy(FILEOBJ foDest,FILEOBJ foSource)
6135 {
6136  int size;
6137  BYTE *dest;
6138  BYTE *source;
6139  int Index;
6140 
6141  dest = (BYTE *)foDest;
6142  source = (BYTE *)foSource;
6143 
6144  size = sizeof(FSFILE);
6145 
6146  for(Index=0;Index< size; Index++)
6147  {
6148  dest[Index] = source[Index];
6149  }
6150 }
6151 
6152 /*************************************************************************
6153  Function:
6154  CETYPE FILECreateHeadCluster( FILEOBJ fo, DWORD *cluster)
6155  Summary:
6156  Create the first cluster of a file
6157  Conditions:
6158  This function should not be called by the user.
6159  Input:
6160  fo - Pointer to file structure
6161  cluster - Cluster location
6162  Return Values:
6163  CE_GOOD - File closed successfully
6164  CE_WRITE_ERROR - Could not write to the sector
6165  CE_DISK_FULL - All clusters in partition are taken
6166  Side Effects:
6167  None
6168  Description:
6169  The FILECreateHeadCluster function will create the first cluster
6170  of a file. First, it will find an empty cluster with the
6171  FATfindEmptyCluster function and mark it as the last cluster in the
6172  file. It will then erase the cluster using the EraseCluster function.
6173  Remarks:
6174  None.
6175  *************************************************************************/
6176 
6177 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6178 CETYPE FILECreateHeadCluster( FILEOBJ fo, DWORD *cluster)
6179 {
6180  DISK * disk;
6181  CETYPE error = CE_GOOD;
6182 
6183  disk = fo->dsk;
6184 
6185  // find the next empty cluster
6186  *cluster = FATfindEmptyCluster(fo);
6187 
6188  if(*cluster == 0) // "0" is just an indication as Disk full in the fn "FATfindEmptyCluster()"
6189  {
6190  error = CE_DISK_FULL;
6191  }
6192  else
6193  {
6194  // mark the cluster as taken, and last in chain
6195  if(disk->type == FAT12)
6196  {
6197  if(WriteFAT( disk, *cluster, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT12, FALSE) == CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16)
6198  {
6199  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6200  }
6201  }
6202  else if(disk->type == FAT16)
6203  {
6204  if(WriteFAT( disk, *cluster, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16, FALSE) == CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16)
6205  {
6206  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6207  }
6208  }
6209 
6210  #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
6211  else
6212  {
6213  if(WriteFAT( disk, *cluster, LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32, FALSE) == CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32)
6214  {
6215  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6216  }
6217  }
6218 #endif
6219 
6220  // lets erase this cluster
6221  if(error == CE_GOOD)
6222  {
6223  error = EraseCluster(disk,*cluster);
6224  }
6225  }
6226 
6227  return(error);
6228 } // allocate head cluster
6229 #endif
6230 
6231 /*************************************************************************
6232  Function:
6233  BYTE EraseCluster(DISK *disk, DWORD cluster)
6234  Summary:
6235  Erase a cluster
6236  Conditions:
6237  This function should not be called by the user.
6238  Input:
6239  dsk - Disk structure
6240  cluster - Cluster to be erased
6241  Return Values:
6242  CE_GOOD - File closed successfully
6243  CE_WRITE_ERROR - Could not write to the sector
6244  Side Effects:
6245  None
6246  Description:
6247  The EraseCluster function will write a 0 value into every byte of
6248  the specified cluster.
6249  Remarks:
6250  None.
6251  *************************************************************************/
6252 
6253 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6254 BYTE EraseCluster(DISK *disk, DWORD cluster)
6255 {
6256  BYTE index;
6257  DWORD SectorAddress;
6258  BYTE error = CE_GOOD;
6259 
6260  SectorAddress = Cluster2Sector(disk,cluster);
6261  if (gNeedDataWrite)
6262  if (flushData())
6263  return CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6264 
6265  gBufferOwner = NULL;
6266 
6267  if (gBufferZeroed == FALSE)
6268  {
6269  // clear out the memory first
6270  memset(disk->buffer, 0x00, disk->sectorSize);
6271  gBufferZeroed = TRUE;
6272  }
6273 
6274  // Now clear them out
6275  for(index = 0; (index < disk->SecPerClus) && (error == CE_GOOD); index++)
6276  {
6277  if (MDD_SectorWrite( SectorAddress++, disk->buffer, FALSE) != TRUE)
6278  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6279  }
6280 
6281  return(error);
6282 }
6283 #endif
6284 
6285 
6286 #if defined (__C30__) || defined (__PIC32MX__)
6287 
6288 /***************************************************
6289  Function:
6290  BYTE ReadByte(BYTE * pBuffer, WORD index)
6291  Summary:
6292  Read a byte from a buffer
6293  Conditions:
6294  This function should not be called by the user.
6295  Input:
6296  pBuffer - pointer to a buffer to read from
6297  index - index in the buffer to read to
6298  Return:
6299  BYTE - the byte read
6300  Side Effects:
6301  None
6302  Description:
6303  Reads a byte from a buffer
6304  Remarks:
6305  None.
6306  ***************************************************/
6307 
6308 BYTE ReadByte( BYTE* pBuffer, WORD index )
6309 {
6310  return( pBuffer[index] );
6311 }
6312 
6313 
6314 /***************************************************
6315  Function:
6316  BYTE ReadWord(BYTE * pBuffer, WORD index)
6317  Summary:
6318  Read a 16-bit word from a buffer
6319  Conditions:
6320  This function should not be called by the user.
6321  Input:
6322  pBuffer - pointer to a buffer to read from
6323  index - index in the buffer to read to
6324  Return:
6325  WORD - the word read
6326  Side Effects:
6327  None
6328  Description:
6329  Reads a 16-bit word from a buffer
6330  Remarks:
6331  None.
6332  ***************************************************/
6333 
6334 WORD ReadWord( BYTE* pBuffer, WORD index )
6335 {
6336  BYTE loByte, hiByte;
6337  WORD res;
6338 
6339  loByte = pBuffer[index];
6340  hiByte = pBuffer[index+1];
6341  res = hiByte;
6342  res *= 0x100;
6343  res |= loByte;
6344  return( res );
6345 }
6346 
6347 
6348 /****************************************************
6349  Function:
6350  BYTE ReadDWord(BYTE * pBuffer, WORD index)
6351  Summary:
6352  Read a 32-bit double word from a buffer
6353  Conditions:
6354  This function should not be called by the user.
6355  Input:
6356  pBuffer - pointer to a buffer to read from
6357  index - index in the buffer to read to
6358  Return:
6359  DWORD - the double word read
6360  Side Effects:
6361  None
6362  Description:
6363  Reads a 32-bit double word from a buffer
6364  Remarks:
6365  None.
6366  ****************************************************/
6367 
6368 DWORD ReadDWord( BYTE* pBuffer, WORD index )
6369 {
6370  WORD loWord, hiWord;
6371  DWORD result;
6372 
6373  loWord = ReadWord( pBuffer, index );
6374  hiWord = ReadWord( pBuffer, index+2 );
6375 
6376  result = hiWord;
6377  result *= 0x10000;
6378  result |= loWord;
6379  return result;
6380 }
6381 
6382 #endif
6383 
6384 
6385 
6386 /****************************************************
6387  Function:
6388  DWORD Cluster2Sector(DISK * dsk, DWORD cluster)
6389  Summary:
6390  Convert a cluster number to the corresponding sector
6391  Conditions:
6392  This function should not be called by the user.
6393  Input:
6394  disk - Disk structure
6395  cluster - Cluster to be converted
6396  Return:
6397  sector - Sector that corresponds to given cluster
6398  Side Effects:
6399  None
6400  Description:
6401  The Cluster2Sector function will calculate the
6402  sector number that corresponds to the first sector
6403  of the cluster whose value was passed into the
6404  function.
6405  Remarks:
6406  None.
6407  ****************************************************/
6408 
6409 DWORD Cluster2Sector(DISK * dsk, DWORD cluster)
6410 {
6411  DWORD sector;
6412 
6413  /* Rt: Settings based on FAT type */
6414  switch (dsk->type)
6415  {
6416 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
6417  case FAT32:
6418  /* In FAT32, there is no separate ROOT region. It is as well stored in DATA region */
6419  sector = (((DWORD)cluster-2) * dsk->SecPerClus) + dsk->data;
6420  break;
6421 #endif
6422  case FAT12:
6423  case FAT16:
6424  default:
6425  // The root dir takes up cluster 0 and 1
6426  if((cluster == 0) || (cluster == 1))
6427  sector = dsk->root + cluster;
6428  else
6429  sector = (((DWORD)cluster-2) * dsk->SecPerClus) + dsk->data;
6430  break;
6431  }
6432 
6433  return(sector);
6434 
6435 }
6436 
6437 
6438 /***************************************************************************
6439  Function:
6440  int FSattrib (FSFILE * file, unsigned char attributes)
6441  Summary:
6442  Change the attributes of a file
6443  Conditions:
6444  File opened
6445  Input:
6446  file - Pointer to file structure
6447  attributes - The attributes to set for the file
6448  - Attribute - Value - Indications
6449  - ATTR_READ_ONLY - 0x01 - The read-only attribute
6450  - ATTR_HIDDEN - 0x02 - The hidden attribute
6451  - ATTR_SYSTEM - 0x04 - The system attribute
6452  - ATTR_ARCHIVE - 0x20 - The archive attribute
6453  Return Values:
6454  0 - Attribute change was successful
6455  -1 - Attribute change was unsuccessful
6456  Side Effects:
6457  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
6458  Description:
6459  The FSattrib funciton will set the attributes of the specified file
6460  to the attributes passed in by the user. This function will load the
6461  file entry, replace the attributes with the ones specified, and write
6462  the attributes back. If the specified file is a directory, the
6463  directory attribute will be preserved.
6464  Remarks:
6465  None
6466  ***************************************************************************/
6467 
6468 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6469 int FSattrib (FSFILE * file, unsigned char attributes)
6470 {
6471  WORD fHandle;
6472  DIRENTRY dir;
6473 
6474  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
6475 
6476  // Check for valid attributes
6477  if ((attributes & ~0x27) != 0)
6478  {
6479  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
6480  return -1;
6481  }
6482 
6483  fHandle = file->entry;
6484 
6485  file->dirccls = file->dirclus;
6486 
6487  // Get the file entry
6488  dir = LoadDirAttrib(file, &fHandle);
6489 
6490  if (dir == NULL)
6491  {
6492  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
6493  return -1;
6494  }
6495 
6496  // Ensure that we aren't trying to change the
6497  // attributes of a volume entry
6498  if (dir->DIR_Attr & ATTR_VOLUME)
6499  {
6500  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
6501  return -1;
6502  }
6503 
6504  // Don't remove the directory attribute from DIR files
6505  if (file->attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY)
6506  file->attributes = attributes | ATTR_DIRECTORY;
6507  else
6508  file->attributes = attributes;
6509 
6510  // just write the last entry in
6511  if(!Write_File_Entry(file,&fHandle))
6512  {
6513  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6514  return -1;
6515  }
6516 
6517  return 0;
6518 }
6519 #endif
6520 
6521 
6522 /*********************************************************************************
6523  Function:
6524  size_t FSfwrite(const void *data_to_write, size_t size, size_t n, FSFILE *stream)
6525  Summary:
6526  Write data to a file
6527  Conditions:
6528  File opened in FS_WRITE, FS_APPEND, FS_WRITE+, FS_APPEND+, FS_READ+ mode
6529  Input:
6530  data_to_write - Pointer to source buffer
6531  size - Size of units in bytes
6532  n - Number of units to transfer
6533  stream - Pointer to file structure
6534  Return:
6535  size_t - number of units written
6536  Side Effects:
6537  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
6538  Description:
6539  The FSfwrite function will write data to a file. First, the sector that
6540  corresponds to the current position in the file will be loaded (if it hasn't
6541  already been cached in the global data buffer). Data will then be written to
6542  the device from the specified buffer until the specified amount has been written.
6543  If the end of a cluster is reached, the next cluster will be loaded, unless
6544  the end-of-file flag for the specified file has been set. If it has, a new
6545  cluster will be allocated to the file. Finally, the new position and filesize
6546  will be stored in the FSFILE object. The parameters 'size' and 'n' indicate how
6547  much data to write. 'Size' refers to the size of one object to write (in bytes),
6548  and 'n' will refer to the number of these objects to write. The value returned
6549  will be equal to 'n' unless an error occured.
6550  Remarks:
6551  None.
6552  *********************************************************************************/
6553 
6554 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6555 size_t FSfwrite(const void *data_to_write, size_t size, size_t n, FSFILE *stream)
6556 {
6557  DWORD count = size * n;
6558  BYTE * src = (BYTE *) data_to_write;
6559  DISK * dsk; // pointer to disk structure
6560  CETYPE error = CE_GOOD;
6561  WORD pos;
6562  DWORD l; // absolute lba of sector to load
6563  DWORD seek, filesize;
6564  WORD writeCount = 0;
6565 
6566  // see if the file was opened in a write mode
6567  if(!(stream->flags.write))
6568  {
6569  FSerrno = CE_READONLY;
6570  error = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6571  return 0;
6572  }
6573 
6574  if (count == 0)
6575  return 0;
6576 
6577  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
6578  {
6579  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
6580  error = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
6581  return 0;
6582  }
6583 
6584  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
6585  dsk = stream->dsk;
6586  // get the stated position
6587  pos = stream->pos;
6588  seek = stream->seek;
6589  l = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
6590  l += (WORD)stream->sec; // add the sector number to it
6591 
6592  // Check if the current stream was the last one to use the
6593  // buffer. If not, check if we need to write data from the
6594  // old stream
6595  if (gBufferOwner != stream)
6596  {
6597  if (gNeedDataWrite)
6598  {
6599  if (flushData())
6600  {
6601  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6602  return 0;
6603  }
6604  }
6605  gBufferOwner = stream;
6606  }
6607  if (gLastDataSectorRead != l)
6608  {
6609  if (gNeedDataWrite)
6610  {
6611  if (flushData())
6612  {
6613  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6614  return 0;
6615  }
6616  }
6617 
6618  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
6619  if(!MDD_SectorRead( l, dsk->buffer) )
6620  {
6621  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
6622  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6623  }
6624  gLastDataSectorRead = l;
6625  }
6626  // exit loop if EOF reached
6627  filesize = stream->size;
6628 
6629  // Loop while writing bytes
6630  while ((error == CE_GOOD) && (count > 0))
6631  {
6632  if( seek == filesize )
6633  stream->flags.FileWriteEOF = TRUE;
6634 
6635  // load a new sector if necessary, multiples of sector
6636  if (pos == dsk->sectorSize)
6637  {
6638  BYTE needRead = TRUE;
6639 
6640  if (gNeedDataWrite)
6641  if (flushData())
6642  {
6643  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6644  return 0;
6645  }
6646 
6647  // reset position
6648  pos = 0;
6649 
6650  // point to the next sector
6651  stream->sec++;
6652 
6653  // get a new cluster if necessary
6654  if (stream->sec == dsk->SecPerClus)
6655  {
6656  stream->sec = 0;
6657 
6658  if(stream->flags.FileWriteEOF)
6659  {
6660  error = FILEallocate_new_cluster(stream, 0); // add new cluster to the file
6661  needRead = FALSE;
6662  }
6663  else
6664  error = FILEget_next_cluster( stream, 1);
6665  }
6666 
6667  if (error == CE_DISK_FULL)
6668  {
6669  FSerrno = CE_DISK_FULL;
6670  return 0;
6671  }
6672 
6673  if(error == CE_GOOD)
6674  {
6675  l = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
6676  l += (WORD)stream->sec; // add the sector number to it
6677  gBufferOwner = stream;
6678  // If we just allocated a new cluster, then the cluster will
6679  // contain garbage data, so it doesn't matter what we write to it
6680  // Whatever is in the buffer will work fine
6681  if (needRead)
6682  {
6683  if( !MDD_SectorRead( l, dsk->buffer) )
6684  {
6685  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
6686  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6687  gLastDataSectorRead = 0xFFFFFFFF;
6688  return 0;
6689  }
6690  else
6691  {
6692  gLastDataSectorRead = l;
6693  }
6694  }
6695  else
6696  gLastDataSectorRead = l;
6697  }
6698  } // load new sector
6699 
6700  if(error == CE_GOOD)
6701  {
6702  // Write one byte at a time
6703  RAMwrite(dsk->buffer, pos++, *(char *)src);
6704  src = src + 1; // compiler bug
6705  seek++;
6706  count--;
6707  writeCount++;
6708  // now increment the size of the part
6709  if(stream->flags.FileWriteEOF)
6710  filesize++;
6711  gNeedDataWrite = TRUE;
6712  }
6713  } // while count
6714 
6715  // save off the positon
6716  stream->pos = pos;
6717 
6718  // save off the seek
6719  stream->seek = seek;
6720 
6721  // now the new size
6722  stream->size = filesize;
6723 
6724  return(writeCount / size);
6725 } // fwrite
6726 #endif
6727 
6728 
6729 /**********************************************************
6730  Function:
6731  BYTE flushData (void)
6732  Summary:
6733  Flush unwritten data to a file
6734  Conditions:
6735  File opened in a write mode, data needs to be written
6736  Return Values:
6737  CE_GOOD - Data was updated successfully
6738  CE_WRITE_ERROR - Data could not be updated
6739  Side Effects:
6740  None
6741  Description:
6742  The flushData function is called when it is necessary to
6743  read new data into the global data buffer and the
6744  gNeedDataWrite variable indicates that there is data
6745  in the buffer that hasn't been written to the device.
6746  The flushData function will write the data from the
6747  buffer into the current cluster of the FSFILE object
6748  that is stored in the gBufferOwner global variable.
6749  Remarks:
6750  None
6751  **********************************************************/
6752 
6753 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6754 BYTE flushData (void)
6755 {
6756  DWORD l;
6757  DISK * dsk;
6758 
6759  // This will either be the pointer to the last file, or the handle
6760  FILEOBJ stream = gBufferOwner;
6761 
6762  dsk = stream->dsk;
6763 
6764  // figure out the lba
6765  l = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
6766  l += (WORD)stream->sec; // add the sector number to it
6767 
6768  if(!MDD_SectorWrite( l, dsk->buffer, FALSE))
6769  {
6770  return CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6771  }
6772 
6773  gNeedDataWrite = FALSE;
6774 
6775  return CE_GOOD;
6776 }
6777 #endif
6778 
6779 /****************************************************
6780  Function:
6781  int FSfeof( FSFILE * stream )
6782  Summary:
6783  Indicate whether the current file position is at the end
6784  Conditions:
6785  File is open in a read mode
6786  Input:
6787  stream - Pointer to the target file
6788  Return Values:
6789  Non-Zero - EOF reached
6790  0 - Not at end of File
6791  Side Effects:
6792  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
6793  Description:
6794  The FSfeof function will indicate that the end-of-
6795  file has been reached for the specified file by
6796  comparing the absolute location in the file to the
6797  size of the file.
6798  Remarks:
6799  None.
6800  ****************************************************/
6801 
6802 int FSfeof( FSFILE * stream )
6803 {
6804  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
6805  return( stream->seek == stream->size );
6806 }
6807 
6808 
6809 /**************************************************************************
6810  Function:
6811  size_t FSfread(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t n, FSFILE *stream)
6812  Summary:
6813  Read data from a file
6814  Conditions:
6815  File is opened in a read mode
6816  Input:
6817  ptr - Destination buffer for read bytes
6818  size - Size of units in bytes
6819  n - Number of units to be read
6820  stream - File to be read from
6821  Return:
6822  size_t - number of units read
6823  Side Effects:
6824  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
6825  Description:
6826  The FSfread function will read data from the specified file. First,
6827  the appropriate sector of the file is loaded. Then, data is read into
6828  the specified buffer until the specified number of bytes have been read.
6829  When a cluster boundary is reached, a new cluster will be loaded. The
6830  parameters 'size' and 'n' indicate how much data to read. 'Size'
6831  refers to the size of one object to read (in bytes), and 'n' will refer
6832  to the number of these objects to read. The value returned will be equal
6833  to 'n' unless an error occured or the user tried to read beyond the end
6834  of the file.
6835  Remarks:
6836  None.
6837  **************************************************************************/
6838 
6839 size_t FSfread (void *ptr, size_t size, size_t n, FSFILE *stream)
6840 {
6841  DWORD len = size * n;
6842  BYTE *pointer = (BYTE *) ptr;
6843  DISK *dsk; // Disk structure
6844  DWORD seek, sec_sel;
6845  WORD pos; //position within sector
6846  CETYPE error = CE_GOOD;
6847  WORD readCount = 0;
6848 
6849  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
6850 
6851  dsk = (DISK *)stream->dsk;
6852  pos = stream->pos;
6853  seek = stream->seek;
6854 
6855  if( !stream->flags.read )
6856  {
6857  FSerrno = CE_WRITEONLY;
6858  return 0; // CE_WRITEONLY
6859  }
6860 
6861 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
6862  if (gNeedDataWrite)
6863  if (flushData() != CE_GOOD)
6864  {
6865  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
6866  return 0;
6867  }
6868 #endif
6869 
6870  // if it not my buffer, then get it from the disk.
6871  if( (gBufferOwner != stream) && (pos != dsk->sectorSize))
6872  {
6873  gBufferOwner = stream;
6874  sec_sel = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
6875  sec_sel += (WORD)stream->sec; // add the sector number to it
6876 
6877  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
6878  if( !MDD_SectorRead( sec_sel, dsk->buffer) )
6879  {
6880  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6881  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6882  return 0;
6883  }
6884  gLastDataSectorRead = sec_sel;
6885  }
6886 
6887  //loop reading (count) bytes
6888  while( len )
6889  {
6890  if( seek == stream->size )
6891  {
6892  FSerrno = CE_EOF;
6893  error = CE_EOF;
6894  break;
6895  }
6896 
6897  // In fopen, pos is init to 0 and the sect is loaded
6898  if( pos == dsk->sectorSize )
6899  {
6900  // reset position
6901  pos = 0;
6902  // point to the next sector
6903  stream->sec++;
6904 
6905  // get a new cluster if necessary
6906  if( stream->sec == dsk->SecPerClus )
6907  {
6908  stream->sec = 0;
6909  if( (error = FILEget_next_cluster( stream, 1)) != CE_GOOD )
6910  {
6911  FSerrno = CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER;
6912  break;
6913  }
6914  }
6915 
6916  sec_sel = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
6917  sec_sel += (WORD)stream->sec; // add the sector number to it
6918 
6919 
6920  gBufferOwner = stream;
6921  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
6922  if( !MDD_SectorRead( sec_sel, dsk->buffer) )
6923  {
6924  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6925  error = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
6926  break;
6927  }
6928  gLastDataSectorRead = sec_sel;
6929  }
6930 
6931  // copy one byte at a time
6932  *pointer = RAMread( dsk->buffer, pos++ );
6933  pointer++;
6934  seek++;
6935  readCount++;
6936  len--;
6937  }
6938 
6939  // save off the positon
6940  stream->pos = pos;
6941  // save off the seek
6942  stream->seek = seek;
6943 
6944  return(readCount / size);
6945 } // fread
6946 
6947 
6948 /***************************************************************************
6949  Function:
6950  BYTE FormatFileName( const char* fileName, FILEOBJ fptr, BYTE mode )
6951  Summary:
6952  Format a file name into dir entry format
6953  Conditions:
6954  This function should not be called by the user.
6955  Input:
6956  fileName - The name to be formatted
6957  fN2 - The location the formatted name will be stored
6958  mode - Non-zero if parital string search chars are allowed
6959  Return Values:
6960  TRUE - Name formatted successfully
6961  FALSE - File name could not be formatted
6962  Side Effects:
6963  None
6964  Description:
6965  Format an 8.3 filename into FSFILE structure format. If filename is less
6966  than 8 chars, then it will be padded with spaces. If the extension name is
6967  fewer than 3 chars, then it will also be oadded with spaces. The
6968  ValidateChars function is used to ensure the characters in the specified
6969  filename are valid in this filesystem.
6970  Remarks:
6971  None.
6972  ***************************************************************************/
6973 BYTE FormatFileName( const char* fileName, FILEOBJ fptr, BYTE mode)
6974 {
6975  char *fN2;
6976  FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE fileNameType;
6977  int temp,count1,count2,count3,count4;
6978  BOOL supportLFN = FALSE;
6979  char *localFileName = NULL;
6980 
6981  // go with static allocation
6982  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
6983  unsigned short int tempString[256];
6984  BOOL AscciIndication = TRUE;
6985  count1 = 256;
6986  #else
6987  unsigned short int tempString[13];
6988  count1 = 12;
6989  #endif
6990 
6991  // Check whether the length of the file name is valid
6992  // for LFN support as well as Non LFN support
6993  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
6994  if(utfModeFileName)
6995  {
6996  utf16Filename = (unsigned short int *)fileName;
6997  fileNameLength = 0;
6998  while(utf16Filename[fileNameLength])
6999  {
7000  fileNameLength++;
7001  }
7002 
7003  if((fileNameLength > count1) || (*utf16Filename == '.') ||
7004  (*utf16Filename == 0))
7005  {
7006  return FALSE;
7007  }
7008 
7009  for (count1 = 0;count1 < fileNameLength; count1++)
7010  {
7011  tempString[count1] = utf16Filename[count1];
7012  }
7013 
7014  utf16Filename = tempString;
7015  }
7016  else
7017  #endif
7018  {
7019  fileNameLength = strlen(fileName);
7020 
7021  if((fileNameLength > count1) || (*fileName == '.') || (*fileName == 0))
7022  {
7023  return FALSE;
7024  }
7025 
7026  asciiFilename = (char *)tempString;
7027  for (count1 = 0;count1 < fileNameLength; count1++)
7028  {
7029  asciiFilename[count1] = fileName[count1];
7030  }
7031  }
7032 
7033  // Make sure the characters are valid
7034  fileNameType = ValidateChars(mode);
7035 
7036  // If the file name doesn't follow 8P3 or LFN format, then return FALSE
7037  if(NAME_ERROR == fileNameType)
7038  {
7039  return FALSE;
7040  }
7041 
7042  temp = fileNameLength;
7043 
7044  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7045  fptr->AsciiEncodingType = TRUE;
7046  fptr->utf16LFNlength = 0;
7047  #endif
7048 
7049  // If LFN is supported and the file name is UTF16 type or Ascii mixed type,
7050  // go for LFN support rather than trying to adjust in 8P3 format
7051  if(NAME_8P3_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE == fileNameType)
7052  {
7053  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7054  supportLFN = TRUE;
7055  #endif
7056  }
7057 
7058  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7059  if(NAME_8P3_UTF16_TYPE == fileNameType)
7060  {
7061  for (count3 = 0; count3 < temp; count3++)
7062  {
7063  if(utf16Filename[count3] > 0xFF)
7064  {
7065  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_NONASCII_TYPE;
7066  supportLFN = TRUE;
7067  break;
7068  }
7069  }
7070 
7071  if(count3 == temp)
7072  {
7073  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_CAPS_TYPE;
7074 
7075  for (count3 = 0; count3 < temp; count3++)
7076  {
7077  if((utf16Filename[count3] >= 0x61) && (utf16Filename[count3] <= 0x7A))
7078  {
7079  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE;
7080  supportLFN = TRUE;
7081  break;
7082  }
7083  }
7084  }
7085  }
7086  #endif
7087 
7088  // If the file name follows 8P3 type
7089  if((NAME_LFN_TYPE != fileNameType) && (FALSE == supportLFN))
7090  {
7091  for (count3 = 0; count3 < temp; count3++)
7092  {
7093  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7094  if(utfModeFileName)
7095  {
7096  if(((utf16Filename[count3] == '.') && ((temp - count3) > 4)) ||
7097  (count3 > 8))
7098  {
7099  // UTF File name extension greater then 3 characters or
7100  // UTF File name greater then 8 charcters
7101  supportLFN = TRUE;
7102  break;
7103  }
7104  else if(utf16Filename[count3] == '.')
7105  {
7106  break;
7107  }
7108  }
7109  else
7110  #endif
7111  {
7112  if(((asciiFilename[count3] == '.') && ((temp - count3) > 4)) ||
7113  (count3 > 8))
7114  {
7115  // File extension greater then 3 characters or
7116  // File name greater then 8 charcters
7117  #if !defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7118  return FALSE;
7119  #endif
7120  supportLFN = TRUE;
7121  break;
7122  }
7123  else if(asciiFilename[count3] == '.')
7124  {
7125  break;
7126  }
7127  }
7128  }
7129 
7130  // If LFN not supported try to adjust in 8P3 format
7131  if(FALSE == supportLFN)
7132  {
7133  // point fN2 to short file name
7134  fN2 = fptr -> name;
7135 
7136  // Load destination filename to be space intially.
7137  for (count1 = 0; count1 < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3; count1++)
7138  {
7139  *(fN2 + count1) = ' ';
7140  }
7141 
7142  // multiply the length by 2 as each UTF word has 2 byte
7143  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7144  if(utfModeFileName)
7145  {
7146  count4 = count3 * 2;
7147  temp = temp * 2;
7148  localFileName = (char *)utf16Filename;
7149  }
7150  else
7151  #endif
7152  {
7153  count4 = count3;
7154  localFileName = asciiFilename;
7155  }
7156 
7157  //copy only file name ( not the extension part )
7158  for (count1 = 0,count2 = 0; (count2 < 8) && (count1 < count4);count1++ )
7159  {
7160  if(localFileName[count1])
7161  {
7162  fN2[count2] = localFileName[count1]; // Destination filename initially filled with SPACE. Now copy only available chars.
7163 
7164  // Convert lower-case to upper-case
7165  if ((fN2[count2] >= 0x61) && (fN2[count2] <= 0x7A))
7166  {
7167  fN2[count2] -= 0x20;
7168  }
7169  count2++;
7170  }
7171  }
7172 
7173  if(count4 < temp)
7174  {
7175  // Discard the '.' part
7176  count4++;
7177 
7178  // Copy the extn to 8th position onwards. Ex: "FILE .Tx "
7179  for (count3 = 8; (count3 < 11) && (count4 < temp);count4++ )
7180  {
7181  if(localFileName[count4])
7182  {
7183  fN2[count3] = localFileName[count4];
7184 
7185  // Convert lower-case to upper-case
7186  if ((fN2[count3] >= 0x61) && (fN2[count3] <= 0x7A))
7187  {
7188  fN2[count3] -= 0x20;
7189  }
7190  count3++;
7191  }
7192  }
7193  }
7194  }
7195  }
7196 
7197  // If the file name follows LFN format
7198  if((NAME_LFN_TYPE == fileNameType) || (TRUE == supportLFN))
7199  {
7200  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7201 
7202  // point fN2 to long file name
7203  fN2 = (char *)(fptr -> utf16LFNptr);
7204 
7205  if(!utfModeFileName)
7206  {
7207  localFileName = asciiFilename;
7208  }
7209 
7210  // Copy the LFN name in the adress specified by FSFILE pointer
7211  count2 = 0;
7212  for(count1 = 0;count1 < temp;count1++)
7213  {
7214  if(utfModeFileName)
7215  {
7216  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = utf16Filename[count1];
7217  if(AscciIndication)
7218  {
7219  if(utf16Filename[count1] > 0xFF)
7220  {
7221  fptr->AsciiEncodingType = FALSE;
7222  AscciIndication = FALSE;
7223  }
7224  }
7225  }
7226  else
7227  {
7228  fN2[count2++] = localFileName[count1];
7229  fN2[count2++] = (BYTE)0x00;
7230  }
7231  }
7232  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = 0x0000;
7233 
7234  fptr->utf16LFNlength = fileNameLength;
7235  #else
7236  return FALSE;
7237  #endif
7238  }
7239 
7240  // Free the temporary heap used for intermediate execution
7241  return TRUE;
7242 }
7243 
7244 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
7245 
7246 /*************************************************************************
7247  Function:
7248  BYTE FormatDirName (char * string,FILEOBJ fptr, BYTE mode)
7249  Summary:
7250  Format a dir name into dir entry format
7251  Conditions:
7252  This function should not be called by the user.
7253  Input:
7254  string - The name to be formatted
7255  mode -
7256  - TRUE - Partial string search characters are allowed
7257  - FALSE - Partial string search characters are forbidden
7258  Return Values:
7259  TRUE - The name was formatted correctly
7260  FALSE - The name contained invalid characters
7261  Side Effects:
7262  None
7263  Description:
7264  Format an 8.3 filename into directory structure format. If the name is less
7265  than 8 chars, then it will be padded with spaces. If the extension name is
7266  fewer than 3 chars, then it will also be oadded with spaces. The
7267  ValidateChars function is used to ensure the characters in the specified
7268  directory name are valid in this filesystem.
7269  Remarks:
7270  None.
7271  *************************************************************************/
7272 
7273 BYTE FormatDirName (char * string,FILEOBJ fptr, BYTE mode)
7274 {
7275  char tempString [12];
7276  FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE fileNameType;
7277  int temp,count1,count2;
7278  BOOL supportLFN = FALSE;
7279  char *localFileName;
7280 
7281  // go with static allocation
7282  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7283  int count3,count4;
7284  BOOL AscciIndication = TRUE;
7285  count1 = 256;
7286  #else
7287  count1 = 12;
7288  #endif
7289 
7290  // Calculate the String length
7291  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7292  if(utfModeFileName)
7293  {
7294  utf16Filename = (unsigned short int *)string;
7295  fileNameLength = 0;
7296  while(utf16Filename[fileNameLength])
7297  {
7298  fileNameLength++;
7299  }
7300  }
7301  else
7302  #endif
7303  {
7304  asciiFilename = string;
7305  fileNameLength = strlen(string);
7306  }
7307 
7308  if(fileNameLength > count1)
7309  {
7310  return FALSE;
7311  }
7312 
7313  // Make sure the characters are valid
7314  fileNameType = ValidateChars(mode);
7315 
7316  // If the file name doesn't follow 8P3 or LFN format, then return FALSE
7317  if(NAME_ERROR == fileNameType)
7318  {
7319  return FALSE;
7320  }
7321 
7322  temp = fileNameLength;
7323 
7324  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7325  fptr->AsciiEncodingType = TRUE;
7326  fptr->utf16LFNlength = 0;
7327  #endif
7328 
7329  // If LFN is supported and the file name is UTF16 type or Ascii mixed type,
7330  // go for LFN support rather than trying to adjust in 8P3 format
7331  if(NAME_8P3_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE == fileNameType)
7332  {
7333  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7334  supportLFN = TRUE;
7335  #endif
7336  }
7337 
7338  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7339  if(NAME_8P3_UTF16_TYPE == fileNameType)
7340  {
7341  for (count3 = 0; count3 < temp; count3++)
7342  {
7343  if(utf16Filename[count3] > 0xFF)
7344  {
7345  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_NONASCII_TYPE;
7346  supportLFN = TRUE;
7347  break;
7348  }
7349  }
7350 
7351  if(count3 == temp)
7352  {
7353  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_CAPS_TYPE;
7354 
7355  for (count3 = 0; count3 < temp; count3++)
7356  {
7357  if((utf16Filename[count3] >= 0x61) && (utf16Filename[count3] <= 0x7A))
7358  {
7359  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE;
7360  supportLFN = TRUE;
7361  break;
7362  }
7363  }
7364  }
7365  }
7366  #endif
7367 
7368  // If the file name follows LFN format
7369  if((NAME_LFN_TYPE == fileNameType) || (TRUE == supportLFN))
7370  {
7371  #if !defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7372  return FALSE;
7373  #else
7374  fptr -> utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)string;
7375 
7376  if(utfModeFileName)
7377  {
7378  if(utf16Filename != (unsigned short int *)string)
7379  {
7380  // Copy the validated/Fomated name in the UTF16 string
7381  for(count1 = 0; count1 < temp; count1++)
7382  {
7383  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = utf16Filename[count1];
7384  if(AscciIndication)
7385  {
7386  if(utf16Filename[count1] > 0xFF)
7387  {
7388  fptr->AsciiEncodingType = FALSE;
7389  AscciIndication = FALSE;
7390  }
7391  }
7392  }
7393  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = 0x0000;
7394  }
7395  else
7396  {
7397  for(count1 = 0; count1 < temp; count1++)
7398  {
7399  if(AscciIndication)
7400  {
7401  if(utf16Filename[count1] > 0xFF)
7402  {
7403  fptr->AsciiEncodingType = FALSE;
7404  AscciIndication = FALSE;
7405  break;
7406  }
7407  }
7408  }
7409  }
7410  }
7411  else
7412  {
7413  #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
7414  unsigned short int *tempAsciiLFN = (unsigned short int *)FS_malloc((temp + 1) * 2);
7415  #else
7416  unsigned short int tempAsciiLFN[temp + 1];
7417  #endif
7418 
7419  localFileName = (char *)tempAsciiLFN;
7420 
7421  // Copy the validated/Fomated name in the Ascii string
7422  count2 = 0;
7423 
7424  for(count1 = 0; count1 < temp; count1++)
7425  {
7426  localFileName[count2++] = asciiFilename[count1];
7427 
7428  localFileName[count2++] = (BYTE)0x00;
7429 
7430  }
7431 
7432  // Copy the validated/Fomated name in the UTF16 string
7433  for(count1 = 0; count1 < temp; count1++)
7434  {
7435  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = tempAsciiLFN[count1];
7436  }
7437 
7438  #ifdef FS_DYNAMIC_MEM
7439  FS_free((unsigned char *)tempAsciiLFN);
7440  #endif
7441  fptr -> utf16LFNptr[count1] = 0x0000;
7442  }
7443 
7444  fptr->utf16LFNlength = fileNameLength;
7445  #endif
7446  }
7447  else
7448  {
7449  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7450  if(utfModeFileName)
7451  {
7452  localFileName = (char *)utf16Filename;
7453 
7454  // Copy the name part in the temporary string
7455  count4 = 0;
7456  for (count3 = 0; (count3 < temp) && (utf16Filename[count3] != '.') && (utf16Filename[count3] != 0); count3++)
7457  {
7458  count1 = count3 * 2;
7459  if(localFileName[count1])
7460  {
7461  tempString[count4] = localFileName[count1];
7462  count4++;
7463  if(count4 == 8)
7464  break;
7465  }
7466 
7467  if(localFileName[count1 + 1])
7468  {
7469  tempString[count4] = localFileName[count1 + 1];
7470  count4++;
7471  if(count4 == 8)
7472  break;
7473  }
7474  }
7475 
7476  // File the remaining name portion with spaces
7477  while (count4 < 8)
7478  {
7479  tempString [count4++] = 0x20;
7480  }
7481 
7482  // Copy the extension part in the temporary string
7483  if (utf16Filename[count3] == '.')
7484  {
7485  count1 = count3 * 2 + 2;
7486  while (localFileName[count1] != 0)
7487  {
7488  if(localFileName[count3])
7489  {
7490  tempString[count4] = localFileName[count3];
7491  count4++;
7492  if(count4 == 11)
7493  break;
7494  }
7495  }
7496  }
7497 
7498  count1 = count4;
7499  }
7500  else
7501  #endif
7502  {
7503  // Copy the name part in the temporary string
7504  for (count1 = 0; (count1 < 8) && (*(asciiFilename + count1) != '.') && (*(asciiFilename + count1) != 0); count1++)
7505  {
7506  tempString[count1] = *(asciiFilename + count1);
7507  }
7508 
7509  count2 = count1;
7510 
7511  // File the remaining name portion with spaces
7512  while (count1 < 8)
7513  {
7514  tempString [count1++] = 0x20;
7515  }
7516 
7517  // Copy the extension part in the temporary string
7518  if (*(asciiFilename + count2) == '.')
7519  {
7520  count2++;
7521  while ((*(asciiFilename + count2) != 0) && (count1 < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3))
7522  {
7523  tempString[count1++] = *(asciiFilename + count2++);
7524  }
7525  }
7526  }
7527 
7528  // File the remaining portion with spaces
7529  while (count1 < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3)
7530  {
7531  tempString[count1++] = 0x20;
7532  }
7533 
7534  // Forbidden
7535  if (tempString[0] == 0x20)
7536  {
7537  tempString[0] = '_';
7538  }
7539 
7540  // point fN2 to short file name
7541  localFileName = fptr -> name;
7542 
7543  // Copy the formated name in string
7544  for (count1 = 0; count1 < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3; count1++)
7545  {
7546  localFileName[count1] = tempString[count1];
7547 
7548  // Convert lower-case to upper-case
7549  if ((tempString[count1] >= 0x61) && (tempString[count1] <= 0x7A))
7550  {
7551  localFileName[count1] -= 0x20;
7552  }
7553  }
7554  }
7555 
7556  return TRUE;
7557 }
7558 #endif
7559 
7560 
7561 /*************************************************************
7562  Function:
7563  FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE ValidateChars(BYTE mode)
7564  Summary:
7565  Validate the characters in a given file name
7566  Conditions:
7567  This function should not be called by the user.
7568  Input:
7569  fileName - The name to be validated
7570  mode - Determines if partial string search is allowed
7571  Return Values:
7572  TRUE - Name was validated
7573  FALSE - File name was not valid
7574  Side Effects:
7575  None
7576  Description:
7577  The ValidateChars function will compare characters in a
7578  specified filename to determine if they're permissable
7579  in the FAT file system. Lower-case characters will be
7580  converted to upper-case. If the mode argument is specifed
7581  to be 'TRUE,' partial string search characters are allowed.
7582  Remarks:
7583  None.
7584  *************************************************************/
7585 FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE ValidateChars(BYTE mode)
7586 {
7587  FILE_DIR_NAME_TYPE fileNameType;
7588  unsigned short int count1;
7589  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7590  unsigned short int utf16Value;
7591  unsigned short int count2;
7592  int count3;
7593  #endif
7594  unsigned char radix = FALSE,asciiValue;
7595 
7596  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7597 
7598  // Remove the spaces if they are present before the file name
7599  for (count1 = 0; count1 < fileNameLength; count1++)
7600  {
7601  if(utfModeFileName)
7602  {
7603  if((utf16Filename[count1] != ' ') && (utf16Filename[count1] != '.'))
7604  {
7605  utf16Filename = utf16Filename + count1;
7606  break;
7607  }
7608  }
7609  else if((asciiFilename[count1] != ' ') && (asciiFilename[count1] != '.'))
7610  {
7611  asciiFilename = asciiFilename + count1;
7612  break;
7613  }
7614  }
7615 
7616  count2 = 0;
7617 
7618  // Remove the spaces & dots if they are present after the file name
7619  for (count3 = fileNameLength - count1 - 1; count3 > 0; count3--)
7620  {
7621  if(utfModeFileName)
7622  {
7623  if((utf16Filename[count3] != ' ') && (utf16Filename[count3] != '.'))
7624  {
7625  break;
7626  }
7627  }
7628  else if((asciiFilename[count3] != ' ') && (asciiFilename[count3] != '.'))
7629  {
7630  break;
7631  }
7632 
7633  count2++;
7634  }
7635 
7636  fileNameLength = fileNameLength - count1 - count2;
7637 
7638  if(( fileNameLength > MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH_LFN ) || (fileNameLength == 0))// 255
7639  return NAME_ERROR; //long file name
7640 
7641  #endif
7642 
7643  // If the string length is greater then 8P3 length, then assume
7644  // the file name as LFN type provided there are no errors in the
7645  // below for loop.
7646  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7647  if(utfModeFileName)
7648  {
7649  if((fileNameLength * 2) > (TOTAL_FILE_SIZE_8P3 * 2))
7650  {
7651  fileNameType = NAME_LFN_TYPE;
7652  }
7653  else
7654  {
7655  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_UTF16_TYPE;
7656  }
7657  }
7658  else
7659  #endif
7660  {
7661  if(fileNameLength > TOTAL_FILE_SIZE_8P3)
7662  {
7663  fileNameType = NAME_LFN_TYPE;
7664  }
7665  else
7666  {
7667  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_ASCII_CAPS_TYPE;
7668  }
7669  }
7670 
7671  for( count1 = 0; count1 < fileNameLength; count1++ )
7672  {
7673  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
7674  if(utfModeFileName)
7675  {
7676  utf16Value = utf16Filename[count1];
7677  // Characters not valid for either of 8P3 & LFN format
7678  if (((utf16Value < 0x20) && (utf16Value != 0x05)) || (utf16Value == 0x22) ||
7679  (utf16Value == 0x2F) || (utf16Value == 0x3A) || (utf16Value == 0x3C) ||
7680  (utf16Value == 0x3E) || (utf16Value == 0x5C) || (utf16Value == 0x7C))
7681  {
7682  return NAME_ERROR;
7683  }
7684 
7685  // Check for partial string search chars
7686  if (mode == FALSE)
7687  {
7688  if ((utf16Value == '*') || (utf16Value == '?'))
7689  {
7690  return NAME_ERROR;
7691  }
7692  }
7693 
7694  if(fileNameType != NAME_LFN_TYPE)
7695  {
7696  // Characters valid for LFN format only
7697  if ((utf16Value == 0x20) || (utf16Value == 0x2B) || (utf16Value == 0x2C) ||
7698  (utf16Value == 0x3B) || (utf16Value == 0x3D) || (utf16Value == 0x5B) ||
7699  (utf16Value == 0x5D) || ((utf16Value == 0x2E) && (radix == TRUE)))
7700  {
7701  fileNameType = NAME_LFN_TYPE;
7702  continue;
7703  }
7704 
7705  // only one radix ('.') character is allowed in 8P3 format, where as
7706  // multiple radices can be present in LFN format
7707  if (utf16Filename[count1] == 0x2E)
7708  {
7709  radix = TRUE;
7710  }
7711  }
7712  }
7713  else
7714  #endif
7715  {
7716  asciiValue = asciiFilename[count1];
7717  if(((asciiValue < 0x20) && (asciiValue != 0x05)) || (asciiValue == 0x22) ||
7718  (asciiValue == 0x2F) || (asciiValue == 0x3A) || (asciiValue == 0x3C) ||
7719  (asciiValue == 0x3E) || (asciiValue == 0x5C) || (asciiValue == 0x7C))
7720  {
7721  return NAME_ERROR;
7722  }
7723 
7724  // Check for partial string search chars
7725  if (mode == FALSE)
7726  {
7727  if ((asciiValue == '*') || (asciiValue == '?'))
7728  {
7729  return NAME_ERROR;
7730  }
7731  }
7732 
7733  if(fileNameType != NAME_LFN_TYPE)
7734  {
7735  // Characters valid for LFN format only
7736  if ((asciiValue == 0x20) || (asciiValue == 0x2B) || (asciiValue == 0x2C) ||
7737  (asciiValue == 0x3B) || (asciiValue == 0x3D) || (asciiValue == 0x5B) ||
7738  (asciiValue == 0x5D) || ((asciiValue == 0x2E) && (radix == TRUE)))
7739  {
7740  fileNameType = NAME_LFN_TYPE;
7741  continue;
7742  }
7743 
7744  // only one radix ('.') character is allowed in 8P3 format, where as
7745  // multiple radices can be present in LFN format
7746  if (asciiValue == 0x2E)
7747  {
7748  radix = TRUE;
7749  }
7750 
7751  // If the characters are mixed type & are within 8P3 length range
7752  // then store file type as 8P3 mixed type format
7753  if(fileNameType != NAME_8P3_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE)
7754  {
7755  if((asciiValue >= 0x61) && (asciiValue <= 0x7A))
7756  {
7757  fileNameType = NAME_8P3_ASCII_MIXED_TYPE;
7758  }
7759  }
7760  }
7761  }
7762  }
7763 
7764  return fileNameType;
7765 }
7766 
7767 
7768 /**********************************************************************
7769  Function:
7770  int FSfseek(FSFILE *stream, long offset, int whence)
7771  Summary:
7772  Change the current position in a file
7773  Conditions:
7774  File opened
7775  Input:
7776  stream - Pointer to file structure
7777  offset - Offset from base location
7778  whence -
7779  - SEEK_SET - Seek from start of file
7780  - SEEK_CUR - Seek from current location
7781  - SEEK_END - Seek from end of file (subtract offset)
7782  Return Values:
7783  0 - Operation successful
7784  -1 - Operation unsuccesful
7785  Side Effects:
7786  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
7787  Description:
7788  The FSfseek function will change the current position in the file to
7789  one specified by the user. First, an absolute offset is calculated
7790  using the offset and base location passed in by the user. Then, the
7791  position variables are updated, and the sector number that corresponds
7792  to the new location. That sector is then loaded. If the offset
7793  falls exactly on a cluster boundary, a new cluster will be allocated
7794  to the file and the position will be set to the first byte of that
7795  cluster.
7796  Remarks:
7797  None
7798  **********************************************************************/
7799 
7800 int FSfseek(FSFILE *stream, long offset, int whence)
7801 {
7802  DWORD numsector, temp; // lba of first sector of first cluster
7803  DISK* dsk; // pointer to disk structure
7804  BYTE test;
7805  long offset2 = offset;
7806 
7807  dsk = stream->dsk;
7808 
7809  switch(whence)
7810  {
7811  case SEEK_CUR:
7812  // Apply the offset to the current position
7813  offset2 += stream->seek;
7814  break;
7815  case SEEK_END:
7816  // Apply the offset to the end of the file
7817  offset2 = stream->size - offset2;
7818  break;
7819  case SEEK_SET:
7820  // automatically there
7821  default:
7822  break;
7823  }
7824 
7825 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
7826  if (gNeedDataWrite)
7827  if (flushData())
7828  {
7829  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
7830  return EOF;
7831  }
7832 #endif
7833 
7834  // start from the beginning
7835  temp = stream->cluster;
7836  stream->ccls = temp;
7837 
7838  temp = stream->size;
7839 
7840  if (offset2 > temp)
7841  {
7842  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
7843  return (-1); // past the limits
7844  }
7845  else
7846  {
7847  // if we are writing we are no longer at the end
7848  stream->flags.FileWriteEOF = FALSE;
7849 
7850  // set the new postion
7851  stream->seek = offset2;
7852 
7853  // figure out how many sectors
7854  numsector = offset2 / dsk->sectorSize;
7855 
7856  // figure out how many bytes off of the offset
7857  offset2 = offset2 - (numsector * dsk->sectorSize);
7858  stream->pos = offset2;
7859 
7860  // figure out how many clusters
7861  temp = numsector / dsk->SecPerClus;
7862 
7863  // figure out the stranded sectors
7864  numsector = numsector - (dsk->SecPerClus * temp);
7865  stream->sec = numsector;
7866 
7867  // if we are in the current cluster stay there
7868  if (temp > 0)
7869  {
7870  test = FILEget_next_cluster(stream, temp);
7871  if (test != CE_GOOD)
7872  {
7873  if (test == CE_FAT_EOF)
7874  {
7875 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
7876  if (stream->flags.write)
7877  {
7878  // load the previous cluster
7879  stream->ccls = stream->cluster;
7880  // Don't perform this operation if there's only one cluster
7881  if (temp != 1)
7882  test = FILEget_next_cluster(stream, temp - 1);
7883  if (FILEallocate_new_cluster(stream, 0) != CE_GOOD)
7884  {
7885  FSerrno = CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER;
7886  return -1;
7887  }
7888  // sec and pos should already be zero
7889  }
7890  else
7891  {
7892 #endif
7893  stream->ccls = stream->cluster;
7894  test = FILEget_next_cluster(stream, temp - 1);
7895  if (test != CE_GOOD)
7896  {
7897  FSerrno = CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER;
7898  return (-1);
7899  }
7900  stream->pos = dsk->sectorSize;
7901  stream->sec = dsk->SecPerClus - 1;
7902 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
7903  }
7904 #endif
7905  }
7906  else
7907  {
7908  FSerrno = CE_COULD_NOT_GET_CLUSTER;
7909  return (-1); // past the limits
7910  }
7911  }
7912  }
7913 
7914  // Determine the lba of the selected sector and load
7915  temp = Cluster2Sector(dsk,stream->ccls);
7916 
7917  // now the extra sectors
7918  numsector = stream->sec;
7919  temp += numsector;
7920 
7921  gBufferOwner = NULL;
7922  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
7923  if( !MDD_SectorRead(temp, dsk->buffer) )
7924  {
7925  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
7926  return (-1); // Bad read
7927  }
7928  gLastDataSectorRead = temp;
7929  }
7930 
7931  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
7932 
7933  return (0);
7934 }
7935 
7936 
7937 // FSfopenpgm, FSremovepgm, and FSrenamepgm will only work on PIC18s
7938 #ifdef __18CXX
7939 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
7940 
7941 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
7942 
7943 /*****************************************************************
7944  Function:
7945  int FSrenamepgm(const rom char * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
7946  Summary:
7947  Renames the file with the ascii ROM string(PIC18)
7948  Conditions:
7949  File opened.
7950  Input:
7951  fileName - The new name of the file (in ROM)
7952  fo - The file to rename
7953  Return Values:
7954  0 - File renamed successfully
7955  -1 - File could not be renamed
7956  Side Effects:
7957  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
7958  Description:
7959  Renames the file with the ascii ROM string(PIC18).The Fsrenamepgm
7960  function will copy the rom fileName specified by the user into a
7961  RAM array and pass that array into the FSrename function.
7962  Remarks:
7963  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
7964  *****************************************************************/
7965 
7966 int FSrenamepgm (const rom char * fileName, FSFILE * fo)
7967 {
7968  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
7969 
7970  char tempArray[257];
7971  unsigned short int count;
7972  #else
7973 
7974  char tempArray[13];
7975 
7976  BYTE count;
7977  #endif
7978 
7979 
7980  *fileName;
7981  for(count = 0; count < sizeof(tempArray); count++)
7982  {
7983  _asm TBLRDPOSTINC _endasm
7984  tempArray[count] = TABLAT;
7985  }//end for(...)
7986 
7987  return FSrename (tempArray, fo);
7988 }
7989 #endif
7990 
7991 /******************************************************************************
7992  Function:
7993  FSFILE * FSfopenpgm(const rom char * fileName, const rom char *mode)
7994  Summary:
7995  Opens a file on PIC18 Microcontrollers where 'fileName' ROM string is given
7996  in Ascii format.
7997  Conditions:
7998  For read modes, file exists; FSInit performed
7999  Input:
8000  fileName - The name of the file to be opened (ROM)
8001  mode - The mode the file will be opened in (ROM)
8002  Return Values:
8003  FSFILE * - A pointer to the file object
8004  NULL - File could not be opened
8005  Side Effects:
8006  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
8007  Description:
8008  This function opens a file on PIC18 Microcontrollers where 'fileName' ROM string
8009  is given in Ascii format.The FSfopenpgm function will copy a PIC18 ROM fileName and
8010  mode argument into RAM arrays, and then pass those arrays to the FSfopen function.
8011  Remarks:
8012  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
8013  ******************************************************************************/
8014 
8015 FSFILE * FSfopenpgm(const rom char * fileName, const rom char *mode)
8016 {
8017  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
8018  char tempArray[257];
8019  unsigned short int count = 0;
8020  #else
8021  char tempArray[13];
8022  BYTE count = 0;
8023  #endif
8024  char M[2];
8025 
8026  for(;;)
8027  {
8028  tempArray[count] = fileName[count];
8029  if(tempArray[count])
8030  count++;
8031  else
8032  break;
8033  }
8034 
8035  for (count = 0; count < 2; count++)
8036  {
8037  M[count] = *(mode + count);
8038  }
8039 
8040  return FSfopen(tempArray, M);
8041 }
8042 
8043 /*************************************************************
8044  Function:
8045  int FSremovepgm (const rom char * fileName)
8046  Summary:
8047  Deletes the file on PIC18 device
8048  Conditions:
8049  File not opened; file exists
8050  Input:
8051  fileName - The name of the file to be deleted (ROM)
8052  Return Values:
8053  0 - File was removed successfully
8054  -1 - File could not be removed
8055  Side Effects:
8056  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
8057  Description:
8058  Deletes the file on PIC18 device.The FSremovepgm function will copy a
8059  PIC18 ROM fileName argument into a RAM array, and then pass that array
8060  to the FSremove function.
8061  Remarks:
8062  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
8063  *************************************************************/
8064 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
8065 int FSremovepgm (const rom char * fileName)
8066 {
8067  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8068  char tempArray[257];
8069  unsigned short int count;
8070  #else
8071 
8072  char tempArray[13];
8073 
8074  BYTE count;
8075  #endif
8076 
8077 
8078  *fileName;
8079  for(count = 0; count < sizeof(tempArray); count++)
8080  {
8081  _asm TBLRDPOSTINC _endasm
8082  tempArray[count] = TABLAT;
8083  }//end for(...)
8084
