8085  return FSremove (tempArray);
8086 }
8087 #endif
8088 
8089 /**************************************************************************************
8090  Function:
8091  int FindFirstpgm (const char * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
8092  Summary:
8093  Find a file named with a ROM string on PIC18
8094  Conditions:
8095  None
8096  Input:
8097  fileName - The name of the file to be found (ROM)
8098  attr - The attributes of the file to be found
8099  rec - Pointer to a search record to store the file info in
8100  Return Values:
8101  0 - File was found
8102  -1 - No file matching the given parameters was found
8103  Side Effects:
8104  Search criteria from previous FindFirstpgm call on passed SearchRec object
8105  will be lost.The FSerrno variable will be changed.
8106  Description:
8107  This function finds a file named with 'fileName' on PIC18. The FindFirstpgm
8108  function will copy a PIC18 ROM fileName argument into a RAM array, and then
8109  pass that array to the FindFirst function.
8110  Remarks:
8111  Call FindFirstpgm or FindFirst before calling FindNext.
8112  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
8113  **************************************************************************************/
8114 #ifdef ALLOW_FILESEARCH
8115 int FindFirstpgm (const rom char * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
8116 {
8117  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
8118 
8119  char tempArray[257];
8120  unsigned short int count;
8121  #else
8122 
8123  char tempArray[13];
8124 
8125  BYTE count;
8126  #endif
8127 
8128 
8129  *fileName;
8130  for(count = 0; count < sizeof(tempArray); count++)
8131  {
8132  _asm TBLRDPOSTINC _endasm
8133  tempArray[count] = TABLAT;
8134  }//end for
8135 
8136  return FindFirst (tempArray,attr,rec);
8137 }
8138 #endif
8139 #endif
8140 #endif
8141 
8142 
8143 /***********************************************
8144  Function:
8145  DWORD ReadFAT (DISK *dsk, DWORD ccls)
8146  Summary:
8147  Read the next entry from the FAT
8148  Conditions:
8149  This function should not be called by the user.
8150  Input:
8151  dsk - The disk structure
8152  ccls - The current cluster
8153  Return:
8154  DWORD - The next cluster in a file chain
8155  Side Effects:
8156  None
8157  Description:
8158  The ReadFAT function will read the FAT and
8159  determine the next cluster value after the
8160  cluster specified by 'ccls.' Note that the
8161  FAT sector that is read is stored in the
8162  global FAT cache buffer.
8163  Remarks:
8164  None.
8165  ***********************************************/
8166 
8167 DWORD ReadFAT (DISK *dsk, DWORD ccls)
8168 {
8169  BYTE q;
8170  DWORD p, l; // "l" is the sector Address
8171  DWORD c = 0, d, ClusterFailValue,LastClusterLimit; // ClusterEntries
8172 
8173  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
8174 
8175  /* Settings based on FAT type */
8176  switch (dsk->type)
8177  {
8178 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8179  case FAT32:
8180  p = (DWORD)ccls * 4;
8181  q = 0; // "q" not used for FAT32, only initialized to remove a warning
8182  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
8183  LastClusterLimit = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT32;
8184  break;
8185 #endif
8186  case FAT12:
8187  p = (DWORD) ccls *3; // Mulby1.5 to find cluster pos in FAT
8188  q = p&1;
8189  p >>= 1;
8190  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
8191  LastClusterLimit = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT12;
8192  break;
8193  case FAT16:
8194  default:
8195  p = (DWORD)ccls *2; // Mulby 2 to find cluster pos in FAT
8196  q = 0; // "q" not used for FAT16, only initialized to remove a warning
8197  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
8198  LastClusterLimit = LAST_CLUSTER_FAT16;
8199  break;
8200  }
8201 
8202  l = dsk->fat + (p / dsk->sectorSize); //
8203  p &= dsk->sectorSize - 1; // Restrict 'p' within the FATbuffer size
8204 
8205  // Check if the appropriate FAT sector is already loaded
8206  if (gLastFATSectorRead == l)
8207  {
8208 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8209  if (dsk->type == FAT32)
8210  c = RAMreadD (gFATBuffer, p);
8211  else
8212 #endif
8213  if(dsk->type == FAT16)
8214  c = RAMreadW (gFATBuffer, p);
8215  else if(dsk->type == FAT12)
8216  {
8217  c = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8218  if (q)
8219  {
8220  c >>= 4;
8221  }
8222  // Check if the MSB is across the sector boundry
8223  p = (p +1) & (dsk->sectorSize-1);
8224  if (p == 0)
8225  {
8226  // Start by writing the sector we just worked on to the card
8227  // if we need to
8228 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
8229  if (gNeedFATWrite)
8230  if(WriteFAT (dsk, 0, 0, TRUE))
8231  return ClusterFailValue;
8232 #endif
8233  if (!MDD_SectorRead (l+1, gFATBuffer))
8234  {
8235  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFF;
8236  return ClusterFailValue;
8237  }
8238  else
8239  {
8240  gLastFATSectorRead = l +1;
8241  }
8242  }
8243  d = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8244  if (q)
8245  {
8246  c += (d <<4);
8247  }
8248  else
8249  {
8250  c += ((d & 0x0F)<<8);
8251  }
8252  }
8253  }
8254  else
8255  {
8256  // If there's a currently open FAT sector,
8257  // write it back before reading into the buffer
8258 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
8259  if (gNeedFATWrite)
8260  {
8261  if(WriteFAT (dsk, 0, 0, TRUE))
8262  return ClusterFailValue;
8263  }
8264 #endif
8265  if (!MDD_SectorRead (l, gFATBuffer))
8266  {
8267  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFF; // Note: It is Sector not Cluster.
8268  return ClusterFailValue;
8269  }
8270  else
8271  {
8272  gLastFATSectorRead = l;
8273 
8274 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8275  if (dsk->type == FAT32)
8276  c = RAMreadD (gFATBuffer, p);
8277  else
8278 #endif
8279  if(dsk->type == FAT16)
8280  c = RAMreadW (gFATBuffer, p);
8281  else if (dsk->type == FAT12)
8282  {
8283  c = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8284  if (q)
8285  {
8286  c >>= 4;
8287  }
8288  p = (p +1) & (dsk->sectorSize-1);
8289  d = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8290  if (q)
8291  {
8292  c += (d <<4);
8293  }
8294  else
8295  {
8296  c += ((d & 0x0F)<<8);
8297  }
8298  }
8299  }
8300  }
8301 
8302  // Normalize it so 0xFFFF is an error
8303  if (c >= LastClusterLimit)
8304  c = LastClusterLimit;
8305 
8306  return c;
8307 } // ReadFAT
8308 
8309 
8310 
8311 /****************************************************************************
8312  Function:
8313  WORD WriteFAT (DISK *dsk, DWORD ccls, WORD value, BYTE forceWrite)
8314  Summary:
8315  Write an entry to the FAT
8316  Conditions:
8317  This function should not be called by the user.
8318  Input:
8319  dsk - The disk structure
8320  ccls - The current cluster
8321  value - The value to write in
8322  forceWrite - Force the function to write the current FAT sector
8323  Return:
8324  0 - The FAT write was successful
8325  FAIL - The FAT could not be written
8326  Side Effects:
8327  None
8328  Description:
8329  The WriteFAT function writes an entry to the FAT. If the function
8330  is called and the 'forceWrite' argument is TRUE, the function will
8331  write the existing FAT data to the device. Otherwise, the function
8332  will replace a single entry in the FAT buffer (indicated by 'ccls')
8333  with a new value (indicated by 'value.')
8334  Remarks:
8335  None.
8336  ****************************************************************************/
8337 
8338 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
8339 DWORD WriteFAT (DISK *dsk, DWORD ccls, DWORD value, BYTE forceWrite)
8340 {
8341  BYTE i, q, c;
8342  DWORD p, li, l, ClusterFailValue;
8343 
8344 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8345  if ((dsk->type != FAT32) && (dsk->type != FAT16) && (dsk->type != FAT12))
8346  return CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
8347 #else // If FAT32 support not enabled
8348  if ((dsk->type != FAT16) && (dsk->type != FAT12))
8349  return CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
8350 #endif
8351 
8352  /* Settings based on FAT type */
8353  switch (dsk->type)
8354  {
8355 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8356  case FAT32:
8357  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT32;
8358  break;
8359 #endif
8360  case FAT12:
8361  case FAT16:
8362  default:
8363  ClusterFailValue = CLUSTER_FAIL_FAT16;
8364  break;
8365  }
8366 
8367  gBufferZeroed = FALSE;
8368 
8369  // The only purpose for calling this function with forceWrite
8370  // is to write the current FAT sector to the card
8371  if (forceWrite)
8372  {
8373  for (i = 0, li = gLastFATSectorRead; i < dsk->fatcopy; i++, li += dsk->fatsize)
8374  {
8375  if (!MDD_SectorWrite (li, gFATBuffer, FALSE))
8376  {
8377  return ClusterFailValue;
8378  }
8379  }
8380 
8381  gNeedFATWrite = FALSE;
8382 
8383  return 0;
8384  }
8385 
8386  /* Settings based on FAT type */
8387  switch (dsk->type)
8388  {
8389 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8390  case FAT32:
8391  p = (DWORD)ccls *4; // "p" is the position in "gFATBuffer" for corresponding cluster.
8392  q = 0; // "q" not used for FAT32, only initialized to remove a warning
8393  break;
8394 #endif
8395  case FAT12:
8396  p = (DWORD) ccls * 3; // "p" is the position in "gFATBuffer" for corresponding cluster.
8397  q = p & 1; // Odd or even?
8398  p >>= 1;
8399  break;
8400  case FAT16:
8401  default:
8402  p = (DWORD) ccls *2; // "p" is the position in "gFATBuffer" for corresponding cluster.
8403  q = 0; // "q" not used for FAT16, only initialized to remove a warning
8404  break;
8405  }
8406 
8407  l = dsk->fat + (p / dsk->sectorSize); //
8408  p &= dsk->sectorSize - 1; // Restrict 'p' within the FATbuffer size
8409 
8410  if (gLastFATSectorRead != l)
8411  {
8412  // If we are loading a new sector then write
8413  // the current one to the card if we need to
8414  if (gNeedFATWrite)
8415  {
8416  for (i = 0, li = gLastFATSectorRead; i < dsk->fatcopy; i++, li += dsk->fatsize)
8417  {
8418  if (!MDD_SectorWrite (li, gFATBuffer, FALSE))
8419  {
8420  return ClusterFailValue;
8421  }
8422  }
8423 
8424  gNeedFATWrite = FALSE;
8425  }
8426 
8427  // Load the new sector
8428  if (!MDD_SectorRead (l, gFATBuffer))
8429  {
8430  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFF;
8431  return ClusterFailValue;
8432  }
8433  else
8434  {
8435  gLastFATSectorRead = l;
8436  }
8437  }
8438 
8439 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
8440  if (dsk->type == FAT32) // Refer page 16 of FAT requirement.
8441  {
8442  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p, ((value & 0x000000ff))); // lsb,1st byte of cluster value
8443  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p+1, ((value & 0x0000ff00) >> 8));
8444  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p+2, ((value & 0x00ff0000) >> 16));
8445  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p+3, ((value & 0x0f000000) >> 24)); // the MSB nibble is supposed to be "0" in FAT32. So mask it.
8446  }
8447  else
8448 
8449 #endif
8450  {
8451  if (dsk->type == FAT16)
8452  {
8453  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p, value); //lsB
8454  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p+1, ((value&0x0000ff00) >> 8)); // msB
8455  }
8456  else if (dsk->type == FAT12)
8457  {
8458  // Get the current byte from the FAT
8459  c = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8460  if (q)
8461  {
8462  c = ((value & 0x0F) << 4) | ( c & 0x0F);
8463  }
8464  else
8465  {
8466  c = (value & 0xFF);
8467  }
8468  // Write in those bits
8469  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p, c);
8470 
8471  // FAT12 entries can cross sector boundaries
8472  // Check if we need to load a new sector
8473  p = (p +1) & (dsk->sectorSize-1);
8474  if (p == 0)
8475  {
8476  // call this function to update the FAT on the card
8477  if (WriteFAT (dsk, 0,0,TRUE))
8478  return ClusterFailValue;
8479 
8480  // Load the next sector
8481  if (!MDD_SectorRead (l +1, gFATBuffer))
8482  {
8483  gLastFATSectorRead = 0xFFFF;
8484  return ClusterFailValue;
8485  }
8486  else
8487  {
8488  gLastFATSectorRead = l + 1;
8489  }
8490  }
8491 
8492  // Get the second byte of the table entry
8493  c = RAMread (gFATBuffer, p);
8494  if (q)
8495  {
8496  c = (value >> 4);
8497  }
8498  else
8499  {
8500  c = ((value >> 8) & 0x0F) | (c & 0xF0);
8501  }
8502  RAMwrite (gFATBuffer, p, c);
8503  }
8504  }
8505  gNeedFATWrite = TRUE;
8506 
8507  return 0;
8508 }
8509 #endif
8510 
8511 
8512 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
8513 
8514 // This string is used by dir functions to hold dir names temporarily
8515 #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
8516  char tempDirectoryString [522];
8517 #else
8518  char tempDirectoryString [14];
8519 #endif
8520 /**************************************************************************
8521  Function:
8522  int FSchdir (char * path)
8523  Summary:
8524  Changes the current working directory to the ascii input path(PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC)
8525  Conditions:
8526  None
8527  Input:
8528  path - The path of the directory to change to.
8529  Return Values:
8530  0 - The current working directory was changed successfully
8531  EOF - The current working directory could not be changed
8532  Side Effects:
8533  The current working directory may be changed. The FSerrno variable will
8534  be changed.
8535  Description:
8536  Changes the current working directory to the ascii input path(PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
8537  The FSchdir function passes a RAM pointer to the path to the chdirhelper function.
8538  Remarks:
8539  None
8540  **************************************************************************/
8541 
8542 int FSchdir (char * path)
8543 {
8544  return chdirhelper (0, path, NULL);
8545 }
8546 
8547 /**************************************************************************
8548  Function:
8549  int wFSchdir (unsigned short int * path)
8550  Summary:
8551  Change the current working directory as per the path specified in
8552  UTF16 format (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC)
8553  Conditions:
8554  None
8555  Input:
8556  path - The path of the directory to change to.
8557  Return Values:
8558  0 - The current working directory was changed successfully
8559  EOF - The current working directory could not be changed
8560  Side Effects:
8561  The current working directory may be changed. The FSerrno variable will
8562  be changed.
8563  Description:
8564  Change the current working directory as per the path specified in
8565  UTF16 format (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).The FSchdir function passes a RAM
8566  pointer to the path to the chdirhelper function.
8567  Remarks:
8568  None
8569  **************************************************************************/
8570 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8571 int wFSchdir (unsigned short int * path)
8572 {
8573  int result;
8574  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
8575  result = chdirhelper (0, (char *)path, NULL);
8576  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
8577  return result;
8578 }
8579 #endif
8580 
8581 /**************************************************************************
8582  Function:
8583  int FSchdirpgm (const rom char * path)
8584  Summary:
8585  Changes the CWD to the input path on PIC18
8586  Conditions:
8587  None
8588  Input:
8589  path - The path of the directory to change to (ROM)
8590  Return Values:
8591  0 - The current working directory was changed successfully
8592  EOF - The current working directory could not be changed
8593  Side Effects:
8594  The current working directory may be changed. The FSerrno variable will
8595  be changed.
8596  Description:
8597  Changes the CWD to the input path on PIC18.The FSchdirpgm function
8598  passes a PIC18 ROM path pointer to the chdirhelper function.
8599  Remarks:
8600  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM
8601  **************************************************************************/
8602 
8603 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8604 int FSchdirpgm (const rom char * path)
8605 {
8606  return chdirhelper (1, NULL, path);
8607 }
8608 
8609 /**************************************************************************
8610  Function:
8611  int wFSchdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path)
8612  Summary:
8613  Changed the CWD with a path in ROM on PIC18
8614  Conditions:
8615  None
8616  Input:
8617  path - The path of the directory to change to (ROM)
8618  Return Values:
8619  0 - The current working directory was changed successfully
8620  EOF - The current working directory could not be changed
8621  Side Effects:
8622  The current working directory may be changed. The FSerrno variable will
8623  be changed.
8624  Description:
8625  The FSchdirpgm function passes a PIC18 ROM path pointer to the
8626  chdirhelper function.
8627  Remarks:
8628  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM
8629  **************************************************************************/
8630 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8631 int wFSchdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path)
8632 {
8633  int result;
8634  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
8635  result = chdirhelper (1, NULL, (const char *)path);
8636  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
8637  return result;
8638 }
8639 #endif
8640 
8641 #endif
8642 
8643 /*************************************************************************
8644  Function:
8645  // PIC24/30/33/32
8646  int chdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr);
8647  // PIC18
8648  int chdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr);
8649  Summary:
8650  Helper function for FSchdir
8651  Conditions:
8652  None
8653  Input:
8654  mode - Indicates which path pointer to use
8655  ramptr - Pointer to the path specified in RAM
8656  romptr - Pointer to the path specified in ROM
8657  Return Values:
8658  0 - Directory was changed successfully.
8659  EOF - Directory could not be changed.
8660  Side Effects:
8661  The current working directory will be changed. The FSerrno variable
8662  will be changed. Any unwritten data in the data buffer will be written
8663  to the device.
8664  Description:
8665  This helper function is used by the FSchdir function. If the path
8666  argument is specified in ROM for PIC18 this function will be able to
8667  parse it correctly. The function will loop through a switch statement
8668  to process the tokens in the path string. Dot or dotdot entries are
8669  handled in the first case statement. A backslash character is handled
8670  in the second case statement (note that this case statement will only
8671  be used if backslash is the first character in the path; backslash
8672  token delimiters will automatically be skipped after each token in the
8673  path is processed). The third case statement will handle actual
8674  directory name strings.
8675  Remarks:
8676  None.
8677  *************************************************************************/
8678 
8679 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8680 int chdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr)
8681 #else
8682 int chdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr)
8683 #endif
8684 {
8685  unsigned short int i,j,k = 0;
8686  WORD curent = 1;
8687  DIRENTRY entry;
8688  char * temppath = ramptr;
8689 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8690  rom char * temppath2 = romptr;
8691  rom unsigned short int * utf16path2 = (rom unsigned short int *)romptr;
8692 #endif
8693  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8694  unsigned short int *utf16path = (unsigned short int *)ramptr;
8695  #endif
8696 
8697  FSFILE tempCWDobj2;
8698  FILEOBJ tempCWD = &tempCWDobj2;
8699 
8700  FileObjectCopy (tempCWD, cwdptr);
8701 
8702  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
8703 
8704  // Check the first char of the path
8705 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8706  if (mode)
8707  {
8708  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8709  if(utfModeFileName)
8710 
8711  {
8712 
8713  i = *utf16path2;
8714  }
8715  else
8716  #endif
8717  {
8718  i = *temppath2;
8719  }
8720  }
8721  else
8722 #endif
8723  {
8724  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8725  if(utfModeFileName)
8726 
8727  {
8728 
8729  i = *utf16path;
8730  }
8731  else
8732  #endif
8733  {
8734  i = *temppath;
8735  }
8736  }
8737 
8738  // if NULL character return error
8739  if (i == 0)
8740  {
8741  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
8742  return -1;
8743  }
8744 
8745  while(1)
8746  {
8747  switch (i)
8748  {
8749  // First case: dot or dotdot entry
8750  case '.':
8751  // Move past the dot
8752 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8753  if (mode)
8754  {
8755  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8756  if(utfModeFileName)
8757 
8758  {
8759 
8760  utf16path2++;
8761  i = *utf16path2;
8762  }
8763  else
8764  #endif
8765  {
8766  temppath2++;
8767  i = *temppath2;
8768  }
8769  }
8770  else
8771  {
8772 #endif
8773  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8774  if(utfModeFileName)
8775 
8776  {
8777 
8778  utf16path++;
8779  i = *utf16path;
8780  }
8781  else
8782  #endif
8783  {
8784  temppath++;
8785  i = *temppath;
8786  }
8787 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8788  }
8789 #endif
8790  // Check if it's a dotdot entry
8791  if (i == '.')
8792  {
8793  // Increment the path variable
8794 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8795  if (mode)
8796  {
8797  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8798  if(utfModeFileName)
8799 
8800  {
8801 
8802  utf16path2++;
8803  i = *utf16path2;
8804  }
8805  else
8806  #endif
8807  {
8808  temppath2++;
8809  i = *temppath2;
8810  }
8811  }
8812  else
8813  {
8814 #endif
8815  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8816  if(utfModeFileName)
8817 
8818  {
8819 
8820  utf16path++;
8821  i = *utf16path;
8822  }
8823  else
8824  #endif
8825  {
8826  temppath++;
8827  i = *temppath;
8828  }
8829 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8830  }
8831 #endif
8832  // Check if we're in the root
8833  if (tempCWD->dirclus == FatRootDirClusterValue)
8834  {
8835  // Fails if there's a dotdot chdir from the root
8836  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
8837  return -1;
8838  }
8839  else
8840  {
8841  // Cache the dotdot entry
8842  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
8843  curent = 1;
8844  entry = Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD, &curent, TRUE);
8845  if (entry == NULL)
8846  {
8847  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
8848  return -1;
8849  }
8850 
8851  // Get the cluster
8852  tempCWD->dirclus = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get Complete Cluster number.
8853  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
8854 
8855  // If we changed to root, record the name
8856  if (tempCWD->dirclus == VALUE_DOTDOT_CLUSTER_VALUE_FOR_ROOT) // "0" is the value of Dotdot entry for Root in both FAT types.
8857  {
8858  j = 0;
8859  tempCWD->name[j++] = '\\';
8860 // if(utfModeFileName)
8861 // {
8862 // tempCWD->name[j++] = 0x00;
8863 // }
8864  for (;j < 11;)
8865  {
8866  tempCWD->name[j] = 0x20;
8867  ++j;
8868  }
8869 
8870  /* While moving to Root, get the Root cluster value */
8871  tempCWD->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
8872  tempCWD->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
8873  }
8874  else
8875  {
8876  // Otherwise set the name to ..
8877  j = 0;
8878  tempCWD->name[j++] = '.';
8879 // if(utfModeFileName)
8880 // {
8881 // tempCWD->name[j++] = 0x00;
8882 // tempCWD->name[j++] = '.';
8883 // tempCWD->name[j++] = 0x00;
8884 // }
8885 // else
8886  {
8887  tempCWD->name[j++] = '.';
8888  }
8889  for (; j < 11;)
8890  {
8891  tempCWD->name[j] = 0x20;
8892  ++j;
8893  }
8894  }
8895  // Cache the dot entry
8896  curent = 0;
8897  if (Cache_File_Entry(tempCWD, &curent, TRUE) == NULL)
8898  {
8899  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
8900  return -1;
8901  }
8902  // Move past the next backslash, if necessary
8903  while (i == '\\')
8904  {
8905 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8906  if (mode)
8907  {
8908  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8909  if(utfModeFileName)
8910 
8911  {
8912 
8913  utf16path2++;
8914  i = *utf16path2;
8915  }
8916  else
8917  #endif
8918  {
8919  temppath2++;
8920  i = *temppath2;
8921  }
8922  }
8923  else
8924  {
8925 #endif
8926  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8927  if(utfModeFileName)
8928 
8929  {
8930 
8931  utf16path++;
8932  i = *utf16path;
8933  }
8934  else
8935  #endif
8936  {
8937  temppath++;
8938  i = *temppath;
8939  }
8940 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8941  }
8942 #endif
8943  }
8944  // Copy and return, if we're at the end
8945  if (i == 0)
8946  {
8947  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
8948  return 0;
8949  }
8950  }
8951  }
8952  else
8953  {
8954  // If we ended with a . entry,
8955  // just return what we have
8956  if (i == 0)
8957  {
8958  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
8959  return 0;
8960  }
8961  else
8962  {
8963  if (i == '\\')
8964  {
8965  while (i == '\\')
8966  {
8967 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
8968  if (mode)
8969  {
8970  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8971  if(utfModeFileName)
8972 
8973  {
8974 
8975  utf16path2++;
8976  i = *utf16path2;
8977  }
8978  else
8979  #endif
8980  {
8981  temppath2++;
8982  i = *temppath2;
8983  }
8984  }
8985  else
8986  {
8987 #endif
8988  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
8989  if(utfModeFileName)
8990 
8991  {
8992 
8993  utf16path++;
8994  i = *utf16path;
8995  }
8996  else
8997  #endif
8998  {
8999  temppath++;
9000  i = *temppath;
9001  }
9002 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9003  }
9004 #endif
9005  }
9006  if (i == 0)
9007  {
9008  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
9009  return 0;
9010  }
9011  }
9012  else
9013  {
9014  // Anything else after a dot doesn't make sense
9015  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
9016  return -1;
9017  }
9018  }
9019  }
9020 
9021  break;
9022 
9023  // Second case: the first char is the root backslash
9024  // We will ONLY switch to this case if the first char
9025  // of the path is a backslash
9026  case '\\':
9027  // Increment pointer to second char
9028 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9029  if (mode)
9030  {
9031  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9032  if(utfModeFileName)
9033 
9034  {
9035 
9036  utf16path2++;
9037  i = *utf16path2;
9038  }
9039  else
9040  #endif
9041  {
9042  temppath2++;
9043  i = *temppath2;
9044  }
9045  }
9046  else
9047  {
9048 #endif
9049  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9050  if(utfModeFileName)
9051 
9052  {
9053 
9054  utf16path++;
9055  i = *utf16path;
9056  }
9057  else
9058  #endif
9059  {
9060  temppath++;
9061  i = *temppath;
9062  }
9063 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9064  }
9065 #endif
9066  // Can't start the path with multiple backslashes
9067  if (i == '\\')
9068  {
9069  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
9070  return -1;
9071  }
9072 
9073  if (i == 0)
9074  {
9075  // The user is changing directory to
9076  // the root
9077  cwdptr->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9078  cwdptr->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9079  j = 0;
9080  cwdptr->name[j++] = '\\';
9081 // if(utfModeFileName)
9082 // {
9083 // cwdptr->name[j++] = 0x00;
9084 // }
9085  for (; j < 11;)
9086  {
9087  cwdptr->name[j] = 0x20;
9088  ++j;
9089  }
9090  return 0;
9091  }
9092  else
9093  {
9094  // Our first char is the root dir switch
9095  tempCWD->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9096  tempCWD->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9097  j = 0;
9098  tempCWD->name[j++] = '\\';
9099 // if(utfModeFileName)
9100 // {
9101 // tempCWD->name[j++] = 0x00;
9102 // }
9103  for (; j < 11;)
9104  {
9105  tempCWD->name[j] = 0x20;
9106  ++j;
9107  }
9108  }
9109  break;
9110 
9111  default:
9112  // We should be at the beginning of a string of letters/numbers
9113  j = 0;
9114 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9115  if (mode)
9116  {
9117  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9118  if(utfModeFileName)
9119 
9120  {
9121 
9122  // Change directories as specified
9123  k = 512;
9124 
9125 
9126 
9127  // Parse the next token
9128  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
9129  {
9130  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i;
9131  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i >> 8;
9132  i = *(++utf16path2);
9133  }
9134 
9135  tempDirectoryString[j++] = 0;
9136  }
9137 
9138  else
9139 
9140  #endif
9141  {
9142 
9143  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9144 
9145  k = 256;
9146 
9147  #else
9148 
9149  k = 12;
9150 
9151  #endif
9152 
9153 
9154 
9155  // Parse the next token
9156  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
9157  {
9158  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i;
9159  i = *(++temppath2);
9160  }
9161  }
9162 
9163  }
9164  else
9165  {
9166 #endif
9167  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9168  if(utfModeFileName)
9169 
9170  {
9171 
9172  // Change directories as specified
9173  k = 512;
9174 
9175 
9176 
9177  // Parse the next token
9178  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
9179  {
9180  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i;
9181  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i >> 8;
9182  i = *(++utf16path);
9183  }
9184 
9185  tempDirectoryString[j++] = 0;
9186  }
9187 
9188  else
9189 
9190  #endif
9191  {
9192 
9193  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9194 
9195  k = 256;
9196 
9197  #else
9198 
9199  k = 12;
9200 
9201  #endif
9202 
9203 
9204 
9205  // Parse the next token
9206  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
9207  {
9208  tempDirectoryString[j++] = i;
9209  i = *(++temppath);
9210  }
9211  }
9212 
9213 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9214  }
9215 #endif
9216 
9217  tempDirectoryString[j++] = 0;
9218 
9219  // We got a whole 12 chars
9220  // There could be more- truncate it
9221  if (j > k)
9222  {
9223  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\'))
9224  {
9225 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9226  if (mode)
9227  {
9228  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9229  if(utfModeFileName)
9230 
9231  {
9232 
9233  i = *(++utf16path2);
9234  }
9235  else
9236  #endif
9237  {
9238 
9239  i = *(++temppath2);
9240  }
9241  }
9242  else
9243  {
9244 #endif
9245  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9246  if(utfModeFileName)
9247 
9248  {
9249 
9250  i = *(++utf16path);
9251  }
9252  else
9253  #endif
9254  {
9255 
9256  i = *(++temppath);
9257  }
9258 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9259  }
9260 #endif
9261  }
9262  }
9263 
9264  if (FormatDirName (tempDirectoryString, tempCWD,0) == FALSE)
9265  return -1;
9266 
9267  // copy file object over
9268  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, tempCWD);
9269 
9270  // See if the directory is there
9271  if(FILEfind (&gFileTemp, tempCWD, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) != CE_GOOD)
9272  {
9273  // Couldn't find the DIR
9274  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
9275  return -1;
9276  }
9277  else
9278  {
9279  // Found the file
9280  // Check to make sure it's actually a directory
9281  if ((gFileTemp.attributes & ATTR_DIRECTORY) == 0 )
9282  {
9283  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
9284  return -1;
9285  }
9286 
9287  // Get the new name
9288  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9289  if(!tempCWD->utf16LFNlength)
9290  #endif
9291  for (j = 0; j < 11; j++)
9292  {
9293  tempCWD->name[j] = gFileTemp.name[j];
9294  }
9295 
9296  tempCWD->dirclus = gFileTemp.cluster;
9297  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
9298  }
9299 
9300  if (i == 0)
9301  {
9302  // If we're at the end of the string, we're done
9303  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
9304  return 0;
9305  }
9306  else
9307  {
9308  while (i == '\\')
9309  {
9310  // If we get to another backslash, increment past it
9311 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9312  if (mode)
9313  {
9314  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9315  if(utfModeFileName)
9316 
9317  {
9318 
9319  utf16path2++;
9320  i = *utf16path2;
9321  }
9322  else
9323  #endif
9324  {
9325  temppath2++;
9326  i = *temppath2;
9327  }
9328  }
9329  else
9330  {
9331 #endif
9332  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9333  if(utfModeFileName)
9334 
9335  {
9336 
9337  utf16path++;
9338  i = *utf16path;
9339  }
9340  else
9341  #endif
9342  {
9343  temppath++;
9344  i = *temppath;
9345  }
9346 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
9347  }
9348 #endif
9349  if (i == 0)
9350  {
9351  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
9352  return 0;
9353  }
9354  }
9355  }
9356  break;
9357  }
9358  } // loop
9359 }
9360 
9361 
9362 
9363 // This string is used by FSgetcwd to return the cwd name if the path
9364 // passed into the function is NULL
9365 char defaultArray [10];
9366 
9367 
9368 /**************************************************************
9369  Function:
9370  char * FSgetcwd (char * path, int numchars)
9371  Summary:
9372  Get the current working directory path in Ascii format
9373  Conditions:
9374  None
9375  Input:
9376  path - Pointer to the array to return the cwd name in
9377  numchars - Number of chars in the path
9378  Return Values:
9379  char * - The cwd name string pointer (path or defaultArray)
9380  NULL - The current working directory name could not be loaded.
9381  Side Effects:
9382  The FSerrno variable will be changed
9383  Description:
9384  Get the current working directory path in Ascii format.
9385  The FSgetcwd function will get the name of the current
9386  working directory and return it to the user. The name
9387  will be copied into the buffer pointed to by 'path,'
9388  starting at the root directory and copying as many chars
9389  as possible before the end of the buffer. The buffer
9390  size is indicated by the 'numchars' argument. The first
9391  thing this function will do is load the name of the current
9392  working directory, if it isn't already present. This could
9393  occur if the user switched to the dotdot entry of a
9394  subdirectory immediately before calling this function. The
9395  function will then copy the current working directory name
9396  into the buffer backwards, and insert a backslash character.
9397  Next, the function will continuously switch to the previous
9398  directories and copy their names backwards into the buffer
9399  until it reaches the root. If the buffer overflows, it
9400  will be treated as a circular buffer, and data will be
9401  copied over existing characters, starting at the beginning.
9402  Once the root directory is reached, the text in the buffer
9403  will be swapped, so that the buffer contains as much of the
9404  current working directory name as possible, starting at the
9405  root.
9406  Remarks:
9407  None
9408  **************************************************************/
9409 char * FSgetcwd (char * path, int numchars)
9410 {
9411  // If path is passed in as null, set up a default
9412  // array with 10 characters
9413  unsigned short int totalchars = (path == NULL) ? 10 : numchars;
9414  char * returnPointer;
9415  char * bufferEnd;
9416  FILEOBJ tempCWD = &gFileTemp;
9417  BYTE bufferOverflow = FALSE;
9418  signed char j;
9419  DWORD curclus;
9420  WORD fHandle, tempindex;
9421  short int i = 0, index = 0;
9422  char aChar;
9423  DIRENTRY entry;
9424 
9425  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9426  WORD prevHandle;
9427  UINT16_VAL tempShift;
9428  FSFILE cwdTemp;
9429  LFN_ENTRY *lfno;
9430  unsigned short int *tempLFN = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
9431  #endif
9432 
9433  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
9434 
9435  // Set up the return value
9436  if (path == NULL)
9437  returnPointer = defaultArray;
9438  else
9439  {
9440  returnPointer = path;
9441  if (numchars == 0)
9442  {
9443  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
9444  return NULL;
9445  }
9446  }
9447 
9448  bufferEnd = returnPointer + totalchars - 1;
9449 
9450  FileObjectCopy (tempCWD, cwdptr);
9451 
9452  if (((tempCWD->name[0] == '.') && (tempCWD->name[1] == '.'))
9453  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9454  || tempCWD->utf16LFNlength
9455  #endif
9456  )
9457  {
9458  // We last changed directory into a dotdot entry
9459  // Save the value of the current directory
9460  curclus = tempCWD->dirclus;
9461  // Put this dir's dotdot entry into the dirclus
9462  // Our cwd absolutely is not the root
9463  fHandle = 1;
9464  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
9465  entry = Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD,&fHandle, TRUE);
9466  if (entry == NULL)
9467  {
9468  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
9469  return NULL;
9470  }
9471 
9472  // Get the cluster
9473  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number.
9474 
9475  // For FAT32, if the .. entry is 0, the cluster won't be 0
9476 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32
9477  if (TempClusterCalc == VALUE_DOTDOT_CLUSTER_VALUE_FOR_ROOT)
9478  {
9479  tempCWD->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9480  }
9481  else
9482 #endif
9483  tempCWD->dirclus = TempClusterCalc;
9484 
9485  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
9486 
9487  // Find the direntry for the entry we were just in
9488  fHandle = 0;
9489  entry = Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD, &fHandle, TRUE);
9490  if (entry == NULL)
9491  {
9492  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
9493  return NULL;
9494  }
9495 
9496  // Get the cluster
9497  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number.
9498 
9499  while ((TempClusterCalc != curclus) ||
9500  ((TempClusterCalc == curclus) &&
9501  (((unsigned char)entry->DIR_Name[0] == 0xE5) || (entry->DIR_Attr == ATTR_VOLUME) || (entry->DIR_Attr == ATTR_LONG_NAME))))
9502  {
9503  fHandle++;
9504  entry = Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD, &fHandle, FALSE);
9505  if (entry == NULL)
9506  {
9507  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
9508  return NULL;
9509  }
9510 
9511  // Get the cluster
9512  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number in a loop.
9513  }
9514 
9515  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9516  FileObjectCopy (&cwdTemp, tempCWD);
9517  prevHandle = fHandle - 1;
9518 
9519  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD, &prevHandle, FALSE);
9520 
9521 
9522  while((lfno->LFN_Attribute == ATTR_LONG_NAME) && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_DEL)
9523 
9524  && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_EMPTY))
9525 
9526  {
9527 
9528  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[0];
9529 
9530  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[1];
9531 
9532  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
9533 
9534  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[2];
9535 
9536  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[3];
9537 
9538  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
9539 
9540  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[4];
9541 
9542  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[5];
9543 
9544  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
9545 
9546  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[6];
9547 
9548  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[7];
9549 
9550  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
9551 
9552  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[8];
9553 
9554  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[9];
9555 
9556  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
9557 
9558 
9559 
9560  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[0];
9561 
9562  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[1];
9563 
9564  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[2];
9565 
9566  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[3];
9567 
9568  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[4];
9569 
9570  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[5];
9571 
9572 
9573 
9574  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[0];
9575 
9576  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[1];
9577 
9578 
9579 
9580  prevHandle = prevHandle - 1;
9581 
9582  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (tempCWD, &prevHandle, FALSE);
9583 
9584  }
9585 
9586  FileObjectCopy (tempCWD, &cwdTemp);
9587  #endif
9588 
9589  if(i == 0)
9590  {
9591  for (j = 0; j < 11; j++)
9592  {
9593  tempCWD->name[j] = entry->DIR_Name[j];
9594  cwdptr->name[j] = entry->DIR_Name[j];
9595  }
9596  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9597  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = 0;
9598 
9599  tempCWD->utf16LFNlength = 0;
9600 
9601  #endif
9602  }
9603 
9604  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9605  else
9606  {
9607 
9608  tempCWD->utf16LFNlength = i;
9609 
9610  for(j = 12;j >= 0;j--)
9611  {
9612  if((tempLFN[i - j - 1]) == 0x0000)
9613  {
9614  tempCWD->utf16LFNlength = i - j - 1;
9615  break;
9616  }
9617  }
9618  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = tempCWD->utf16LFNlength;
9619 
9620  tempCWD->utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
9621 
9622  cwdptr->utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
9623 
9624  }
9625 
9626  #endif
9627  // Reset our temp dir back to that cluster
9628  tempCWD->dirclus = curclus;
9629  tempCWD->dirccls = curclus;
9630  // This will set us at the cwd, but it will actually
9631  // have the name in the name field this time
9632  }
9633 
9634  // There's actually some kind of name value in the cwd
9635  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9636  if (((tempCWD->name[0] == '\\') && (tempCWD->utf16LFNlength == 0x0000)) ||
9637  ((tempCWD->utf16LFNlength != 0x0000) && (tempCWD->utf16LFNptr[0] == (unsigned short int)'\\')) || (numchars == 0x02))
9638  #else
9639  if ((tempCWD->name[0] == '\\') || (numchars == 0x02))
9640  #endif
9641  {
9642  // Easy, our CWD is the root
9643  *returnPointer = '\\';
9644  *(returnPointer + 1) = 0;
9645  return returnPointer;
9646  }
9647  else
9648  {
9649  index = 0;
9650  // Loop until we get back to the root
9651  while (tempCWD->dirclus != FatRootDirClusterValue)
9652  {
9653  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
9654  if(tempCWD->utf16LFNlength)
9655  {
9656  i = tempCWD->utf16LFNlength * 2 - 1;
9657  while(i >= 0)
9658  {
9659  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9660  if(twoByteMode)
9661  {
9662  returnPointer[index++] = tempDirectoryString[i--];
9663  if (index == totalchars)
9664  {
9665  index = 0;
9666  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9667  }
9668  }
9669  else
9670  #endif
9671  {
9672  if(tempDirectoryString[i])
9673  {
9674  returnPointer[index++] = tempDirectoryString[i];
9675  if (index == totalchars)
9676  {
9677  index = 0;
9678  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9679  }
9680 
9681  }
9682  i--;
9683  }
9684  }
9685  }
9686  else
9687  #endif
9688  {
9689  j = 10;
9690  while (tempCWD->name[j] == 0x20)
9691  j--;
9692  if (j >= 8)
9693  {
9694  while (j >= 8)
9695  {
9696  *(returnPointer + index++) = tempCWD->name[j--];
9697  // This is a circular buffer
9698  // Any unnecessary values will be overwritten
9699  if (index == totalchars)
9700  {
9701  index = 0;
9702  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9703  }
9704 
9705  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9706  if(twoByteMode)
9707  {
9708  returnPointer[index++] = 0x00;
9709  if (index == totalchars)
9710  {
9711  index = 0;
9712  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9713  }
9714  }
9715  #endif
9716  }
9717 
9718  *(returnPointer + index++) = '.';
9719  if (index == totalchars)
9720  {
9721  index = 0;
9722  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9723  }
9724 
9725  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9726  if(twoByteMode)
9727  {
9728  returnPointer[index++] = 0x00;
9729  if (index == totalchars)
9730  {
9731  index = 0;
9732  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9733  }
9734  }
9735  #endif
9736  }
9737 
9738  while (tempCWD->name[j] == 0x20)
9739  j--;
9740 
9741  while (j >= 0)
9742  {
9743  *(returnPointer + index++) = tempCWD->name[j--];
9744  // This is a circular buffer
9745  // Any unnecessary values will be overwritten
9746  if (index == totalchars)
9747  {
9748  index = 0;
9749  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9750  }
9751 
9752  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9753  if(twoByteMode)
9754  {
9755  returnPointer[index++] = 0x00;
9756  if (index == totalchars)
9757  {
9758  index = 0;
9759  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9760  }
9761  }
9762  #endif
9763  }
9764  }
9765 
9766  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9767  if(twoByteMode)
9768  {
9769  returnPointer[index++] = 0x00;
9770  if (index == totalchars)
9771  {
9772  index = 0;
9773  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9774  }
9775  }
9776  #endif
9777 
9778  // Put a backslash delimiter in front of the dir name
9779  *(returnPointer + index++) = '\\';
9780  if (index == totalchars)
9781  {
9782  index = 0;
9783  bufferOverflow = TRUE;
9784  }
9785 
9786  // Load the previous entry
9787  tempCWD->dirccls = tempCWD->dirclus;
9788  if (GetPreviousEntry (tempCWD))
9789  {
9790  FSerrno = CE_BAD_SECTOR_READ;
9791  return NULL;
9792  }
9793  }
9794  }
9795 
9796  // Point the index back at the last char in the string
9797  index--;
9798 
9799  i = 0;
9800  // Swap the chars in the buffer so they are in the right places
9801  if (bufferOverflow)
9802  {
9803  tempindex = index;
9804  // Swap the overflowed values in the buffer
9805  while ((index - i) > 0)
9806  {
9807  aChar = *(returnPointer + i);
9808  *(returnPointer + i) = * (returnPointer + index);
9809  *(returnPointer + index) = aChar;
9810  index--;
9811  i++;
9812  }
9813 
9814  // Point at the non-overflowed values
9815  i = tempindex + 1;
9816  index = bufferEnd - returnPointer;
9817 
9818  // Swap the non-overflowed values into the right places
9819  while ((index - i) > 0)
9820  {
9821  aChar = *(returnPointer + i);
9822  *(returnPointer + i) = * (returnPointer + index);
9823  *(returnPointer + index) = aChar;
9824  index--;
9825  i++;
9826  }
9827  // All the values should be in the right place now
9828  // Null-terminate the string
9829  *(bufferEnd) = 0;
9830  }
9831  else
9832  {
9833  // There was no overflow, just do one set of swaps
9834  tempindex = index;
9835  while ((index - i) > 0)
9836  {
9837  aChar = *(returnPointer + i);
9838  *(returnPointer + i) = * (returnPointer + index);
9839  *(returnPointer + index) = aChar;
9840  index--;
9841  i++;
9842  }
9843  *(returnPointer + tempindex + 1) = 0;
9844  }
9845 
9846  return returnPointer;
9847 }
9848 
9849 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9850 
9851 /**************************************************************
9852  Function:
9853  char * wFSgetcwd (unsigned short int * path, int numchars)
9854  Summary:
9855  Get the current working directory path in UTF16 format
9856  Conditions:
9857  None
9858  Input:
9859  path - Pointer to the array to return the cwd name in
9860  numchars - Number of chars in the path
9861  Return Values:
9862  char * - The cwd name string pointer (path or defaultArray)
9863  NULL - The current working directory name could not be loaded.
9864  Side Effects:
9865  The FSerrno variable will be changed
9866  Description:
9867  Get the current working directory path in UTF16 format.
9868  The FSgetcwd function will get the name of the current
9869  working directory and return it to the user. The name
9870  will be copied into the buffer pointed to by 'path,'
9871  starting at the root directory and copying as many chars
9872  as possible before the end of the buffer. The buffer
9873  size is indicated by the 'numchars' argument. The first
9874  thing this function will do is load the name of the current
9875  working directory, if it isn't already present. This could
9876  occur if the user switched to the dotdot entry of a
9877  subdirectory immediately before calling this function. The
9878  function will then copy the current working directory name
9879  into the buffer backwards, and insert a backslash character.
9880  Next, the function will continuously switch to the previous
9881  directories and copy their names backwards into the buffer
9882  until it reaches the root. If the buffer overflows, it
9883  will be treated as a circular buffer, and data will be
9884  copied over existing characters, starting at the beginning.
9885  Once the root directory is reached, the text in the buffer
9886  will be swapped, so that the buffer contains as much of the
9887  current working directory name as possible, starting at the
9888  root.
9889  Remarks:
9890  None
9891  **************************************************************/
9892 char * wFSgetcwd (unsigned short int * path, int numchars)
9893 {
9894  char *result;
9895  twoByteMode = TRUE;
9896  result = FSgetcwd ((char *)path,numchars);
9897  twoByteMode = FALSE;
9898  return result;
9899 }
9900 #endif
9901 
9902 /**************************************************************************
9903  Function:
9904  void GetPreviousEntry (FSFILE * fo)
9905  Summary:
9906  Get the file entry info for the parent dir of the specified dir
9907  Conditions:
9908  Should not be called by the user.
9909  Input:
9910  fo - The file to get the previous entry of
9911  Return Values:
9912  0 - The previous entry was successfully retrieved
9913  -1 - The previous entry could not be retrieved
9914  Side Effects:
9915  None
9916  Description:
9917  The GetPreviousEntry function is used by the FSgetcwd function to
9918  load the previous (parent) directory. This function will load the
9919  parent directory and then search through the file entries in that
9920  directory for one that matches the cluster number of the original
9921  directory. When the matching entry is found, the name of the
9922  original directory is copied into the 'fo' FSFILE object.
9923  Remarks:
9924  None.
9925  **************************************************************************/
9926 
9927 BYTE GetPreviousEntry (FSFILE * fo)
9928 {
9929  int i,j;
9930  WORD fHandle = 1;
9931  DWORD dirclus;
9932  DIRENTRY dirptr;
9933 
9934  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
9935  unsigned short int *tempLFN = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
9936  FSFILE cwdTemp;
9937  LFN_ENTRY *lfno;
9938 
9939  WORD prevHandle;
9940  UINT16_VAL tempShift;
9941 
9942  #endif
9943 
9944  // Load the previous entry
9945  dirptr = Cache_File_Entry (fo, &fHandle, TRUE);
9946  if (dirptr == NULL)
9947  return -1;
9948 
9949  // Get the cluster
9950  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(dirptr); // Get complete cluster number.
9951 
9952  if (TempClusterCalc == VALUE_DOTDOT_CLUSTER_VALUE_FOR_ROOT)
9953  {
9954  // The previous directory is the root
9955  fo->name[0] = '\\';
9956  for (i = 0; i < 11; i++)
9957  {
9958  fo->name[i] = 0x20;
9959  }
9960  fo->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9961  fo->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9962  }
9963  else
9964  {
9965  // Get the directory name
9966  // Save the previous cluster value
9967  // Get the cluster
9968 
9969  dirclus = TempClusterCalc;
9970  fo->dirclus = TempClusterCalc;
9971  fo->dirccls = TempClusterCalc;
9972 
9973 
9974  // Load the previous previous cluster
9975  dirptr = Cache_File_Entry (fo, &fHandle, TRUE);
9976  if (dirptr == NULL)
9977  return -1;
9978 
9979  // Get the cluster
9980  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(dirptr); // Get complete cluster number.
9981 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32
9982  // If we're using FAT32 and the previous previous cluster is the root, the
9983  // value in the dotdot entry will be 0, but the actual cluster won't
9984  if (TempClusterCalc == VALUE_DOTDOT_CLUSTER_VALUE_FOR_ROOT)
9985  {
9986  fo->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
9987  }
9988  else
9989 #endif
9990  fo->dirclus = TempClusterCalc;
9991 
9992  fo->dirccls = fo->dirclus;
9993 
9994  fHandle = 0;
9995  dirptr = Cache_File_Entry (fo, &fHandle, TRUE);
9996  if (dirptr == NULL)
9997  return -1;
9998  // Look through it until we get the name
9999  // of the previous cluster
10000  // Get the cluster
10001  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(dirptr); // Get complete cluster number.
10002  while ((TempClusterCalc != dirclus) ||
10003  ((TempClusterCalc == dirclus) &&
10004  (((unsigned char)dirptr->DIR_Name[0] == 0xE5) || (dirptr->DIR_Attr == ATTR_VOLUME) || (dirptr->DIR_Attr == ATTR_LONG_NAME))))
10005  {
10006  // Look through the entries until we get the
10007  // right one
10008  dirptr = Cache_File_Entry (fo, &fHandle, FALSE);
10009  if (dirptr == NULL)
10010  return -1;
10011  fHandle++;
10012 
10013  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(dirptr); // Get complete cluster number in a loop.
10014  }
10015 
10016  // The name should be in the entry now
10017  // Copy the actual directory location back
10018  fo->dirclus = dirclus;
10019  fo->dirccls = dirclus;
10020  }
10021 
10022  i = 0;
10023  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10024  FileObjectCopy (&cwdTemp, fo);
10025  prevHandle = fHandle - 2;
10026 
10027  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (fo, &prevHandle, FALSE);
10028 
10029  // Get the long file name of the short file name(if present)
10030  while((lfno->LFN_Attribute == ATTR_LONG_NAME) && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_DEL)
10031 
10032  && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_EMPTY))
10033 
10034  {
10035 
10036  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[0];
10037 
10038  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[1];
10039 
10040  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
10041 
10042  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[2];
10043 
10044  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[3];
10045 
10046  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
10047 
10048  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[4];
10049 
10050  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[5];
10051 
10052  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
10053 
10054  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[6];
10055 
10056  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[7];
10057 
10058  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
10059 
10060  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[8];
10061 
10062  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[9];
10063 
10064  tempLFN[i++] = tempShift.Val;
10065 
10066 
10067  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[0];
10068 
10069  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[1];
10070 
10071  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[2];
10072 
10073  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[3];
10074 
10075  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[4];
10076 
10077  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[5];
10078 
10079 
10080  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[0];
10081 
10082  tempLFN[i++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[1];
10083 
10084 
10085 
10086  prevHandle = prevHandle - 1;
10087 
10088  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (fo, &prevHandle, FALSE);
10089 
10090  }
10091 
10092 
10093  FileObjectCopy (fo, &cwdTemp);
10094  #endif
10095 
10096  if(i == 0)
10097 
10098  {
10099  for (j = 0; j < 11; j++)
10100  fo->name[j] = dirptr->DIR_Name[j];
10101  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10102  fo->utf16LFNlength = 0;
10103 
10104  #endif
10105  }
10106  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10107  else
10108 
10109  {
10110 
10111  fo->utf16LFNlength = i;
10112 
10113 
10114 
10115  for(j = 12;j >= 0;j--)
10116 
10117  {
10118 
10119  if((tempLFN[i - j - 1]) == 0x0000)
10120 
10121  {
10122 
10123  fo->utf16LFNlength = i - j - 1;
10124 
10125  break;
10126 
10127  }
10128 
10129  }
10130 
10131 
10132  fo->utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
10133 
10134  }
10135 
10136  #endif
10137 
10138  return 0;
10139 }
10140 
10141 
10142 /**************************************************************************
10143  Function:
10144  int FSmkdir (char * path)
10145  Summary:
10146  Creates a directory as per the ascii input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC)
10147  Conditions:
10148  None
10149  Input:
10150  path - The path of directories to create.
10151  Return Values:
10152  0 - The specified directory was created successfully
10153  EOF - The specified directory could not be created
10154  Side Effects:
10155  Will create all non-existent directories in the path. The FSerrno
10156  variable will be changed.
10157  Description:
10158  Creates a directory as per the ascii input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
10159  This function doesn't move the current working directory setting.
10160  Remarks:
10161  None
10162  **************************************************************************/
10163 
10164 #ifdef ALLOW_WRITES
10165 int FSmkdir (char * path)
10166 {
10167  return mkdirhelper (0, path, NULL);
10168 }
10169 
10170 /**************************************************************************
10171  Function:
10172  int wFSmkdir (unsigned short int * path)
10173  Summary:
10174  Creates a directory as per the UTF16 input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC)
10175  Conditions:
10176  None
10177  Input:
10178  path - The path of directories to create.
10179  Return Values:
10180  0 - The specified directory was created successfully
10181  EOF - The specified directory could not be created
10182  Side Effects:
10183  Will create all non-existent directories in the path. The FSerrno
10184  variable will be changed.
10185  Description:
10186  Creates a directory as per the UTF16 input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
10187  This function doesn't move the current working directory setting.
10188  Remarks:
10189  None
10190  **************************************************************************/
10191 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10192 int wFSmkdir (unsigned short int * path)
10193 {
10194  int result;
10195  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
10196  result = mkdirhelper (0, (char *)path, NULL);
10197  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
10198  return result;
10199 }
10200 #endif
10201 
10202 /**************************************************************************
10203  Function:
10204  int FSmkdirpgm (const rom char * path)
10205  Summary:
10206  Creates a directory as per the path mentioned in the input string on
10207  PIC18 devices.
10208  Conditions:
10209  None
10210  Input:
10211  path - The path of directories to create (ROM)
10212  Return Values:
10213  0 - The specified directory was created successfully
10214  EOF - The specified directory could not be created
10215  Side Effects:
10216  Will create all non-existent directories in the path. The FSerrno
10217  variable will be changed.
10218  Description:
10219  Creates a directory as per the path mentioned in the input string on
10220  PIC18 devices.'FSmkdirpgm' creates the directories as per the input
10221  string path.This function doesn't move the current working
10222  directory setting.
10223  Remarks:
10224  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arugments in ROM
10225  **************************************************************************/
10226 
10227 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10228 int FSmkdirpgm (const rom char * path)
10229 {
10230  return mkdirhelper (1, NULL, path);
10231 }
10232 
10233 /**************************************************************************
10234  Function:
10235  int wFSmkdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path)
10236  Summary:
10237  Create a directory with a path in ROM on PIC18
10238  Conditions:
10239  None
10240  Input:
10241  path - The path of directories to create (ROM)
10242  Return Values:
10243  0 - The specified directory was created successfully
10244  EOF - The specified directory could not be created
10245  Side Effects:
10246  Will create all non-existent directories in the path. The FSerrno
10247  variable will be changed.
10248  Description:
10249  The FSmkdirpgm function passes a PIC18 ROM path pointer to the
10250  mkdirhelper function.
10251  Remarks:
10252  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arugments in ROM
10253  **************************************************************************/
10254 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10255 int wFSmkdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path)
10256 {
10257  int result;
10258  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
10259  result = mkdirhelper (1, NULL, (const char *)path);
10260  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
10261  return result;
10262 }
10263 #endif
10264 
10265 #endif
10266 
10267 /*************************************************************************
10268  Function:
10269  // PIC24/30/33/32
10270  int mkdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr)
10271  // PIC18
10272  int mkdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr)
10273  Summary:
10274  Helper function for FSmkdir
10275  Conditions:
10276  None
10277  Input:
10278  mode - Indicates which path pointer to use
10279  ramptr - Pointer to the path specified in RAM
10280  romptr - Pointer to the path specified in ROM
10281  Return Values:
10282  0 - Directory was created
10283  -1 - Directory could not be created
10284  Side Effects:
10285  Will create all non-existant directories in the path.
10286  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
10287  Description:
10288  This helper function is used by the FSchdir function. If the path
10289  argument is specified in ROM for PIC18 this function will be able
10290  to parse it correctly. This function will first scan through the path
10291  to ensure that any DIR names don't exceed 11 characters. It will then
10292  backup the current working directory and begin changing directories
10293  through the path until it reaches a directory than can't be changed to.
10294  It will then create the specified directory and change directories to
10295  the new directory. The function will continue creating and changing to
10296  directories until the end of the path is reached. The function will
10297  then restore the original current working directory.
10298  Remarks:
10299  None
10300  **************************************************************************/
10301 
10302 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10303 int mkdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr)
10304 #else
10305 int mkdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr)
10306 #endif
10307 {
10308  unsigned short int i,j = 0,k = 0;
10309  char * temppath = ramptr;
10310 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10311  rom char * temppath2 = romptr;
10312  rom unsigned short int * utf16path2 = (rom unsigned short int *)romptr;
10313 #endif
10314  unsigned short int *utf16path = (unsigned short int *)ramptr;
10315  FILEOBJ tempCWD = &tempCWDobj;
10316 
10317 #ifdef __18CXX
10318  char dotdotPath[] = "..";
10319  char dotdotPath1[5] = {'.','\0','.','\0','\0'};
10320 #endif
10321 
10322 // Do Dynamic allocation if the macro is defined or
10323 // go with static allocation
10324 #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10325  char tempArray[514];
10326 #else
10327  char tempArray[14];
10328 #endif
10329 
10330  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
10331 
10332  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
10333  {
10334  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_PROTECTED;
10335  return (-1);
10336  }
10337 
10338 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10339  if (mode == 1)
10340  {
10341  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10342  if(utfModeFileName)
10343  {
10344  // Scan for too-long file names
10345  while (1)
10346  {
10347  i = 0;
10348  while((*utf16path2 != 0) && (*utf16path2 != '.')&& (*utf16path2 != '\\'))
10349  {
10350  utf16path2++;
10351  i++;
10352  }
10353 
10354  if (i > 256)
10355  {
10356  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10357  return -1;
10358  }
10359 
10360  j = 0;
10361  if (*utf16path2 == '.')
10362  {
10363  utf16path2++;
10364  while ((*utf16path2 != 0) && (*utf16path2 != '\\'))
10365  {
10366  utf16path2++;
10367  j++;
10368  }
10369  if ((i + j) > 256)
10370  {
10371  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10372  return -1;
10373  }
10374  }
10375 
10376  if((i + j) > k)
10377  {
10378  k = (i + j);
10379  }
10380 
10381  while (*utf16path2 == '\\')
10382  utf16path2++;
10383  if (*utf16path2 == 0)
10384  break;
10385  }
10386  }
10387  else
10388  #endif
10389  {
10390  // Scan for too-long file names
10391  while (1)
10392  {
10393  i = 0;
10394  while((*temppath2 != 0) && (*temppath2 != '.')&& (*temppath2 != '\\'))
10395  {
10396  temppath2++;
10397  i++;
10398  }
10399 
10400  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10401  if (i > 256)
10402  {
10403  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10404  return -1;
10405  }
10406  #else
10407  if (i > 8)
10408  {
10409  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10410  return -1;
10411  }
10412  #endif
10413 
10414  j = 0;
10415  if (*temppath2 == '.')
10416  {
10417  temppath2++;
10418  while ((*temppath2 != 0) && (*temppath2 != '\\'))
10419  {
10420  temppath2++;
10421  j++;
10422  }
10423  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10424  if ((i + j) > 256)
10425  {
10426  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10427  return -1;
10428  }
10429  #else
10430  if (j > 3)
10431  {
10432  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10433  return -1;
10434  }
10435  #endif
10436  }
10437 
10438  if((i + j) > k)
10439  {
10440  k = (i + j);
10441  }
10442 
10443  while (*temppath2 == '\\')
10444  temppath2++;
10445  if (*temppath2 == 0)
10446  break;
10447  }
10448  }
10449  }
10450  else
10451 #endif
10452  {
10453  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10454  if(utfModeFileName)
10455  {
10456  utf16path = (unsigned short int *)ramptr;
10457  // Scan for too-long file names
10458  while (1)
10459  {
10460  i = 0;
10461  while((*utf16path != 0) && (*utf16path != '.')&& (*utf16path != '\\'))
10462  {
10463  utf16path++;
10464  i++;
10465  }
10466  if (i > 256)
10467  {
10468  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10469  return -1;
10470  }
10471 
10472  j = 0;
10473  if (*utf16path == '.')
10474  {
10475  utf16path++;
10476  while ((*utf16path != 0) && (*utf16path != '\\'))
10477  {
10478  utf16path++;
10479  j++;
10480  }
10481  if ((i + j) > 256)
10482  {
10483  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10484  return -1;
10485  }
10486  }
10487 
10488  if((i + j) > k)
10489  {
10490  k = (i + j);
10491  }
10492 
10493  while (*utf16path == '\\')
10494  utf16path++;
10495  if (*utf16path == 0)
10496  break;
10497  }
10498  }
10499  else
10500  #endif
10501  {
10502  // Scan for too-long file names
10503  while (1)
10504  {
10505  i = 0;
10506  while((*temppath != 0) && (*temppath != '.')&& (*temppath != '\\'))
10507  {
10508  temppath++;
10509  i++;
10510  }
10511  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10512  if (i > 256)
10513  {
10514  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10515  return -1;
10516  }
10517  #else
10518  if (i > 8)
10519  {
10520  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10521  return -1;
10522  }
10523  #endif
10524 
10525  j = 0;
10526  if (*temppath == '.')
10527  {
10528  temppath++;
10529  while ((*temppath != 0) && (*temppath != '\\'))
10530  {
10531  temppath++;
10532  j++;
10533  }
10534  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10535  if ((i + j) > 256)
10536  {
10537  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10538  return -1;
10539  }
10540  #else
10541  if (j > 3)
10542  {
10543  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10544  return -1;
10545  }
10546  #endif
10547  }
10548 
10549  if((i + j) > k)
10550  {
10551  k = (i + j);
10552  }
10553 
10554  while (*temppath == '\\')
10555  temppath++;
10556  if (*temppath == 0)
10557  break;
10558  }
10559  }
10560  }
10561 
10562  utf16path = (unsigned short int *)ramptr;
10563  temppath = ramptr;
10564 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10565  utf16path2 = (rom unsigned short int *)romptr;
10566  temppath2 = romptr;
10567 #endif
10568 
10569  // We're going to be moving the CWD
10570  // Back up the CWD
10571  FileObjectCopy (tempCWD, cwdptr);
10572 
10573  // get to the target directory
10574  while (1)
10575  {
10576 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10577  if (mode == 1)
10578  {
10579  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10580  if(utfModeFileName)
10581  i = *utf16path2;
10582  else
10583  #endif
10584  i = *temppath2;
10585  }
10586  else
10587 #endif
10588  {
10589  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10590  if(utfModeFileName)
10591  i = *utf16path;
10592  else
10593  #endif
10594  i = *temppath;
10595  }
10596 
10597  if (i == '.')
10598  {
10599 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10600  if (mode == 1)
10601  {
10602  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10603  if(utfModeFileName)
10604  {
10605  utf16path2++;
10606  i = *utf16path2;
10607  }
10608  else
10609  #endif
10610  {
10611  temppath2++;
10612  i = *temppath2;
10613  }
10614  }
10615  else
10616  {
10617 #endif
10618  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10619  if(utfModeFileName)
10620  {
10621  utf16path++;
10622  i = *utf16path;
10623  }
10624  else
10625  #endif
10626  {
10627  temppath++;
10628  i = *temppath;
10629  }
10630 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10631  }
10632 #endif
10633 
10634  if ((i != '.') && (i != 0) && (i != '\\'))
10635  {
10636  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10637  return -1;
10638  }
10639 
10640  if (i == '.')
10641  {
10642  if (cwdptr->dirclus == FatRootDirClusterValue)
10643  {
10644  // If we try to change to the .. from the
10645  // root, operation fails
10646  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10647  return -1;
10648  }
10649 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10650  if (mode == 1)
10651  {
10652  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10653  if(utfModeFileName)
10654  {
10655  utf16path2++;
10656  i = *utf16path2;
10657  }
10658  else
10659  #endif
10660  {
10661  temppath2++;
10662  i = *temppath2;
10663  }
10664  }
10665  else
10666 #endif
10667  {
10668  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10669  if(utfModeFileName)
10670  {
10671  utf16path++;
10672  i = *utf16path;
10673  }
10674  else
10675  #endif
10676  {
10677  temppath++;
10678  i = *temppath;
10679  }
10680  }
10681 
10682  if ((i != '\\') && (i != 0))
10683  {
10684  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10685  return -1;
10686  }
10687 // dotdot entry
10688 #ifndef __18CXX
10689  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10690  if(utfModeFileName)
10691  FSchdir (".\0.\0\0");
10692  #endif
10693  else
10694  FSchdir ("..");
10695 #else
10696  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10697  if(utfModeFileName)
10698  FSchdir (dotdotPath1);
10699  else
10700  #endif
10701  FSchdir (dotdotPath);
10702 #endif
10703  }
10704  // Skip past any backslashes
10705  while (i == '\\')
10706  {
10707 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10708  if (mode == 1)
10709  {
10710  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10711  if(utfModeFileName)
10712  {
10713  utf16path2++;
10714  i = *utf16path2;
10715  }
10716  else
10717  #endif
10718  {
10719  temppath2++;
10720  i = *temppath2;
10721  }
10722  }
10723  else
10724  {
10725 #endif
10726  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10727  if(utfModeFileName)
10728  {
10729  utf16path++;
10730  i = *utf16path;
10731  }
10732  else
10733  #endif
10734  {
10735  temppath++;
10736  i = *temppath;
10737  }
10738 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10739  }
10740 #endif
10741  }
10742  if (i == 0)
10743  {
10744  // No point in creating a dot or dotdot entry directly
10745  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10746  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10747  return -1;
10748  }
10749  }
10750  else
10751  {
10752  if (i == '\\')
10753  {
10754  // Start at the root
10755  cwdptr->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
10756  cwdptr->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
10757  i = 0;
10758  cwdptr->name[i++] = '\\';
10759 // if(utfModeFileName)
10760 // {
10761 // cwdptr->name[i++] = 0x00;
10762 // }
10763  for (; i < 11; i++)
10764  {
10765  cwdptr->name[i] = 0x20;
10766  }
10767 
10768 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10769  if (mode == 1)
10770  {
10771  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10772  if(utfModeFileName)
10773  {
10774  utf16path2++;
10775  i = *utf16path2;
10776  }
10777  else
10778  #endif
10779  {
10780  temppath2++;
10781  i = *temppath2;
10782  }
10783  }
10784  else
10785  {
10786 #endif
10787  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10788  if(utfModeFileName)
10789  {
10790  utf16path++;
10791  i = *utf16path;
10792  }
10793  else
10794  #endif
10795  {
10796  temppath++;
10797  i = *temppath;
10798  }
10799 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10800  }
10801 #endif
10802  // If we just got two backslashes in a row at the
10803  // beginning of the path, the function fails
10804  if ((i == '\\') || (i == 0))
10805  {
10806  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10807  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10808  return -1;
10809  }
10810  }
10811  else
10812  {
10813  break;
10814  }
10815  }
10816  }
10817 
10818  while (1)
10819  {
10820  while(1)
10821  {
10822 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10823  if (mode == 1)
10824  {
10825  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10826  if(utfModeFileName)
10827  {
10828  // Change directories as specified
10829  i = *utf16path2;
10830  j = 0;
10831 
10832  k = 512;
10833 
10834  // Parse the next token
10835  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
10836  {
10837  tempArray[j++] = i;
10838  tempArray[j++] = i >> 8;
10839  utf16path2++;
10840  i = *utf16path2;
10841  }
10842  }
10843  else
10844  #endif
10845  {
10846  // Change directories as specified
10847  i = *temppath2;
10848  j = 0;
10849 
10850  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10851  k = 256;
10852  #else
10853  k = 12;
10854  #endif
10855 
10856  // Parse the next token
10857  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
10858  {
10859  tempArray[j++] = i;
10860  temppath2++;
10861  i = *temppath2;
10862  }
10863  }
10864  }
10865  else
10866  {
10867 #endif
10868  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10869  if(utfModeFileName)
10870  {
10871  // Change directories as specified
10872  i = *utf16path;
10873  j = 0;
10874 
10875  k = 512;
10876 
10877  // Parse the next token
10878  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
10879  {
10880  tempArray[j++] = i;
10881  tempArray[j++] = i >> 8;
10882  utf16path++;
10883  i = *utf16path;
10884  }
10885  }
10886  else
10887  #endif
10888  {
10889  // Change directories as specified
10890  i = *temppath;
10891  j = 0;
10892 
10893  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
10894  k = 256;
10895  #else
10896  k = 12;
10897  #endif
10898 
10899  // Parse the next token
10900  while ((i != 0) && (i != '\\') && (j < k))
10901  {
10902  tempArray[j++] = i;
10903  temppath++;
10904  i = *temppath;
10905  }
10906  }
10907 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10908  }
10909 #endif
10910  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10911  if(utfModeFileName)
10912  {
10913  tempArray[j++] = 0;
10914  tempArray[j] = 0;
10915 
10916  if ((tempArray[0] == '.') && (tempArray[1] == 0))
10917  {
10918  if (((tempArray[2] != 0) || (tempArray[3] != 0)) && ((tempArray[2] != '.') || (tempArray[3] != 0)))
10919  {
10920  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10921  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10922  return -1;
10923  }
10924  if (((tempArray[2] == '.') && (tempArray[3] == 0)) && ((tempArray[4] != 0) || (tempArray[5] != 0)))
10925  {
10926  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10927  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10928  return -1;
10929  }
10930  }
10931  }
10932  else
10933  #endif
10934  {
10935  tempArray[j] = 0;
10936 
10937  if (tempArray[0] == '.')
10938  {
10939  if ((tempArray[1] != 0) && (tempArray[1] != '.'))
10940  {
10941  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10942  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10943  return -1;
10944  }
10945  if ((tempArray[1] == '.') && (tempArray[2] != 0))
10946  {
10947  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
10948  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
10949  return -1;
10950  }
10951  }
10952  }
10953 
10954  // Try to change to it
10955  // If you can't we need to create it
10956  if (FSchdir (tempArray))
10957  break;
10958  else
10959  {
10960  // We changed into the directory
10961  while (i == '\\')
10962  {
10963  // Next char is a backslash
10964  // Move past it
10965 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10966  if (mode == 1)
10967  {
10968  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10969  if(utfModeFileName)
10970  {
10971  utf16path2++;
10972  i = *utf16path2;
10973  }
10974  else
10975  #endif
10976  {
10977  temppath2++;
10978  i = *temppath2;
10979  }
10980  }
10981  else
10982  {
10983 #endif
10984  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
10985  if(utfModeFileName)
10986  {
10987  utf16path++;
10988  i = *utf16path;
10989  }
10990  else
10991  #endif
10992  {
10993  temppath++;
10994  i = *temppath;
10995  }
10996 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
10997  }
10998 #endif
10999  }
11000  // If it's the last one, return success
11001  if (i == 0)
11002  {
11003  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11004  return 0;
11005  }
11006  }
11007  }
11008 
11009  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11010  if(utfModeFileName)
11011  {
11012  unsigned short int *tempPtr1;
11013  unsigned short int *tempPtr2;
11014  k = 0;
11015  tempPtr1 = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
11016  tempPtr2 = (unsigned short int *)&tempDirectoryString[0];
11017 
11018  for(;;)
11019  {
11020  tempPtr2[k] = tempPtr1[k];
11021  if(tempPtr2[k])
11022  k++;
11023  else
11024  break;
11025  }
11026  }
11027  else
11028  #endif
11029  {
11030  strcpy(&tempDirectoryString[0],&tempArray[0]);
11031  }
11032 
11033  // Create a dir here
11034  if (!CreateDIR (tempDirectoryString))
11035  {
11036  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11037  return -1;
11038  }
11039 
11040  // Try to change to that directory
11041  if (FSchdir (tempArray))
11042  {
11043  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11044  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11045  return -1;
11046  }
11047 
11048 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11049  if (mode == 1)
11050  {
11051  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11052  if(utfModeFileName)
11053  {
11054  while (*utf16path2 == '\\')
11055  {
11056  utf16path2++;
11057  i = *utf16path2;
11058  }
11059  }
11060  else
11061  #endif
11062  {
11063  // Check for another backslash
11064  while (*temppath2 == '\\')
11065  {
11066  temppath2++;
11067  i = *temppath2;
11068  }
11069  }
11070  }
11071  else
11072  {
11073 #endif
11074  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11075  if(utfModeFileName)
11076  {
11077  while (*utf16path == '\\')
11078  {
11079  utf16path++;
11080  i = *utf16path;
11081  }
11082  }
11083  else
11084  #endif
11085  {
11086  while (*temppath == '\\')
11087  {
11088  temppath++;
11089  i = *temppath;
11090  }
11091  }
11092 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11093  }
11094 #endif
11095 
11096  // Check to see if we're at the end of the path string
11097  if (i == 0)
11098  {
11099  // We already have one
11100  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11101  return 0;
11102  }
11103  }
11104 }
11105 
11106 
11107 /**************************************************************************
11108  Function:
11109  int CreateDIR (char * path)
11110  Summary:
11111  FSmkdir helper function to create a directory
11112  Conditions:
11113  This function should not be called by the user.
11114  Input:
11115  path - The name of the dir to create
11116  Return Values:
11117  TRUE - Directory was created successfully
11118  FALSE - Directory could not be created.
11119  Side Effects:
11120  Any unwritten data in the data buffer or the FAT buffer will be written
11121  to the device.
11122  Description:
11123  The CreateDIR function is a helper function for the mkdirhelper
11124  function. The CreateDIR function will create a new file entry for
11125  a directory and assign a cluster to it. It will erase the cluster
11126  and write a dot and dotdot entry to it.
11127  Remarks:
11128  None.
11129  **************************************************************************/
11130 
11131 int CreateDIR (char * path)
11132 {
11133  FSFILE * dirEntryPtr = &gFileTemp;
11134  DIRENTRY dir;
11135  WORD handle = 0;
11136  DWORD dot, dotdot;
11137 
11138  if (FormatDirName(path, dirEntryPtr,0) == FALSE)
11139  {
11140  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
11141  return FALSE;
11142  }
11143 
11144  dirEntryPtr->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
11145  dirEntryPtr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
11146  dirEntryPtr->cluster = 0;
11147  dirEntryPtr->ccls = 0;
11148  dirEntryPtr->dsk = cwdptr->dsk;
11149 
11150  // Create a directory entry
11151  if(CreateFileEntry(dirEntryPtr, &handle, DIRECTORY, TRUE) != CE_GOOD)
11152  {
11153  return FALSE;
11154  }
11155  else
11156  {
11157  if (gNeedFATWrite)
11158  if(WriteFAT (dirEntryPtr->dsk, 0, 0, TRUE))
11159  {
11160  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
11161  return FALSE;
11162  }
11163  // Zero that cluster
11164  if (dirEntryPtr->dirclus == FatRootDirClusterValue)
11165  dotdot = 0;
11166  else
11167  dotdot = dirEntryPtr->dirclus;
11168  dirEntryPtr->dirccls = dirEntryPtr->dirclus;
11169  dir = Cache_File_Entry(dirEntryPtr, &handle, TRUE);
11170  if (dir == NULL)
11171  {
11172  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11173  return FALSE;
11174  }
11175 
11176  // Get the cluster
11177  dot = GetFullClusterNumber(dir); // Get complete cluster number.
11178 
11179  if (writeDotEntries (dirEntryPtr->dsk, dot, dotdot))
11180  return TRUE;
11181  else
11182  return FALSE;
11183 
11184  }
11185 }
11186 
11187 
11188 /***********************************************************************************
11189  Function:
11190  BYTE writeDotEntries (DISK * disk, DWORD dotAddress, DWORD dotdotAddress)
11191  Summary:
11192  Create dot and dotdot entries in a non-root directory
11193  Conditions:
11194  This function should not be called by the user.
11195  Input:
11196  disk - The global disk structure
11197  dotAddress - The cluster the current dir is in
11198  dotdotAddress - The cluster the previous directory was in
11199  Return Values:
11200  TRUE - The dot and dotdot entries were created
11201  FALSE - The dot and dotdot entries could not be created in the new directory
11202  Side Effects:
11203  None
11204  Description:
11205  The writeDotEntries function will create and write dot and dotdot entries
11206  to a newly created directory.
11207  Remarks:
11208  None.
11209  ***********************************************************************************/
11210 
11211 BYTE writeDotEntries (DISK * disk, DWORD dotAddress, DWORD dotdotAddress)
11212 {
11213  WORD i;
11214  WORD size;
11215  volatile _DIRENTRY entry;
11216  DIRENTRY entryptr = (DIRENTRY)&entry;
11217  DWORD sector;
11218 
11219  gBufferOwner = NULL;
11220 
11221  size = sizeof (_DIRENTRY);
11222 
11223  memset(disk->buffer, 0x00, disk->sectorSize);
11224 
11225  entry.DIR_Name[0] = '.';
11226 
11227  for (i = 1; i < 8; i++)
11228  {
11229  entry.DIR_Name[i] = 0x20;
11230  }
11231  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
11232  {
11233  entry.DIR_Extension[i] = 0x20;
11234  }
11235 
11236  entry.DIR_Attr = ATTR_DIRECTORY;
11237  entry.DIR_NTRes = 0x00;
11238 
11239  entry.DIR_FstClusLO = (WORD)(dotAddress & 0x0000FFFF); // Lower 16 bit address
11240 
11241 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
11242  entry.DIR_FstClusHI = (WORD)((dotAddress & 0x0FFF0000)>> 16); // Higher 16 bit address. FAT32 uses only 28 bits. Mask even higher nibble also.
11243 #else // If FAT32 support not enabled
11244  entry.DIR_FstClusHI = 0;
11245 #endif
11246 
11247  entry.DIR_FileSize = 0x00;
11248 
11249 // Times need to be the same as the times in the directory entry
11250 
11251 // Set dir date for uncontrolled clock source
11252 #ifdef INCREMENTTIMESTAMP
11253  entry.DIR_CrtTimeTenth = 0xB2;
11254  entry.DIR_CrtTime = 0x7278;
11255  entry.DIR_CrtDate = 0x32B0;
11256  entry.DIR_LstAccDate = 0x0000;
11257  entry.DIR_WrtTime = 0x0000;
11258  entry.DIR_WrtDate = 0x0000;
11259 #endif
11260 
11261 #ifdef USEREALTIMECLOCK
11262  entry.DIR_CrtTimeTenth = gTimeCrtMS; // millisecond stamp
11263  entry.DIR_CrtTime = gTimeCrtTime; // time created //
11264  entry.DIR_CrtDate = gTimeCrtDate; // date created (1/1/2004)
11265  entry.DIR_LstAccDate = 0x0000; // Last Access date
11266  entry.DIR_WrtTime = 0x0000; // last update time
11267  entry.DIR_WrtDate = 0x0000; // last update date
11268 #endif
11269 
11270 #ifdef USERDEFINEDCLOCK
11271  entry.DIR_CrtTimeTenth = gTimeCrtMS; // millisecond stamp
11272  entry.DIR_CrtTime = gTimeCrtTime; // time created //
11273  entry.DIR_CrtDate = gTimeCrtDate; // date created (1/1/2004)
11274  entry.DIR_LstAccDate = 0x0000; // Last Access date
11275  entry.DIR_WrtTime = 0x0000; // last update time
11276  entry.DIR_WrtDate = 0x0000; // last update date
11277 #endif
11278 
11279  for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
11280  {
11281  *(disk->buffer + i) = *((char *)entryptr + i);
11282  }
11283  entry.DIR_Name[1] = '.';
11284
