11285  entry.DIR_FstClusLO = (WORD)(dotdotAddress & 0x0000FFFF); // Lower 16 bit address
11286 
11287 #ifdef SUPPORT_FAT32 // If FAT32 supported.
11288  entry.DIR_FstClusHI = (WORD)((dotdotAddress & 0x0FFF0000)>> 16); // Higher 16 bit address. FAT32 uses only 28 bits. Mask even higher nibble also.
11289 #else // If FAT32 support not enabled
11290  entry.DIR_FstClusHI = 0;
11291 #endif
11292 
11293 
11294  for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
11295  {
11296  *(disk->buffer + i + size) = *((char *)entryptr + i);
11297  }
11298 
11299  sector = Cluster2Sector (disk, dotAddress);
11300 
11301  if (MDD_SectorWrite(sector, disk->buffer, FALSE) == FALSE)
11302  {
11303  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
11304  return FALSE;
11305  }
11306 
11307  return TRUE;
11308 }
11309 
11310 // This array is used to prevent a stack frame error
11311 #ifdef __18CXX
11312  char tempArray[13] = " ";
11313 #endif
11314 
11315 
11316 /**************************************************************************
11317  Function:
11318  int FSrmdir (char * path)
11319  Summary:
11320  Deletes the directory as per the ascii input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
11321  Conditions:
11322  None
11323  Input:
11324  path - The path of the directory to remove
11325  rmsubdirs -
11326  - TRUE - All sub-dirs and files in the target dir will be removed
11327  - FALSE - FSrmdir will not remove non-empty directories
11328  Return Values:
11329  0 - The specified directory was deleted successfully
11330  EOF - The specified directory could not be deleted
11331  Side Effects:
11332  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
11333  Description:
11334  Deletes the directory as per the ascii input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
11335  This function wont delete the current working directory.
11336  Remarks:
11337  None.
11338  **************************************************************************/
11339 
11340 int FSrmdir (char * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11341 {
11342  return rmdirhelper (0, path, NULL, rmsubdirs);
11343 }
11344 
11345 
11346 /**************************************************************************
11347  Function:
11348  int wFSrmdir (unsigned short int * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11349  Summary:
11350  Deletes the directory as per the UTF16 input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
11351  Conditions:
11352  None
11353  Input:
11354  path - The path of the directory to remove
11355  rmsubdirs -
11356  - TRUE - All sub-dirs and files in the target dir will be removed
11357  - FALSE - FSrmdir will not remove non-empty directories
11358  Return Values:
11359  0 - The specified directory was deleted successfully
11360  EOF - The specified directory could not be deleted
11361  Side Effects:
11362  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
11363  Description:
11364  Deletes the directory as per the UTF16 input path (PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC).
11365  This function wont delete the current working directory.
11366  Remarks:
11367  None.
11368  **************************************************************************/
11369 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11370 int wFSrmdir (unsigned short int * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11371 {
11372  int result;
11373  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
11374  result = rmdirhelper (0, (char *)path, NULL, rmsubdirs);
11375  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
11376  return result;
11377 }
11378 #endif
11379 
11380 /**************************************************************************
11381  Function:
11382  int FSrmdirpgm (const rom char * path)
11383  Summary:
11384  Deletes the directory as per the ascii input path (PIC18).
11385  Conditions:
11386  None.
11387  Input:
11388  path - The path of the directory to remove (ROM)
11389  rmsubdirs -
11390  - TRUE - All sub-dirs and files in the target dir will be removed
11391  - FALSE - FSrmdir will not remove non-empty directories
11392  Return Values:
11393  0 - The specified directory was deleted successfully
11394  EOF - The specified directory could not be deleted
11395  Side Effects:
11396  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
11397  Description:
11398  Deletes the directory as per the ascii input path (PIC18).
11399  This function deletes the directory as specified in the path.
11400  This function wont delete the current working directory.
11401  Remarks:
11402  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
11403  **************************************************************************/
11404 
11405 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11406 int FSrmdirpgm (const rom char * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11407 {
11408  return rmdirhelper (1, NULL, path, rmsubdirs);
11409 }
11410 #endif
11411 
11412 /**************************************************************************
11413  Function:
11414  int wFSrmdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11415  Summary:
11416  Delete a directory with a path in ROM on PIC18
11417  Conditions:
11418  None.
11419  Input:
11420  path - The path of the directory to remove (ROM)
11421  rmsubdirs -
11422  - TRUE - All sub-dirs and files in the target dir will be removed
11423  - FALSE - FSrmdir will not remove non-empty directories
11424  Return Values:
11425  0 - The specified directory was deleted successfully
11426  EOF - The specified directory could not be deleted
11427  Side Effects:
11428  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
11429  Description:
11430  The FSrmdirpgm function passes a PIC18 ROM path pointer to the
11431  rmdirhelper function.
11432  Remarks:
11433  This function is for use with PIC18 when passing arguments in ROM.
11434  **************************************************************************/
11435 
11436 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11437 
11438 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11439 int wFSrmdirpgm (const rom unsigned short int * path, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11440 {
11441  int result;
11442  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
11443  result = rmdirhelper (1, NULL, (const char *)path, rmsubdirs);
11444  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
11445  return result;
11446 }
11447 #endif
11448 
11449 #endif
11450 
11451 /************************************************************************************************
11452  Function:
11453  // PIC24/30/33/32
11454  int rmdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11455  // PIC18
11456  int rmdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11457  Summary:
11458  Helper function for FSrmdir
11459  Conditions:
11460  This function should not be called by the user.
11461  Input:
11462  path - The path of the dir to delete
11463  rmsubdirs -
11464  - TRUE - Remove all sub-directories and files in the directory
11465  - FALSE - Non-empty directories can not be removed
11466  Return Values:
11467  0 - The specified directory was successfully removed.
11468  EOF - The specified directory could not be removed.
11469  Side Effects:
11470  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
11471  Description:
11472  This helper function is used by the FSmkdir function. If the path
11473  argument is specified in ROM for PIC18 this function will be able
11474  to parse it correctly. This function will first change to the
11475  specified directory. If the rmsubdirs argument is FALSE the function
11476  will search through the directory to ensure that it is empty and then
11477  remove it. If the rmsubdirs argument is TRUE the function will also
11478  search through the directory for subdirectories or files. When the
11479  function finds a file, the file will be erased. When the function
11480  finds a subdirectory, it will switch to the subdirectory and begin
11481  removing all of the files in that subdirectory. Once the subdirectory
11482  is empty, the function will switch back to the original directory.
11483  return to the original position in that directory, and continue removing
11484  files. Once the specified directory is empty, the function will
11485  change to the parent directory, search through it for the directory
11486  to remove, and then erase that directory.
11487  Remarks:
11488  None.
11489  ************************************************************************************************/
11490 
11491 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11492 int rmdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, const rom char * romptr, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11493 #else
11494 int rmdirhelper (BYTE mode, char * ramptr, char * romptr, unsigned char rmsubdirs)
11495 #endif
11496 {
11497  FILEOBJ tempCWD = &tempCWDobj;
11498  FILEOBJ fo = &gFileTemp;
11499  DIRENTRY entry;
11500  WORD handle = 0;
11501  WORD handle2;
11502  WORD subDirDepth;
11503  short int Index3 = 0;
11504  char Index, Index2;
11505 
11506  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11507 
11508  BOOL prevUtfModeFileName = utfModeFileName;
11509  char tempArray[514];
11510  WORD prevHandle;
11511  LFN_ENTRY *lfno;
11512  FSFILE cwdTemp;
11513  UINT16_VAL tempShift;
11514  unsigned short int *tempLFN = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
11515  BOOL forFirstTime;
11516  #else
11517 
11518  char tempArray[13];
11519 
11520  #endif
11521 
11522 #ifndef __18CXX
11523 
11524 #else
11525  char dotdotname[] = "..";
11526  char dotdotname1[5] = {'.','\0','.','\0','\0'};
11527 #endif
11528 
11529  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
11530 
11531  // Back up the current working directory
11532  FileObjectCopy (tempCWD, cwdptr);
11533 
11534 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11535  if (mode)
11536  {
11537  if (chdirhelper (1, NULL, romptr))
11538  {
11539  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
11540  return -1;
11541  }
11542  }
11543  else
11544  {
11545 #endif
11546  if (FSchdir (ramptr))
11547  {
11548  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
11549  return -1;
11550  }
11551 #ifdef ALLOW_PGMFUNCTIONS
11552  }
11553 #endif
11554 
11555  // Make sure we aren't trying to remove the root dir or the CWD
11556  if ((cwdptr->dirclus == FatRootDirClusterValue) || (cwdptr->dirclus == tempCWD->dirclus))
11557  {
11558  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11559  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
11560  return -1;
11561  }
11562 
11563  handle++;
11564  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, TRUE);
11565 
11566  if (entry == NULL)
11567  {
11568  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11569  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11570  return -1;
11571  }
11572 
11573  handle++;
11574  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, FALSE);
11575  if (entry == NULL)
11576  {
11577  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11578  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11579  return -1;
11580  }
11581  // Don't remove subdirectories and sub-files
11582  if (!rmsubdirs)
11583  {
11584  while (entry->DIR_Name[0] != 0)
11585  {
11586  if ((unsigned char)entry->DIR_Name[0] != 0xE5)
11587  {
11588  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11589  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY;
11590  return -1;
11591  }
11592  handle++;
11593  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, FALSE);
11594  if ((entry == NULL))
11595  {
11596  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11597  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11598  return -1;
11599  }
11600  }
11601  }
11602  else
11603  {
11604  // Do remove subdirectories and sub-files
11605  dirCleared = FALSE;
11606  subDirDepth = 0;
11607  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11608  tempCWD-> utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
11609  fo-> utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
11610  #endif
11611 
11612  while (!dirCleared)
11613  {
11614  if (entry->DIR_Name[0] != 0)
11615  {
11616  if (((unsigned char)entry->DIR_Name[0] != 0xE5) && (entry->DIR_Attr == ATTR_LONG_NAME))
11617  {
11618  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11619  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)entry;
11620 
11621  if(lfno->LFN_SequenceNo & 0x40)
11622  {
11623  Index3 = (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo - 0x41) * 13;
11624  tempLFN[Index3 + 13] = 0x0000;
11625  forFirstTime = TRUE;
11626  }
11627  else
11628  {
11629  Index3 = (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo - 1) * 13;
11630  forFirstTime = FALSE;
11631  }
11632 
11633  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[0];
11634  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[1];
11635  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11636  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[2];
11637  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[3];
11638  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11639  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[4];
11640  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[5];
11641  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11642  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[6];
11643  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[7];
11644  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11645  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[8];
11646  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[9];
11647  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11648 
11649  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[0];
11650  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[1];
11651  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[2];
11652  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[3];
11653  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[4];
11654  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[5];
11655 
11656  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[0];
11657  tempLFN[Index3] = lfno->LFN_Part3[1];
11658 
11659  if(forFirstTime)
11660  {
11661  tempCWD->utf16LFNlength = Index3;
11662 
11663  for(Index = 12;Index >= 0;Index--)
11664  {
11665  if((tempLFN[Index3 - Index - 1]) == 0x0000)
11666  {
11667  tempCWD->utf16LFNlength = Index3 - Index - 1;
11668  break;
11669  }
11670  }
11671 
11672  fo->utf16LFNlength = tempCWD->utf16LFNlength;
11673  }
11674  handle++;
11675  #endif
11676  }
11677  else if (((unsigned char)entry->DIR_Name[0] != 0xE5) && (entry->DIR_Attr != ATTR_VOLUME) && (entry->DIR_Attr != ATTR_LONG_NAME))
11678  {
11679  if ((entry->DIR_Attr & ATTR_DIRECTORY) == ATTR_DIRECTORY)
11680  {
11681  // We have a directory
11682  subDirDepth++;
11683  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11684  if(tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength)
11685  {
11686  utfModeFileName = 1;
11687  Index = FSchdir(&tempArray[0]);
11688  utfModeFileName = prevUtfModeFileName;
11689  tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11690  fo-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11691  }
11692  else
11693  #endif
11694  {
11695  for (Index = 0; (Index < DIR_NAMESIZE) && (entry->DIR_Name[(BYTE)Index] != 0x20); Index++)
11696  {
11697  tempArray[(BYTE)Index] = entry->DIR_Name[(BYTE)Index];
11698  }
11699  if (entry->DIR_Extension[0] != 0x20)
11700  {
11701  tempArray[(BYTE)Index++] = '.';
11702  for (Index2 = 0; (Index2 < DIR_EXTENSION) && (entry->DIR_Extension[(BYTE)Index2] != 0x20); Index2++)
11703  {
11704  tempArray[(BYTE)Index++] = entry->DIR_Extension[(BYTE)Index2];
11705  }
11706  }
11707  tempArray[(BYTE)Index] = 0;
11708  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11709  utfModeFileName = 0;
11710  #endif
11711  Index = FSchdir(&tempArray[0]);
11712  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11713  utfModeFileName = prevUtfModeFileName;
11714  #endif
11715  }
11716 
11717  // Change to the subdirectory
11718  if (Index)
11719  {
11720  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11721  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
11722  return -1;
11723  }
11724  else
11725  {
11726  // Make sure we're not trying to delete the CWD
11727  if (cwdptr->dirclus == tempCWD->dirclus)
11728  {
11729  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11730  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
11731  return -1;
11732  }
11733  }
11734  handle = 2;
11735  recache = TRUE;
11736  }
11737  else
11738  {
11739  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11740  if(!tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength)
11741  #endif
11742  {
11743  for (Index = 0; Index < 8; Index++)
11744  {
11745  fo->name[(BYTE)Index] = entry->DIR_Name[(BYTE)Index];
11746  }
11747 
11748  for (Index = 0; Index < 3; Index++)
11749  {
11750  fo->name[(BYTE)Index + 8] = entry->DIR_Extension[(BYTE)Index];
11751  }
11752  }
11753 
11754  fo->dsk = &gDiskData;
11755 
11756  fo->entry = handle;
11757  fo->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
11758  fo->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
11759  fo->cluster = 0;
11760  fo->ccls = 0;
11761 
11762  if (FILEerase(fo, &handle, TRUE))
11763  {
11764  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11765  tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11766  fo-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11767  #endif
11768  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11769  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
11770  return -1;
11771  }
11772  else
11773  {
11774  handle++;
11775  }
11776  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11777  tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11778  fo-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11779  #endif
11780  } // Check to see if it's a DIR entry
11781  }// Check non-dir entry to see if its a valid file
11782  else
11783  {
11784  handle++;
11785  }
11786 
11787  if (recache)
11788  {
11789  recache = FALSE;
11790  cwdptr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirclus;
11791  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, TRUE);
11792  }
11793  else
11794  {
11795  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, FALSE);
11796  }
11797 
11798  if (entry == NULL)
11799  {
11800  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11801  tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11802  fo-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11803  #endif
11804  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11805  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11806  return -1;
11807  }
11808  }
11809  else
11810  {
11811  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11812  tempCWD-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11813  fo-> utf16LFNlength = 0;
11814  #endif
11815 
11816  // We have reached the end of the directory
11817  if (subDirDepth != 0)
11818  {
11819  handle2 = 0;
11820 
11821  cwdptr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirclus;
11822  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle2, TRUE);
11823  if (entry == NULL)
11824  {
11825  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11826  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11827  return -1;
11828  }
11829 
11830  // Get the cluster
11831  handle2 = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number.
11832 
11833 #ifndef __18CXX
11834  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11835  if(utfModeFileName)
11836 
11837  Index3 = FSchdir (".\0.\0\0");
11838 
11839  else
11840 
11841  #endif
11842  Index3 = FSchdir ("..");
11843 
11844 #else
11845  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
11846  if(utfModeFileName)
11847 
11848  Index3 = FSchdir (dotdotname1);
11849 
11850  else
11851 
11852  #endif
11853  Index3 = FSchdir (dotdotname);
11854 
11855 #endif
11856  if(Index3)
11857  {
11858  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11859  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
11860  return -1;
11861  }
11862  // Return to our previous position in this directory
11863  handle = 2;
11864  cwdptr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirclus;
11865  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, TRUE);
11866  if (entry == NULL)
11867  {
11868  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11869  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11870  return -1;
11871  }
11872 
11873  // Get the cluster
11874  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number.
11875 
11876  while ((TempClusterCalc != handle2) ||
11877  ((TempClusterCalc == handle2) &&
11878  (((unsigned char)entry->DIR_Name[0] == 0xE5) || (entry->DIR_Attr == ATTR_VOLUME))))
11879  {
11880  handle++;
11881  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, FALSE);
11882  if (entry == NULL)
11883  {
11884  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11885  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11886  return -1;
11887  }
11888  // Get the cluster
11889  TempClusterCalc = GetFullClusterNumber(entry); // Get complete cluster number in a loop.
11890  }
11891 
11892  Index3 = 0;
11893  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11894  FileObjectCopy (&cwdTemp, cwdptr);
11895  prevHandle = handle - 1;
11896  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &prevHandle, FALSE);
11897 
11898 
11899  while((lfno->LFN_Attribute == ATTR_LONG_NAME) && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_DEL)
11900  && (lfno->LFN_SequenceNo != DIR_EMPTY))
11901  {
11902  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[0];
11903  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[1];
11904  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11905  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[2];
11906  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[3];
11907  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11908  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[4];
11909  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[5];
11910  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11911  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[6];
11912  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[7];
11913  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11914  tempShift.byte.LB = lfno->LFN_Part1[8];
11915  tempShift.byte.HB = lfno->LFN_Part1[9];
11916  tempLFN[Index3++] = tempShift.Val;
11917 
11918  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[0];
11919  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[1];
11920  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[2];
11921  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[3];
11922  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[4];
11923  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part2[5];
11924 
11925  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[0];
11926  tempLFN[Index3++] = lfno->LFN_Part3[1];
11927 
11928  prevHandle = prevHandle - 1;
11929  lfno = (LFN_ENTRY *)Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &prevHandle, FALSE);
11930  }
11931 
11932  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, &cwdTemp);
11933 
11934  #endif
11935 
11936  if(Index3 == 0)
11937  {
11938  memset (tempArray, 0x00, 12);
11939  for (Index = 0; Index < 8; Index++)
11940  {
11941  tempArray[(BYTE)Index] = entry->DIR_Name[(BYTE)Index];
11942  }
11943  for (Index = 0; Index < 3; Index++)
11944  {
11945  tempArray[(BYTE)Index + 8] = entry->DIR_Extension[(BYTE)Index];
11946  }
11947  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11948  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = 0;
11949  #endif
11950  }
11951  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
11952  else
11953  {
11954  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = Index3;
11955 
11956  for(Index = 12;Index >= 0;Index--)
11957  {
11958  if((tempLFN[Index3 - Index - 1]) == 0x0000)
11959  {
11960  cwdptr->utf16LFNlength = Index3 - Index - 1;
11961  break;
11962  }
11963  }
11964 
11965  cwdptr->utf16LFNptr = (unsigned short int *)&tempArray[0];
11966  }
11967  #endif
11968  // Erase the directory that we just cleared the subdirectories out of
11969 
11970  if (eraseDir (&tempArray[0]))
11971  {
11972  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11973  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
11974  return -1;
11975  }
11976  else
11977  {
11978  handle++;
11979  cwdptr->dirccls = cwdptr->dirclus;
11980  entry = Cache_File_Entry (cwdptr, &handle, TRUE);
11981  if (entry == NULL)
11982  {
11983  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
11984  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
11985  return -1;
11986  }
11987  }
11988 
11989  // Decrease the subdirectory depth
11990  subDirDepth--;
11991  }
11992  else
11993  {
11994  dirCleared = TRUE;
11995  } // Check subdirectory depth
11996  } // Check until we get an empty entry
11997  } // Loop until the whole dir is cleared
11998  }
11999 
12000  // Cache the current directory name
12001  // tempArray is used so we don't disturb the
12002  // global getcwd buffer
12003  if (FSgetcwd (&tempArray[0], 2) == NULL)
12004  {
12005  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
12006  return -1;
12007  }
12008  else
12009  {
12010  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12011  if(!cwdptr->utf16LFNlength)
12012  #endif
12013  {
12014  memset (tempArray, 0x00, 12);
12015  for (Index = 0; Index < 11; Index++)
12016  {
12017  tempArray[(BYTE)Index] = cwdptr->name[(BYTE)Index];
12018  }
12019  }
12020  }
12021 
12022  // If we're here, this directory is empty
12023 #ifndef __18CXX
12024  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12025  if(utfModeFileName)
12026 
12027  Index3 = FSchdir (".\0.\0\0");
12028 
12029  else
12030 
12031  #endif
12032  Index3 = FSchdir ("..");
12033 
12034 #else
12035  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12036  if(utfModeFileName)
12037 
12038  Index3 = FSchdir (dotdotname1);
12039 
12040  else
12041 
12042  #endif
12043  Index3 = FSchdir (dotdotname);
12044 
12045 #endif
12046  if(Index3)
12047  {
12048  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
12049  FSerrno = CE_DIR_NOT_FOUND;
12050  return -1;
12051  }
12052 
12053  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12054  if(cwdptr->utf16LFNlength)
12055  {
12056  Index3 = eraseDir((char *)cwdptr->utf16LFNptr);
12057  }
12058  else
12059  #endif
12060  {
12061  Index3 = eraseDir(tempArray);
12062  }
12063 
12064  if (Index3)
12065  {
12066  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
12067  FSerrno = CE_ERASE_FAIL;
12068  return -1;
12069  }
12070  else
12071  {
12072  FileObjectCopy (cwdptr, tempCWD);
12073  return 0;
12074  }
12075 }
12076 
12077 
12078 /****************************************************************
12079  Function:
12080  int eraseDir (char * path)
12081  Summary:
12082  FSrmdir helper function to erase dirs
12083  Conditions:
12084  This function should not be called by the user.
12085  Input:
12086  path - The name of the directory to delete
12087  Return Values:
12088  0 - Dir was deleted successfully
12089  -1 - Dir could not be deleted.
12090  Side Effects:
12091  None
12092  Description:
12093  The eraseDir function is a helper function for the rmdirhelper
12094  function. The eraseDir function will search for the
12095  directory that matches the specified path name and then erase
12096  it with the FILEerase function.
12097  Remarks:
12098  None.
12099  *****************************************************************/
12100 
12101 int eraseDir (char * path)
12102 {
12103  int result;
12104  BYTE Index;
12105  FSFILE tempCWDobj2;
12106 
12107  if (MDD_WriteProtectState())
12108  {
12109  return (-1);
12110  }
12111 
12112  // preserve CWD
12113  FileObjectCopy(&tempCWDobj2, cwdptr);
12114 
12115  // If long file name not present, copy the 8.3 name in cwdptr
12116  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12117  if(!cwdptr->utf16LFNlength)
12118  #endif
12119  {
12120  for (Index = 0; Index <11; Index++)
12121  {
12122  cwdptr->name[Index] = *(path + Index);
12123  }
12124  }
12125 
12126  // copy file object over
12127  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, cwdptr);
12128 
12129  // See if the file is found
12130  if(FILEfind (cwdptr, &gFileTemp, LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 0) == CE_GOOD)
12131  {
12132  if(FILEerase(cwdptr, &cwdptr->entry, TRUE) == CE_GOOD)
12133  result = 0;
12134  else
12135  result = -1;
12136  }
12137  else
12138  result = -1;
12139 
12140  FileObjectCopy(cwdptr, &tempCWDobj2);
12141  return(result);
12142 }
12143 #endif
12144 
12145 
12146 #endif
12147 
12148 
12149 #ifdef ALLOW_FILESEARCH
12150 
12151 
12152 /***********************************************************************************
12153  Function:
12154  int FindFirst (const char * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
12155  Summary:
12156  Initial search function for the input Ascii fileName on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices.
12157  Conditions:
12158  None
12159  Input:
12160  fileName - The name to search for
12161  - Parital string search characters
12162  - * - Indicates the rest of the filename or extension can vary (e.g. FILE.*)
12163  - ? - Indicates that one character in a filename can vary (e.g. F?LE.T?T)
12164  attr - The attributes that a found file may have
12165  - ATTR_READ_ONLY - File may be read only
12166  - ATTR_HIDDEN - File may be a hidden file
12167  - ATTR_SYSTEM - File may be a system file
12168  - ATTR_VOLUME - Entry may be a volume label
12169  - ATTR_DIRECTORY - File may be a directory
12170  - ATTR_ARCHIVE - File may have archive attribute
12171  - ATTR_MASK - All attributes
12172  rec - pointer to a structure to put the file information in
12173  Return Values:
12174  0 - File was found
12175  -1 - No file matching the specified criteria was found
12176  Side Effects:
12177  Search criteria from previous FindFirst call on passed SearchRec object
12178  will be lost. "utf16LFNfound" is overwritten after subsequent FindFirst/FindNext
12179  operations.It is the responsibility of the application to read the "utf16LFNfound"
12180  before it is lost.The FSerrno variable will be changed.
12181  Description:
12182  Initial search function for the input Ascii fileName on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices.
12183  The FindFirst function will search for a file based on parameters passed in
12184  by the user. This function will use the FILEfind function to parse through
12185  the current working directory searching for entries that match the specified
12186  parameters. If a file is found, its parameters are copied into the SearchRec
12187  structure, as are the initial parameters passed in by the user and the position
12188  of the file entry in the current working directory.If the return value of the
12189  function is 0 then "utf16LFNfoundLength" indicates whether the file found was
12190  long file name or short file name(8P3 format). The "utf16LFNfoundLength" is non-zero
12191  for long file name and is zero for 8P3 format."utf16LFNfound" points to the
12192  address of long file name if found during the operation.
12193  Remarks:
12194  Call FindFirst or FindFirstpgm before calling FindNext
12195  ***********************************************************************************/
12196 
12197 int FindFirst (const char * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
12198 {
12199  FSFILE f;
12200  FILEOBJ fo = &f;
12201  WORD fHandle;
12202  BYTE j;
12203  BYTE Index;
12204  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12205  short int indexLFN;
12206  #endif
12207 
12208  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
12209 
12210  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12211  fo->utf16LFNptr = &recordSearchName[0];
12212  rec->utf16LFNfound = &recordFoundName[0];
12213  #endif
12214 
12215  // Format the file name as per 8.3 format or LFN format
12216  if( !FormatFileName(fileName, fo, 1) )
12217  {
12218  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
12219  return -1;
12220  }
12221 
12222  rec->initialized = FALSE;
12223 
12224  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12225  rec->AsciiEncodingType = fo->AsciiEncodingType;
12226  recordSearchLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
12227 
12228  // If file name is 8.3 format copy it in 'searchname' string
12229  if(!recordSearchLength)
12230  #endif
12231  {
12232  for (Index = 0; (Index < 12) && (fileName[Index] != 0); Index++)
12233  {
12234  rec->searchname[Index] = fileName[Index];
12235  }
12236 
12237  for (;Index < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3 + 2; Index++)
12238  {
12239  rec->searchname[Index] = 0;
12240  }
12241  }
12242 
12243  rec->searchattr = attr;
12244 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
12245  rec->cwdclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
12246 #else
12247  rec->cwdclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
12248 #endif
12249 
12250  fo->dsk = &gDiskData;
12251  fo->cluster = 0;
12252  fo->ccls = 0;
12253  fo->entry = 0;
12254  fo->attributes = attr;
12255 
12256 #ifndef ALLOW_DIRS
12257  // start at the root directory
12258  fo->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
12259  fo->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
12260 #else
12261  fo->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
12262  fo->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
12263 #endif
12264 
12265  // copy file object over
12266  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, fo);
12267 
12268  // See if the file is found
12269  if (FILEfind (fo, &gFileTemp,LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 1) != CE_GOOD)
12270  {
12271  FSerrno = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
12272  return -1;
12273  }
12274 
12275  fHandle = fo->entry;
12276 
12277  if (FILEopen (fo, &fHandle, 'r') == CE_GOOD)
12278  {
12279  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12280  rec->utf16LFNfoundLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
12281  if(fo->utf16LFNlength)
12282  {
12283  indexLFN = fo->utf16LFNlength;
12284  recordFoundName[indexLFN] = 0x0000;
12285  while(indexLFN--)
12286  recordFoundName[indexLFN] = fileFoundString[indexLFN];
12287  }
12288  #endif
12289 
12290  for(j = 0; j < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3 + 2 ; j++)
12291  {
12292  rec->filename[j] = 0;
12293  }
12294 
12295  // Copy as much name as there is
12296  if (fo->attributes != ATTR_VOLUME)
12297  {
12298  for (Index = 0, j = 0; (j < 8) && (fo->name[j] != 0x20); Index++, j++)
12299  {
12300  rec->filename[Index] = fo->name[j];
12301  }
12302 
12303  if(fo->name[8] != 0x20)
12304  {
12305  rec->filename[Index++] = '.';
12306 
12307  // Move to the extension, even if there are more space chars
12308  for (j = 8; (j < 11) && (fo->name[j] != 0x20); Index++, j++)
12309  {
12310  rec->filename[Index] = fo->name[j];
12311  }
12312  }
12313  }
12314  else
12315  {
12316  for (Index = 0; Index < DIR_NAMECOMP; Index++)
12317  {
12318  rec->filename[Index] = fo->name[Index];
12319  }
12320  }
12321 
12322  rec->attributes = fo->attributes;
12323  rec->filesize = fo->size;
12324  rec->timestamp = (DWORD)((DWORD)fo->date << 16) + fo->time;
12325  rec->entry = fo->entry;
12326  rec->initialized = TRUE;
12327  return 0;
12328  }
12329  else
12330  {
12331  FSerrno = CE_BADCACHEREAD;
12332  return -1;
12333  }
12334 }
12335 
12336 
12337 /**********************************************************************
12338  Function:
12339  int FindNext (SearchRec * rec)
12340  Summary:
12341  Sequential search function
12342  Conditions:
12343  None
12344  Input:
12345  rec - The structure to store the file information in
12346  Return Values:
12347  0 - File was found
12348  -1 - No additional files matching the specified criteria were found
12349  Side Effects:
12350  Search criteria from previous FindNext call on passed SearchRec object
12351  will be lost. "utf16LFNfound" is overwritten after subsequent FindFirst/FindNext
12352  operations.It is the responsibility of the application to read the "utf16LFNfound"
12353  before it is lost.The FSerrno variable will be changed.
12354  Description:
12355  The FindNext function performs the same function as the FindFirst
12356  funciton, except it does not copy any search parameters into the
12357  SearchRec structure (only info about found files) and it begins
12358  searching at the last directory entry offset at which a file was
12359  found, rather than at the beginning of the current working
12360  directory.If the return value of the function is 0 then "utf16LFNfoundLength"
12361  indicates whether the file found was long file name or short file
12362  name(8P3 format). The "utf16LFNfoundLength" is non-zero for long file name
12363  and is zero for 8P3 format."utf16LFNfound" points to the address of long
12364  file name if found during the operation.
12365  Remarks:
12366  Call FindFirst or FindFirstpgm before calling this function
12367  **********************************************************************/
12368 
12369 int FindNext (SearchRec * rec)
12370 {
12371  FSFILE f;
12372  FILEOBJ fo = &f;
12373  BYTE i, j;
12374  #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12375  short int indexLFN;
12376  #endif
12377 
12378  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
12379 
12380  // Make sure we called FindFirst on this object
12381  if (rec->initialized == FALSE)
12382  {
12383  FSerrno = CE_NOT_INIT;
12384  return -1;
12385  }
12386 
12387  // Make sure we called FindFirst in the cwd
12388 #ifdef ALLOW_DIRS
12389  if (rec->cwdclus != cwdptr->dirclus)
12390  {
12391  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12392  return -1;
12393  }
12394 #endif
12395 
12396  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12397  fo->AsciiEncodingType = rec->AsciiEncodingType;
12398  fo->utf16LFNlength = recordSearchLength;
12399  if(fo->utf16LFNlength)
12400  {
12401  fo->utf16LFNptr = &recordSearchName[0];
12402  }
12403  else
12404  #endif
12405  {
12406  // Format the file name
12407  if( !FormatFileName(rec->searchname, fo, 1) )
12408  {
12409  FSerrno = CE_INVALID_FILENAME;
12410  return -1;
12411  }
12412  }
12413 
12414  /* Brn: Copy the formatted name to "fo" which is necesary before calling "FILEfind" function */
12415  //strcpy(fo->name,rec->searchname);
12416 
12417  fo->dsk = &gDiskData;
12418  fo->cluster = 0;
12419  fo->ccls = 0;
12420  fo->entry = rec->entry + 1;
12421  fo->attributes = rec->searchattr;
12422 
12423 #ifndef ALLOW_DIRS
12424  // start at the root directory
12425  fo->dirclus = FatRootDirClusterValue;
12426  fo->dirccls = FatRootDirClusterValue;
12427 #else
12428  fo->dirclus = cwdptr->dirclus;
12429  fo->dirccls = cwdptr->dirccls;
12430 #endif
12431 
12432  // copy file object over
12433  FileObjectCopy(&gFileTemp, fo);
12434 
12435  // See if the file is found
12436  if (CE_GOOD != FILEfind (fo, &gFileTemp,LOOK_FOR_MATCHING_ENTRY, 1))
12437  {
12438  FSerrno = CE_FILE_NOT_FOUND;
12439  return -1;
12440  }
12441  else
12442  {
12443  #if defined(SUPPORT_LFN)
12444  rec->utf16LFNfoundLength = fo->utf16LFNlength;
12445  if(fo->utf16LFNlength)
12446  {
12447  indexLFN = fo->utf16LFNlength;
12448  recordFoundName[indexLFN] = 0x0000;
12449  while(indexLFN--)
12450  recordFoundName[indexLFN] = fileFoundString[indexLFN];
12451  }
12452  #endif
12453 
12454  for(j = 0; j < FILE_NAME_SIZE_8P3 + 2 ; j++)
12455  {
12456  rec->filename[j] = 0;
12457  }
12458 
12459  if (fo->attributes != ATTR_VOLUME)
12460  {
12461  for (i = 0, j = 0; (j < 8) && (fo->name[j] != 0x20); i++, j++)
12462  {
12463  rec->filename[i] = fo->name[j];
12464  }
12465 
12466  if(fo->name[8] != 0x20)
12467  {
12468  rec->filename[i++] = '.';
12469 
12470  // Move to the extension, even if there are more space chars
12471  for (j = 8; (j < 11) && (fo->name[j] != 0x20); i++, j++)
12472  {
12473  rec->filename[i] = fo->name[j];
12474  }
12475  }
12476  }
12477  else
12478  {
12479  for (i = 0; i < DIR_NAMECOMP; i++)
12480  {
12481  rec->filename[i] = fo->name[i];
12482  }
12483  }
12484 
12485  rec->attributes = fo->attributes;
12486  rec->filesize = fo->size;
12487  rec->timestamp = (DWORD)((DWORD)fo->date << 16) + fo->time;
12488  rec->entry = fo->entry;
12489  return 0;
12490  }
12491 }
12492 
12493 /***********************************************************************************
12494  Function:
12495  int wFindFirst (const unsigned short int * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
12496  Summary:
12497  Initial search function for the 'fileName' in UTF16 format on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices.
12498  Conditions:
12499  None
12500  Input:
12501  fileName - The name to search for
12502  - Parital string search characters
12503  - * - Indicates the rest of the filename or extension can vary (e.g. FILE.*)
12504  - ? - Indicates that one character in a filename can vary (e.g. F?LE.T?T)
12505  attr - The attributes that a found file may have
12506  - ATTR_READ_ONLY - File may be read only
12507  - ATTR_HIDDEN - File may be a hidden file
12508  - ATTR_SYSTEM - File may be a system file
12509  - ATTR_VOLUME - Entry may be a volume label
12510  - ATTR_DIRECTORY - File may be a directory
12511  - ATTR_ARCHIVE - File may have archive attribute
12512  - ATTR_MASK - All attributes
12513  rec - pointer to a structure to put the file information in
12514  Return Values:
12515  0 - File was found
12516  -1 - No file matching the specified criteria was found
12517  Side Effects:
12518  Search criteria from previous wFindFirst call on passed SearchRec object
12519  will be lost. "utf16LFNfound" is overwritten after subsequent wFindFirst/FindNext
12520  operations.It is the responsibility of the application to read the "utf16LFNfound"
12521  before it is lost.The FSerrno variable will be changed.
12522  Description:
12523  Initial search function for the 'fileName' in UTF16 format on PIC24/PIC32/dsPIC devices.
12524  The wFindFirst function will search for a file based on parameters passed in
12525  by the user. This function will use the FILEfind function to parse through
12526  the current working directory searching for entries that match the specified
12527  parameters. If a file is found, its parameters are copied into the SearchRec
12528  structure, as are the initial parameters passed in by the user and the position
12529  of the file entry in the current working directory.If the return value of the
12530  function is 0 then "utf16LFNfoundLength" indicates whether the file found was
12531  long file name or short file name(8P3 format). The "utf16LFNfoundLength" is non-zero
12532  for long file name and is zero for 8P3 format."utf16LFNfound" points to the
12533  address of long file name if found during the operation.
12534  Remarks:
12535  Call FindFirst or FindFirstpgm before calling FindNext
12536  ***********************************************************************************/
12537 
12538 #ifdef SUPPORT_LFN
12539 int wFindFirst (const unsigned short int * fileName, unsigned int attr, SearchRec * rec)
12540 {
12541  int result;
12542  utfModeFileName = TRUE;
12543  result = FindFirst ((const char *)fileName,attr,rec);
12544  utfModeFileName = FALSE;
12545  return result;
12546 }
12547 #endif
12548 
12549 #endif
12550 
12551 #ifdef ALLOW_FSFPRINTF
12552 
12553 
12554 /**********************************************************************
12555  Function:
12556  int FSputc (char c, FSFILE * file)
12557  Summary:
12558  FSfprintf helper function to write a char
12559  Conditions:
12560  This function should not be called by the user.
12561  Input:
12562  c - The character to write to the file.
12563  file - The file to write to.
12564  Return Values:
12565  0 - The character was written successfully
12566  EOF - The character was not written to the file.
12567  Side Effects:
12568  None
12569  Description:
12570  This is a helper function for FSfprintf. It will write one
12571  character to a file.
12572  Remarks:
12573  None
12574  **********************************************************************/
12575 
12576 int FSputc (char c, FSFILE * file)
12577 {
12578  if (FSfwrite ((void *)&c, 1, 1, file) != 1)
12579  return EOF;
12580  else
12581  return 0;
12582 }
12583 
12584 
12585 /**********************************************************************
12586  Function:
12587  int str_put_n_chars (FSFILE * handle, unsigned char n, char c)
12588  Summary:
12589  FSfprintf helper function to write a char multiple times
12590  Conditions:
12591  This function should not be called by the user.
12592  Input:
12593  handle - The file to write to.
12594  n - The number of times to write that character to a file.
12595  c - The character to write to the file.
12596  Return Values:
12597  0 - The characters were written successfully
12598  EOF - The characters were not written to the file.
12599  Side Effects:
12600  None
12601  Description:
12602  This funciton is used by the FSfprintf function to write multiple
12603  instances of a single character to a file (for example, when
12604  padding a format specifier with leading spacez or zeros).
12605  Remarks:
12606  None.
12607  **********************************************************************/
12608 
12609 
12610 unsigned char str_put_n_chars (FSFILE * handle, unsigned char n, char c)
12611 {
12612  while (n--)
12613  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
12614  return 1;
12615  return 0;
12616 }
12617 
12618 
12619 /**********************************************************************
12620  Function:
12621  // PIC24/30/33/32
12622  int FSfprintf (FSFILE * fptr, const char * fmt, ...)
12623  // PIC18
12624  int FSfpritnf (FSFILE * fptr, const rom char * fmt, ...)
12625  Summary:
12626  Function to write formatted strings to a file
12627  Conditions:
12628  For PIC18, integer promotion must be enabled in the project build
12629  options menu. File opened in a write mode.
12630  Input:
12631  fptr - A pointer to the file to write to.
12632  fmt - A string of characters and format specifiers to write to
12633  the file
12634  ... - Additional arguments inserted in the string by format
12635  specifiers
12636  Returns:
12637  The number of characters written to the file
12638  Side Effects:
12639  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
12640  Description:
12641  Writes a specially formatted string to a file.
12642  Remarks:
12643  Consult AN1045 for a full description of how to use format
12644  specifiers.
12645  **********************************************************************/
12646 
12647 #ifdef __18CXX
12648 int FSfprintf (FSFILE *fptr, const rom char *fmt, ...)
12649 #else
12650 int FSfprintf (FSFILE *fptr, const char * fmt, ...)
12651 #endif
12652 {
12653  va_list ap;
12654  int n;
12655 
12656  va_start (ap, fmt);
12657  n = FSvfprintf (fptr, fmt, ap);
12658  va_end (ap);
12659  return n;
12660 }
12661 
12662 
12663 /**********************************************************************
12664  Function:
12665  // PIC24/30/33/32
12666  int FSvfprintf (FSFILE * handle, const char * formatString, va_list ap)
12667  // PIC18
12668  int FSvfpritnf (auto FSFILE * handle, auto const rom char * formatString, auto va_list ap)
12669  Summary:
12670  Helper function for FSfprintf
12671  Conditions:
12672  This function should not be called by the user.
12673  Input:
12674  handle - A pointer to the file to write to.
12675  formatString - A string of characters and format specifiers to write to
12676  the file
12677  ap - A structure pointing to the arguments on the stack
12678  Returns:
12679  The number of characters written to the file
12680  Side Effects:
12681  The FSerrno variable will be changed.
12682  Description:
12683  This helper function will access the elements passed to FSfprintf
12684  Remarks:
12685  Consult AN1045 for a full description of how to use format
12686  specifiers.
12687  **********************************************************************/
12688 
12689 #ifdef __18CXX
12690 int FSvfprintf (auto FSFILE *handle, auto const rom char * formatString, auto va_list ap)
12691 #else
12692 int FSvfprintf (FSFILE *handle, const char * formatString, va_list ap)
12693 #endif
12694 {
12695  unsigned char c;
12696  int count = 0;
12697 
12698  for (c = *formatString; c; c = *++formatString)
12699  {
12700  if (c == '%')
12701  {
12702  unsigned char flags = 0;
12703  unsigned char width = 0;
12704  unsigned char precision = 0;
12705  unsigned char have_precision = 0;
12706  unsigned char size = 0;
12707 #ifndef __18CXX
12708  unsigned char size2 = 0;
12709 #endif
12710  unsigned char space_cnt;
12711  unsigned char cval;
12712 #ifdef __18CXX
12713  unsigned long larg;
12714  far rom char * romstring;
12715 #else
12716  unsigned long long larg;
12717 #endif
12718  char * ramstring;
12719  int n;
12720 
12721  FSerrno = CE_GOOD;
12722 
12723  c = *++formatString;
12724 
12725  while ((c == '-') || (c == '+') || (c == ' ') || (c == '#') || (c == '0'))
12726  {
12727  switch (c)
12728  {
12729  case '-':
12730  flags |= _FLAG_MINUS;
12731  break;
12732  case '+':
12733  flags |= _FLAG_PLUS;
12734  break;
12735  case ' ':
12736  flags |= _FLAG_SPACE;
12737  break;
12738  case '#':
12739  flags |= _FLAG_OCTO;
12740  break;
12741  case '0':
12742  flags |= _FLAG_ZERO;
12743  break;
12744  }
12745  c = *++formatString;
12746  }
12747  /* the optional width field is next */
12748  if (c == '*')
12749  {
12750  n = va_arg (ap, int);
12751  if (n < 0)
12752  {
12753  flags |= _FLAG_MINUS;
12754  width = -n;
12755  }
12756  else
12757  width = n;
12758  c = *++formatString;
12759  }
12760  else
12761  {
12762  cval = 0;
12763  while ((unsigned char) isdigit (c))
12764  {
12765  cval = cval * 10 + c - '0';
12766  c = *++formatString;
12767  }
12768  width = cval;
12769  }
12770 
12771  /* if '-' is specified, '0' is ignored */
12772  if (flags & _FLAG_MINUS)
12773  flags &= ~_FLAG_ZERO;
12774 
12775  /* the optional precision field is next */
12776  if (c == '.')
12777  {
12778  c = *++formatString;
12779  if (c == '*')
12780  {
12781  n = va_arg (ap, int);
12782  if (n >= 0)
12783  {
12784  precision = n;
12785  have_precision = 1;
12786  }
12787  c = *++formatString;
12788  }
12789  else
12790  {
12791  cval = 0;
12792  while ((unsigned char) isdigit (c))
12793  {
12794  cval = cval * 10 + c - '0';
12795  c = *++formatString;
12796  }
12797  precision = cval;
12798  have_precision = 1;
12799  }
12800  }
12801 
12802  /* the optional 'h' specifier. since int and short int are
12803  the same size for MPLAB C18, this is a NOP for us. */
12804  if (c == 'h')
12805  {
12806  c = *++formatString;
12807  /* if 'c' is another 'h' character, this is an 'hh'
12808  specifier and the size is 8 bits */
12809  if (c == 'h')
12810  {
12811  size = _FMT_BYTE;
12812  c = *++formatString;
12813  }
12814  }
12815  else if ((c == 't') || (c == 'z'))
12816  c = *++formatString;
12817 #ifdef __18CXX
12818  else if ((c == 'H') || (c == 'T') || (c == 'Z'))
12819  {
12820  size = _FMT_SHRTLONG;
12821  c = *++formatString;
12822  }
12823  else if ((c == 'l') || (c == 'j'))
12824 #else
12825  else if ((c == 'q') || (c == 'j'))
12826  {
12827  size = _FMT_LONGLONG;
12828  c = *++formatString;
12829  }
12830  else if (c == 'l')
12831 #endif
12832  {
12833  size = _FMT_LONG;
12834  c = *++formatString;
12835  }
12836 
12837  switch (c)
12838  {
12839  case '\0':
12840  /* this is undefined behaviour. we have a trailing '%' character
12841  in the string, perhaps with some flags, width, precision
12842  stuff as well, but no format specifier. We'll, arbitrarily,
12843  back up a character so that the loop will terminate
12844  properly when it loops back and we'll output a '%'
12845  character. */
12846  --formatString;
12847  /* fallthrough */
12848  case '%':
12849  if (FSputc ('%', handle) == EOF)
12850  {
12851  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12852  return EOF;
12853  }
12854  ++count;
12855  break;
12856  case 'c':
12857  space_cnt = 0;
12858  if (width > 1)
12859  {
12860  space_cnt = width - 1;
12861  count += space_cnt;
12862  }
12863  if (space_cnt && !(flags & _FLAG_MINUS))
12864  {
12865  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12866  {
12867  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12868  return EOF;
12869  }
12870  space_cnt = 0;
12871  }
12872  c = va_arg (ap, int);
12873  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
12874  {
12875  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12876  return EOF;
12877  }
12878  ++count;
12879  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12880  {
12881  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12882  return EOF;
12883  }
12884  break;
12885  case 'S':
12886 #ifdef __18CXX
12887  if (size == _FMT_SHRTLONG)
12888  romstring = va_arg (ap, rom far char *);
12889  else
12890  romstring = (far rom char*)va_arg (ap, rom near char *);
12891  n = strlenpgm (romstring);
12892  /* Normalize the width based on the length of the actual
12893  string and the precision. */
12894  if (have_precision && precision < (unsigned char) n)
12895  n = precision;
12896  if (width < (unsigned char) n)
12897  width = n;
12898  space_cnt = width - (unsigned char) n;
12899  count += space_cnt;
12900  /* we've already calculated the space count that the width
12901  will require. now we want the width field to have the
12902  number of character to display from the string itself,
12903  limited by the length of the actual string and the
12904  specified precision. */
12905  if (have_precision && precision < width)
12906  width = precision;
12907  /* if right justified, we print the spaces before the
12908  string */
12909  if (!(flags & _FLAG_MINUS))
12910  {
12911  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12912  {
12913  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12914  return EOF;
12915  }
12916  space_cnt = 0;
12917  }
12918  cval = 0;
12919  for (c = *romstring; c && cval < width; c = *++romstring)
12920  {
12921  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
12922  {
12923  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12924  return EOF;
12925  }
12926  ++count;
12927  ++cval;
12928  }
12929  /* If there are spaces left, it's left justified.
12930  Either way, calling the function unconditionally
12931  is smaller code. */
12932  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12933  {
12934  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12935  return EOF;
12936  }
12937  break;
12938 #endif
12939  case 's':
12940  ramstring = va_arg (ap, char *);
12941  n = strlen (ramstring);
12942  /* Normalize the width based on the length of the actual
12943  string and the precision. */
12944  if (have_precision && precision < (unsigned char) n)
12945  n = precision;
12946  if (width < (unsigned char) n)
12947  width = n;
12948  space_cnt = width - (unsigned char) n;
12949  count += space_cnt;
12950  /* we've already calculated the space count that the width
12951  will require. now we want the width field to have the
12952  number of character to display from the string itself,
12953  limited by the length of the actual string and the
12954  specified precision. */
12955  if (have_precision && precision < width)
12956  width = precision;
12957  /* if right justified, we print the spaces before the string */
12958  if (!(flags & _FLAG_MINUS))
12959  {
12960  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12961  {
12962  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12963  return EOF;
12964  }
12965  space_cnt = 0;
12966  }
12967  cval = 0;
12968  for (c = *ramstring; c && cval < width; c = *++ramstring)
12969  {
12970  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
12971  {
12972  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12973  return EOF;
12974  }
12975  ++count;
12976  ++cval;
12977  }
12978  /* If there are spaces left, it's left justified.
12979  Either way, calling the function unconditionally
12980  is smaller code. */
12981  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
12982  {
12983  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
12984  return EOF;
12985  }
12986  break;
12987  case 'd':
12988  case 'i':
12989  flags |= _FLAG_SIGNED;
12990  /* fall through */
12991  case 'o':
12992  case 'u':
12993  case 'x':
12994  case 'X':
12995  case 'b':
12996  case 'B':
12997  /* This is a bit of a trick. The 'l' and 'hh' size
12998  specifiers are valid only for the integer conversions,
12999  not the 'p' or 'P' conversions, and are ignored for the
13000  latter. By jumping over the additional size specifier
13001  checks here we get the best code size since we can
13002  limit the size checks in the remaining code. */
13003  if (size == _FMT_LONG)
13004  {
13005  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED)
13006  larg = va_arg (ap, long int);
13007  else
13008  larg = va_arg (ap, unsigned long int);
13009  goto _do_integer_conversion;
13010  }
13011  else if (size == _FMT_BYTE)
13012  {
13013  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED)
13014  larg = (signed char) va_arg (ap, int);
13015  else
13016  larg = (unsigned char) va_arg (ap, unsigned int);
13017  goto _do_integer_conversion;
13018  }
13019 #ifndef __18CXX
13020  else if (size == _FMT_LONGLONG)
13021  {
13022  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED)
13023  larg = (signed long long)va_arg (ap, long long);
13024  else
13025  larg = (unsigned long long) va_arg (ap, unsigned long long);
13026  goto _do_integer_conversion;
13027  }
13028 #endif
13029  /* fall trough */
13030  case 'p':
13031  case 'P':
13032 #ifdef __18CXX
13033  if (size == _FMT_SHRTLONG)
13034  {
13035  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED)
13036  larg = va_arg (ap, short long int);
13037  else
13038  larg = va_arg (ap, unsigned short long int);
13039  }
13040  else
13041 #endif
13042  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED)
13043  larg = va_arg (ap, int);
13044  else
13045  larg = va_arg (ap, unsigned int);
13046  _do_integer_conversion:
13047  /* default precision is 1 */
13048  if (!have_precision)
13049  precision = 1;
13050  {
13051  unsigned char digit_cnt = 0;
13052  unsigned char prefix_cnt = 0;
13053  unsigned char sign_char;
13054  /* A 32 bit number will require at most 32 digits in the
13055  string representation (binary format). */
13056 #ifdef __18CXX
13057  char buf[33];
13058  /* Start storing digits least-significant first */
13059  char *q = &buf[31];
13060  /* null terminate the string */
13061  buf[32] = '\0';
13062 #else
13063  char buf[65];
13064  char *q = &buf[63];
13065  buf[64] = '\0';
13066 #endif
13067  space_cnt = 0;
13068  size = 10;
13069 
13070  switch (c)
13071  {
13072  case 'b':
13073  case 'B':
13074  size = 2;
13075 #ifndef __18CXX
13076  size2 = 1;
13077 #endif
13078  break;
13079  case 'o':
13080  size = 8;
13081 #ifndef __18CXX
13082  size2 = 3;
13083 #endif
13084  break;
13085  case 'p':
13086  case 'P':
13087  /* from here on out, treat 'p' conversions just
13088  like 'x' conversions. */
13089  c += 'x' - 'p';
13090  /* fall through */
13091  case 'x':
13092  case 'X':
13093  size = 16;
13094 #ifndef __18CXX
13095  size2 = 4;
13096 #endif
13097  break;
13098  }// switch (c)
13099 
13100  /* if it's an unsigned conversion, we should ignore the
13101  ' ' and '+' flags */
13102  if (!(flags & _FLAG_SIGNED))
13103  flags &= ~(_FLAG_PLUS | _FLAG_SPACE);
13104 
13105  /* if it's a negative value, we need to negate the
13106  unsigned version before we convert to text. Using
13107  unsigned for this allows us to (ab)use the 2's
13108  complement system to avoid overflow and be able to
13109  adequately handle LONG_MIN.
13110 
13111  We'll figure out what sign character to print, if
13112  any, here as well. */
13113 #ifdef __18CXX
13114  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED && ((long) larg < 0))
13115  {
13116  larg = -(long) larg;
13117 #else
13118  if (flags & _FLAG_SIGNED && ((long long) larg < 0))
13119  {
13120  larg = -(long long) larg;
13121 #endif
13122  sign_char = '-';
13123  ++digit_cnt;
13124  }
13125  else if (flags & _FLAG_PLUS)
13126  {
13127  sign_char = '+';
13128  ++digit_cnt;
13129  }
13130  else if (flags & _FLAG_SPACE)
13131  {
13132  sign_char = ' ';
13133  ++digit_cnt;
13134  }
13135  else
13136  sign_char = '\0';
13137  /* get the digits for the actual number. If the
13138  precision is zero and the value is zero, the result
13139  is no characters. */
13140  if (precision || larg)
13141  {
13142  do
13143  {
13144 #ifdef __18CXX
13145  cval = s_digits[larg % size];
13146  if ((c == 'X') && (cval >= 'a'))
13147  cval -= 'a' - 'A';
13148  larg /= size;
13149 #else
13150  // larg is congruent mod size2 to its lower 16 bits
13151  // for size2 = 2^n, 0 <= n <= 4
13152  if (size2 != 0)
13153  cval = s_digits[(unsigned int) larg % size];
13154  else
13155  cval = s_digits[larg % size];
13156  if ((c == 'X') && (cval >= 'a'))
13157  cval -= 'a' - 'A';
13158  if (size2 != 0)
13159  larg = larg >> size2;
13160  else
13161  larg /= size;
13162 #endif
13163  *q-- = cval;
13164  ++digit_cnt;
13165  } while (larg);
13166  /* if the '#' flag was specified and we're dealing
13167  with an 'o', 'b', 'B', 'x', or 'X' conversion,
13168  we need a bit more. */
13169  if (flags & _FLAG_OCTO)
13170  {
13171  if (c == 'o')
13172  {
13173  /* per the standard, for octal, the '#' flag
13174  makes the precision be at least one more
13175  than the number of digits in the number */
13176  if (precision <= digit_cnt)
13177  precision = digit_cnt + 1;
13178  }
13179  else if ((c == 'x') || (c == 'X') || (c == 'b') || (c == 'B'))
13180  prefix_cnt = 2;
13181  }
13182  }
13183  else
13184  digit_cnt = 0;
13185 
13186  /* The leading zero count depends on whether the '0'
13187  flag was specified or not. If it was not, then the
13188  count is the difference between the specified
13189  precision and the number of digits (including the
13190  sign character, if any) to be printed; otherwise,
13191  it's as if the precision were equal to the max of
13192  the specified precision and the field width. If a
13193  precision was specified, the '0' flag is ignored,
13194  however. */
13195  if ((flags & _FLAG_ZERO) && (width > precision)
13196  && !have_precision)
13197  precision = width;
13198  /* for the rest of the processing, precision contains
13199  the leading zero count for the conversion. */
13200  if (precision > digit_cnt)
13201  precision -= digit_cnt;
13202  else
13203  precision = 0;
13204  /* the space count is the difference between the field
13205  width and the digit count plus the leading zero
13206  count. If the width is less than the digit count
13207  plus the leading zero count, the space count is
13208  zero. */
13209  if (width > precision + digit_cnt + prefix_cnt)
13210  space_cnt = width - precision - digit_cnt - prefix_cnt;
13211 
13212  /* for output, we check the justification, if it's
13213  right justified and the space count is positive, we
13214  emit the space characters first. */
13215  if (!(flags & _FLAG_MINUS) && space_cnt)
13216  {
13217  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
13218  {
13219  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13220  return EOF;
13221  }
13222  count += space_cnt;
13223  space_cnt = 0;
13224  }
13225  /* if we have a sign character to print, that comes
13226  next */
13227  if (sign_char)
13228  if (FSputc (sign_char, handle) == EOF)
13229  {
13230  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13231  return EOF;
13232  }
13233  /* if we have a prefix (0b, 0B, 0x or 0X), that's next */
13234  if (prefix_cnt)
13235  {
13236  if (FSputc ('0', handle) == EOF)
13237  {
13238  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13239  return EOF;
13240  }
13241  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
13242  {
13243  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13244  return EOF;
13245  }
13246  }
13247  /* if we have leading zeros, they follow. the prefix, if any
13248  is included in the number of digits when determining how
13249  many leading zeroes are needed. */
13250 // if (precision > prefix_cnt)
13251  // precision -= prefix_cnt;
13252  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, precision, '0'))
13253  {
13254  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13255  return EOF;
13256  }
13257  /* print the actual number */
13258  for (cval = *++q; cval; cval = *++q)
13259  if (FSputc (cval, handle) == EOF)
13260  {
13261  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13262  return EOF;
13263  }
13264  /* if there are any spaces left, they go to right-pad
13265  the field */
13266  if (str_put_n_chars (handle, space_cnt, ' '))
13267  {
13268  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13269  return EOF;
13270  }
13271 
13272  count += precision + digit_cnt + space_cnt + prefix_cnt;
13273  }
13274  break;
13275  case 'n':
13276  switch (size)
13277  {
13278  case _FMT_LONG:
13279  *(long *) va_arg (ap, long *) = count;
13280  break;
13281 #ifdef __18CXX
13282  case _FMT_SHRTLONG:
13283  *(short long *) va_arg (ap, short long *) = count;
13284  break;
13285 #else
13286  case _FMT_LONGLONG:
13287  *(long long *) va_arg (ap, long long *) = count;
13288  break;
13289 #endif
13290  case _FMT_BYTE:
13291  *(signed char *) va_arg (ap, signed char *) = count;
13292  break;
13293  default:
13294  *(int *) va_arg (ap, int *) = count;
13295  break;
13296  }
13297  break;
13298  default:
13299  /* undefined behaviour. we do nothing */
13300  break;
13301  }
13302  }
13303  else
13304  {
13305  if (FSputc (c, handle) == EOF)
13306  {
13307  FSerrno = CE_WRITE_ERROR;
13308  return EOF;
13309  }
13310  ++count;
13311  }
13312  }
13313  return count;
13314 }
13315 
13316 
13317 
13318 #endif
13319 
13320 
13321 
13322 
RAMreadD
#define RAMreadD(a, f)
Definition: FSDefs.h:252
FILEOBJ
FSFILE * FILEOBJ
Definition: FSIO.c:282
gNeedDataWrite
BYTE gNeedDataWrite
Definition: FSIO.c:178
cwd
FSFILE cwd
Definition: FSIO.c:193
MEDIA_INFORMATION::validityFlags
union MEDIA_INFORMATION::@8 validityFlags
BSI_SPF
#define BSI_SPF
Definition: FSDefs.h:424
FS_DISK_PROPERTIES::disk
DISK * disk
Definition: FSIO.h:267
CE_INVALID_FILENAME
Definition: FSDefs.h:62
RAMwrite
#define RAMwrite(a, f, d)
Definition: FSDefs.h:240
CE_DISK_FULL
Definition: FSDefs.h:65
FAT32
#define FAT32
Definition: FSDefs.h:105
LoadMBR
BYTE LoadMBR(DISK *dsk)
Definition: FSIO.c:1631
FS_DISK_PROPERTIES::results
struct FS_DISK_PROPERTIES::@10 results
FILEget_next_cluster
BYTE FILEget_next_cluster(FSFILE *fo, DWORD n)
Definition: FSIO.c:1470
NAME_8P3_UTF16_TYPE
Definition: FSIO.c:270
_BootSec::FAT
union _BootSec::@7 FAT
MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH_LFN
#define MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH_LFN
Definition: FSIO.h:194
LFN_ENTRY::LFN_Type
BYTE LFN_Type
Definition: FSIO.c:256
GenericTypeDefs.h
_BPB_FAT16::BootSec_SPF
WORD BootSec_SPF
Definition: FSDefs.h:351
CE_EOF
#define CE_EOF
Definition: FSIO.c:280
_BPB_FAT32::BootSec_Reserved
BYTE BootSec_Reserved[12]
Definition: FSDefs.h:391
FSfclose
int FSfclose(FSFILE *fo)
Definition: FSIO.c:4496
Cache_File_Entry
DIRENTRY Cache_File_Entry(FILEOBJ fo, WORD *curEntry, BYTE ForceRead)
Definition: FSIO.c:3057
BYTE
unsigned char BYTE
Definition: GenericTypeDefs.h:342
ATTR_VOLUME
#define ATTR_VOLUME
Definition: FSDefs.h:128
Cluster2Sector
DWORD Cluster2Sector(DISK *disk, DWORD cluster)
Definition: FSIO.c:6409
ATTR_MASK
#define ATTR_MASK
Definition: FSDefs.h:150
DISK::maxcls
DWORD maxcls
Definition: FSDefs.h:275
FS_DISK_PROPERTIES::curcls
DWORD curcls
Definition: FSIO.h:283
FSInit
int FSInit(void)
Definition: FSIO.c:424
BootSec
_BootSec * BootSec
Definition: FSDefs.h:513
LFN_ENTRY::LFN_Reserved2
unsigned short int LFN_Reserved2
Definition: FSIO.c:259
